examples.sentence: When in doubt, I usually [opt for] what's familiar.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在困惑時，我通常選擇熟悉的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To decide not to participate in something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 決定不參加某事

examples.sentence: You can [opt out] of the mailing list at any time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以隨時選擇退出郵件列表。

examples.sentence: I chose to [opt out] of the survey.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我選擇退出調查。

examples.sentence: She decided to [opt out] of the group project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定不參與小組項目。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To include a lot of activities or information in a limited amount of time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在有限的時間內包含很多活動或信息

examples.sentence: We really [packed in] a lot during our short trip.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在短短的旅行中確實包含了很多活動。

examples.sentence: She tried to [pack in] as many meetings as possible.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她試圖安排盡可能多的會議。

examples.sentence: They [packed in] several workshops during the conference.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在會議期間安排了幾個研討會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To put things into a container or bag for storage or transport.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將物品放入容器或包中以便存儲或運輸

examples.sentence: It's time to [pack up] after the party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 派對結束後，是時候收拾了。

examples.sentence: She needs to [pack up] her belongings before moving.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她需要在搬家前整理好自己的物品。

examples.sentence: They [packed up] the supplies to take to the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們將物資整理好以帶到活動中。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To move past something or someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 經過某物或某人

examples.sentence: We saw them [pass by] the park while walking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在散步時看到他們經過公園。

examples.sentence: They didn't notice us [passing by] the café.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們沒有注意到我們經過咖啡館。

examples.sentence: You can see the river as you [pass by].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你經過時能看到河流。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To refuse or decline something; to transmit information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 拒絕某事或傳遞信息

examples.sentence: He decided to [pass on] the job offer.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定拒絕這個工作機會。

examples.sentence: Please [pass on] my regards to your family.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請代我向你的家人問好。

examples.sentence: She always tries to [pass on] useful tips.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是試圖傳遞有用的建議。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To give money in exchange for something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用金錢交換某物

examples.sentence: I will [pay for] the dinner tonight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 今晚我將支付晚餐的費用。

examples.sentence: She forgot to [pay for] her coffee.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她忘了付咖啡的費用。

examples.sentence: They need to [pay for] their tickets in advance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們需要提前支付票款。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To finish paying a debt or to receive a benefit from an investment.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 還清債務或從投資中獲得利益

examples.sentence: He finally [paid off] his student loans.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他最終還清了學生貸款。

examples.sentence: The investment really [paid off] in the long run.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這項投資在長期內獲得了回報。

examples.sentence: She hopes her hard work will [pay off] soon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她希望自己的努力能儘快有回報。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To distribute or disburse money.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 分配或支付金錢

examples.sentence: The insurance company will [pay out] for the damages.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 保險公司將支付損失的賠償金。

examples.sentence: They plan to [pay out] bonuses at the end of the year.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們計劃在年底發放獎金。

examples.sentence: You can [pay out] compensation for the inconvenience.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 您可以支付因不便而產生的賠償金。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To eat something slowly or in small bites; to annoy or criticize someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 慢慢吃東西或小口吃；煩擾或批評某人

examples.sentence: He tends to [pick at] his food when he's not hungry.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他不餓時，他會慢慢吃東西。

examples.sentence: She [picked at] the leftovers instead of eating a full meal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她只吃了剩菜，而不是吃一頓完整的餐。

examples.sentence: Don't [pick at] him; he's doing his best.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要挑剔他；他已經在努力了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To bully or unfairly criticize someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 欺負或不公平地批評某人

examples.sentence: It's not nice to [pick on] others for their mistakes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為別人的錯誤而挑剔他人並不好。

examples.sentence: He always [picks on] his little brother.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是欺負他的小弟弟。

examples.sentence: Don't [pick on] her; she is trying her best.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要欺負她；她已經在努力了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lift something or someone; to improve or increase.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 拾起某物或某人；改善或增加

examples.sentence: Can you [pick up] that book from the floor?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能從地上撿起那本書嗎？

examples.sentence: Sales have started to [pick up] after the holiday season.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 節假日之後，銷售開始回升。

examples.sentence: We need to [pick up] the pace to finish on time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要加快進度以便按時完成。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To accumulate or stack things together.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將東西累積或堆疊在一起

examples.sentence: The work has started to [pile up] since I've been gone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 自從我離開以來，工作開始累積。

examples.sentence: We need to [pile up] the boxes for the move.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要把箱子堆起來以供搬運。

examples.sentence: She let her laundry [pile up] before doing it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在洗衣之前，她讓衣物積累起來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To suddenly appear or come out; to leave briefly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 突然出現或走出；短暫離開

examples.sentence: He [popped out] to buy some groceries.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他出門買了一些雜貨。

examples.sentence: Suddenly, a rabbit [popped out] from behind the bush.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 突然，一隻兔子從灌木叢後面跳了出來。

examples.sentence: She [popped out] to say hello and then came back.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她出來打招呼，然後又回來了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To arrive at a certain place, often in reference to transportation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 到達某地，通常是指交通工具

examples.sentence: The train will [pull in] at 5 PM.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 火車將於下午5點抵達。

examples.sentence: The bus [pulled in] right on time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 公車準時到達。

examples.sentence: They can [pull in] several passengers at once.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們可以一次接載幾個乘客。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To come to a stop after driving.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 駕駛後停下來

examples.sentence: Please [pull up] to the curb.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請停到路邊。

examples.sentence: He [pulled up] right outside the entrance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他就在入口處停下來。

examples.sentence: The driver [pulled up] and let passengers out.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 駕駛員停下並讓乘客下車。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To continue moving forward or making progress.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 繼續前進或取得進展

examples.sentence: Even though it was tough, they decided to [push on].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管很艱難，他們決定繼續前進。

examples.sentence: Let's [push on] despite the obstacles.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管有困難，我們還是繼續前進吧。

examples.sentence: They have to [push on] to meet the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們必須繼續努力以趕上最後期限。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To delay something or postpone it.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 延遲或推遲某事

examples.sentence: We had to [put off] the meeting until next week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們不得不將會議推遲到下週。

examples.sentence: She decided to [put off] her vacation plans.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定推遲她的度假計劃。

examples.sentence: Don't [put off] your homework; you'll regret it later.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要拖延你的家庭作業；你會為此後悔。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To extinguish a fire or to produce something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 撲滅火源或生產某物

examples.sentence: The firefighters [put out] the blaze quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 消防員迅速撲滅了大火。

examples.sentence: Can you [put out] the candles when you're done?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能在結束時熄滅蠟燭嗎？

examples.sentence: The company is planning to [put out] a new product.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該公司計劃推出一款新產品。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To increase or improve something, usually in preparation for something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 增加或改善某物，通常是為了準備某事

examples.sentence: We need to [ramp up] production for the holiday season.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要增加生產來迎接假日季節。

examples.sentence: The team is planning to [ramp up] their marketing efforts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該團隊計劃加強他們的市場行銷工作。

examples.sentence: They need to [ramp up] training sessions for new hires.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們需要增加新員工的培訓課程。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To depend on someone or something for support or help.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 依賴某人或某事以獲得支持或幫助

examples.sentence: You can always [rely on] your friends in tough times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在艱難時期，你總是可以依賴你的朋友。

examples.sentence: Many people [rely on] technology for their daily tasks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多人依賴科技來完成日常任務。

examples.sentence: We need to [rely on] proven methods for success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要依賴有效的方法來獲得成功。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become higher or to shift upward, commonly in reference to clothing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變高或向上移動，通常是指衣物

examples.sentence: Her dress tends to [ride up] when she sits down.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的裙子在坐下時經常會往上滑。

examples.sentence: The waistband of my pants keeps [riding up].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我褲子的腰帶總是往上滑。

examples.sentence: I hate it when my shirt [rides up] while I'm working.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我討厭在工作時，襯衫往上滑的感覺。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To cheat someone, especially by charging too much or giving them less than what they are owed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 欺騙某人，特別是收取過高的費用或給予他們少於應得的東西

examples.sentence: They really ripped me off at that store.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在那家商店真的欺騙了我。

examples.sentence: I felt like I was being ripped off during the negotiation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我覺得在談判中我被欺騙了。

examples.sentence: He ripped off his clients by charging them double.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他通過向客户收取雙倍價格來欺騙他們。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To remove something forcefully or suddenly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 強行或突然地移除某物

examples.sentence: He ripped out the page from his notebook.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他從筆記本中撕下了那一頁。

examples.sentence: She ripped out the weeds from the garden.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她從花園中撕下了雜草。

examples.sentence: I accidentally ripped out the plug while cleaning.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我在清理時不小心撕下了插頭。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To arrive in large numbers or a large amount.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 大量到達或大量出現

examples.sentence: Guests started to roll in around 7 PM.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 客人們於晚上7點左右開始陸續到達。

examples.sentence: The profits rolled in after the new campaign launched.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新活動啟動後，利潤開始大量進來。

examples.sentence: Rain clouds began to roll in just before the storm.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 暴風雨來臨前，雲彩開始聚集。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To transfer a quality or characteristic to someone or something through contact.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過接觸將某一特質轉移到某人或某物身上

examples.sentence: His enthusiasm has really rubbed off on me.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的熱情真的對我產生了影響。

examples.sentence: The paint will rub off if you touch it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你碰到它，油漆會剝落。

examples.sentence: She hopes her good habits will rub off on her friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她希望她的好習慣會影響到她的朋友。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To erase or remove something, especially marks or writing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 擦掉或移除某物，特別是標記或文字

examples.sentence: He rubbed out the mistakes with an eraser.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他用橡皮擦掉錯誤。

examples.sentence: I need to rub out this pencil mark.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要擦掉這個鉛筆痕跡。

examples.sentence: They rubbed out the graffiti on the wall.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們擦掉了牆上的塗鴉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To attempt to achieve a position or office in an election.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 企圖在選舉中獲得一個職位或官職

examples.sentence: She decided to run for mayor in the upcoming election.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定在即將到來的選舉中參選市長。

examples.sentence: He has announced that he will run for re-election.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他已宣布將參選連任。

examples.sentence: Many people encourage her to run for the council.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多人鼓勵她競選議會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To leave quickly, typically to avoid a situation or person.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 快速離開，通常是為了避免某種情況或某人

examples.sentence: They ran off before anyone could catch them.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在任何人能抓住他們之前就迅速逃走了。

examples.sentence: She decided to run off and start a new life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定逃離，開始新的生活。

examples.sentence: The dog ran off the moment it saw the open door.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那隻狗在看到打開的門的時候立刻跑了出去。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have no more of something left.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 沒有剩下任何東西

examples.sentence: We ran out of milk, so we need to buy some.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們的牛奶用完了，所以需要買一些。

examples.sentence: They ran out of time before completing the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在完成項目之前，他們時間用完了。

examples.sentence: I always run out of battery on my phone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我的手機總是沒電。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To accumulate savings or money over time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 隨著時間的推移累積儲蓄或金錢

examples.sentence: I need to save up for a new car.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要存錢買一輛新車。

examples.sentence: They have been saving up for their vacation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們一直在為假期存錢。

examples.sentence: She saved up enough money to buy a house.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她存了足夠的錢去買房子。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To say goodbye to someone at the beginning of their journey.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在某人旅行開始時向其告別

examples.sentence: I went to the airport to see him off.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我去機場送他。

examples.sentence: She saw her friend off at the train station.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在火車站告別了她的朋友。

examples.sentence: They planned to see off the guests at the hotel.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們計劃在酒店送客人。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To submit something, typically a document or application, for consideration.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 提交某物，通常是文件或申請，以供考慮

examples.sentence: You need to send in your application by the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要在截止日期之前提交申請。

examples.sentence: They will send in their report next week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們將在下週提交報告。

examples.sentence: I recommend that you send in your resume early.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我建議你儘早提交你的簡歷。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To begin a journey or start an activity.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 開始旅程或啟動活動

examples.sentence: We set off early to avoid traffic.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們很早出發以避免交通。

examples.sentence: He plans to set off on his trip next month.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他計劃下個月開始旅行。

examples.sentence: She set off to explore the city after breakfast.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她早餐後出發去探索城市。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To begin an endeavor or journey with a particular intention.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以特定意圖開始一個努力或旅程

examples.sentence: They set out to make a difference in the world.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們開始努力改變世界。

examples.sentence: We set out on our journey at dawn.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在黎明時開始了旅程。

examples.sentence: She set out to prove her point during the debate.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在辯論中，她開始試圖證明自己的觀點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To arrive or appear at a place.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 到達或出現在某個地方

examples.sentence: He always shows up late to meetings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是遲到開會。

examples.sentence: She didn't show up for her appointment.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她沒有來赴約。

examples.sentence: They finally showed up after an hour of waiting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在等了一個小時後終於出現了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To confine someone indoors or within a restricted space.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將某人限制在室內或狹小空間內

examples.sentence: He felt shut in during the long winter months.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在漫長的冬季，他感到被限制在室內。

examples.sentence: The storm shut us in the house for days.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 暴風雨將我們困在家裡好幾天。

examples.sentence: She shut her dog in the yard while she cleaned.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在清理時把狗關在院子裡。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stop talking or to cause someone to stop talking.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 停止講話或使某人停止講話

examples.sentence: I wish they would just shut up.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望他們能夠閉嘴。

examples.sentence: He told her to shut up during the argument.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在爭吵期間，他告訴她閉嘴。

examples.sentence: They were told to shut up and listen.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們被告知要閉嘴並聆聽。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To register one's presence, often by providing one's name or other details.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 註冊個人出席，通常是提供姓名或其他詳細信息

examples.sentence: Please sign in at the reception desk upon arrival.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 到達時請在接待台登記。

examples.sentence: You need to sign in to access the online system.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要登錄才能訪問在線系統。

examples.sentence: She signed in for the conference before it started.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議開始之前，她登記了參加。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To agree to participate in a task or organization.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 同意參加任務或組織

examples.sentence: He signed on to help with the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他同意幫助這個項目。

examples.sentence: She signed on as a volunteer for the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她簽約作為活動的志願者。

examples.sentence: They signed on for a year of service.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們簽約為期一年的服務。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To assess or evaluate someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 評估或評價某人或某物

examples.sentence: He sized up the competition before the game.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在比賽前，他評估了競爭對手。

examples.sentence: She always sizes up a situation before acting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在行動前總是評估情況。

examples.sentence: They sized up the risks involved in the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們評估了這個項目中涉及的風險。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To eagerly seize or take advantage of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 急切地抓住或利用某物

examples.sentence: She snapped up the last ticket to the concert.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她急切地抓住了最後一張音樂會的票。

examples.sentence: They snapped up the opportunity as soon as it was announced.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一公布，他們就抓住了這個機會。

examples.sentence: He snapped up the job offer without hesitation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他毫不猶豫地抓住了這份工作機會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To absorb or fully experience something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 吸收或充分體驗某事物

examples.sentence: Take a moment to soak in the beauty of the sunset.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 花點時間去欣賞日落的美景。

examples.sentence: She soaked in all the information during the lecture.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在講座中吸收了所有的信息。

examples.sentence: They took a walk to soak in the fresh air.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們散步以吸收新鮮空氣。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To absorb or take in a substance or information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 吸收或吸取某種物質或信息

examples.sentence: The sponge soaks up the water.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 海綿吸收水分。

examples.sentence: He managed to soak up all the details of the story.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他成功地吸取了故事的所有細節。

examples.sentence: They spend time on the beach to soak up the sun.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們花時間在海灘上來吸收陽光。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To remain indoors rather than going out.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 待在室內而不出去

examples.sentence: I prefer to stay in on weekends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我週末喜歡待在家裡。

examples.sentence: They decided to stay in instead of going to the party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們決定待在家裡，而不去派對。

examples.sentence: She stayed in to read a book.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她待在家裡讀書。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To intervene in a situation, usually to help or resolve an issue.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 介入情況，通常是為了幫助或解決問題

examples.sentence: She chose to step in when the argument started.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當爭吵開始時，她選擇介入。

examples.sentence: He stepped in to assist with the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他介入幫助這個項目。

examples.sentence: They decided to step in to resolve the conflict.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們決定介入以解決衝突。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take action or increase effort in a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在情況中採取行動或增加努力

examples.sentence: He needs to step up his performance to meet expectations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他需要提高表現以滿足期望。

examples.sentence: The community stepped up to help those in need.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 社區團體採取行動以幫助有需要的人。

examples.sentence: She stepped up and took charge of the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她接手這個項目，開始負責。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To incite or provoke a reaction or emotional response.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 激起或引發反應或情感回應

examples.sentence: The speech stirred up a lot of emotions in the audience.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這段演講激起了觀眾的許多情感。

examples.sentence: He tends to stir up trouble wherever he goes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在任何地方都容易引起麻煩。

examples.sentence: They stirred up interest in the new product.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們激起了對新產品的興趣。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a short visit to someone or someplace.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某人或某地進行短暫的拜訪

examples.sentence: I will stop by your house later.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我待會會去你家拜訪。

examples.sentence: She stopped by the store to pick up groceries.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她順道去商店買雜貨。

examples.sentence: They stopped by for a quick chat.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們順道過來聊了幾句。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To try to gain favor or approval from someone through insincere behavior.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過不真誠的行為來試圖獲得某人的青睞或認可

examples.sentence: He always tries to suck up to the boss.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是試圖迎合老闆。

examples.sentence: She sucks up to her co-workers to get ahead.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她迎合同事以獲得進步。

examples.sentence: They often suck up to customers for positive reviews.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們經常迎合客戶以獲得好評。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To absorb information or experiences.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 吸收信息或經歷

examples.sentence: It took me a moment to take in everything he said.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我花了點時間來理解他所說的一切。

examples.sentence: She took in the beautiful surroundings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她吸收了美麗的環境。

examples.sentence: They need to take in more information before making a decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在做決定之前需要吸收更多的信息。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To accept a challenge or responsibility.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 接受挑戰或責任

examples.sentence: She is ready to take on new projects.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她準備接受新的項目。

examples.sentence: He took on the challenge of learning a new language.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他接受了學習新語言的挑戰。

examples.sentence: They are prepared to take on more responsibilities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們已準備好承擔更多的責任。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To develop a liking for someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某人或某物產生好感

examples.sentence: She took to her new role quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她迅速適應了她的新角色。

examples.sentence: He quickly took to the idea of working abroad.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他很快接受了在國外工作的想法。

examples.sentence: They seem to take to their new teammates well.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們似乎對新隊友相處得很好。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To begin or start a new hobby, activity, or topic.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 開始或啟動一項新愛好、活動或話題

examples.sentence: I want to take up painting as a hobby.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想把繪畫作為一個愛好。

examples.sentence: She decided to take up yoga for her health.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定開始練習瑜伽以促進健康。

examples.sentence: They took up a new sport together.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們一起開始了一項新運動。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To communicate with someone in speech.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 與某人進行口頭交流

examples.sentence: I need to talk to you about our plans.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要跟你談談我們的計劃。

examples.sentence: She talked to her friend on the phone for hours.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她和朋友通過電話聊了幾個小時。

examples.sentence: He is too shy to talk to new people.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他太害羞了，不敢與新朋友交談。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To promote or speak positively about someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某人或某事進行推廣或正面表達

examples.sentence: He always talks up his achievements.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是大肆宣揚自己的成就。

examples.sentence: She is talking the new policy up to her colleagues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在向同事們宣傳新政策。

examples.sentence: They talked up the benefits of the project during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在會議上描述了這個項目的好處。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To rip something into pieces or to become emotional.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 把某物撕成碎片或變得情緒化

examples.sentence: He tore up the letter after reading it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他讀完信後把它撕掉了。

examples.sentence: She tends to tear up during sad movies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在悲傷的電影中容易流淚。

examples.sentence: They tore up the contract in anger.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們氣憤地撕掉了合同。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To inform someone, usually in authority, about someone's wrongdoing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通知某人，通常是當權者，某人的不當行為

examples.sentence: She decided to tell on her classmate for cheating.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定告訴老師她的同班同學作弊的事。

examples.sentence: He was afraid to tell on the bullies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不敢告訴大人的霸凌事件。

examples.sentence: They encouraged him to tell on the thieves.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們鼓勵他向警方報告小偷的事情。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To inform someone about something, usually a secret or alert about a potential problem.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 告知某人某事，通常是秘密或潛在問題的警告

examples.sentence: He tipped off the police about the robbery.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他向警方報告了這宗搶劫事件。

examples.sentence: She got a tip-off about the impending layoffs.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她得到了有關即將裁員的消息。

examples.sentence: The journalist received a tip-off about the corruption scandal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記者獲悉有關腐敗醜聞的消息。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To complete something by adding a final touch or component.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過增加最後的觸感或組成來完成某事

examples.sentence: She topped off the cake with fresh strawberries.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她用新鮮的草莓完成了蛋糕。

examples.sentence: They topped off their road trip with a visit to a scenic spot.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們的公路旅行以拜訪一個風景區結束。

examples.sentence: He topped off his drink before heading out.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在外出之前將飲料加滿。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To test something or to audition for a role or position.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 測試某物或對角色或位置進行試鏡

examples.sentence: I want to try out this new recipe for dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想試試這個新食譜來做晚餐。

examples.sentence: She tried out for the school play.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她參加了學校的戲劇試鏡。

examples.sentence: They are trying out several new methods.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們正在嘗試幾種新方法。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To pay attention to or listen to a broadcast.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 注意或收聽廣播

examples.sentence: Make sure to tune in to the live show tonight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保今晚收看現場直播。

examples.sentence: She tunes in to her favorite podcast every week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她每週收聽她最喜歡的播客。

examples.sentence: They tuned in early to catch the beginning of the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們提前收聽以收看活動的開始。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To submit something, such as a report or homework, to an authority or the proper place.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 向當局或適當地方提交某物，例如報告或作業。

examples.sentence: I need to [turn in] my assignment by Friday.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要在星期五之前提交我的作業。

examples.sentence: She [turned in] her resignation yesterday.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她昨天提交了辭職信。

examples.sentence: He forgot to [turn in] his application on time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他忘了按時提交申請。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To activate a device or system.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 啟動設備或系統。

examples.sentence: Please [turn on] the lights when you enter the room.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你進入房間時，請開燈。

examples.sentence: He [turned on] the television to watch the news.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他打開電視看新聞。

examples.sentence: You need to [turn on] the computer before using it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 使用之前你需要開啟電腦。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To serve or assist someone, especially in a restaurant or similar setting.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為某人服務或協助，特別是在餐廳或類似環境中。

examples.sentence: The waiter [waited on] us promptly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 服務生及時為我們服務。

examples.sentence: She has experience [waiting on] customers.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她有為客戶服務的經驗。

examples.sentence: I prefer to [wait on] people rather than be waited on.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我更喜歡為他人服務，而不是被服務。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stay awake or continue to wait for someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持清醒或繼續等待某人。

examples.sentence: I will [wait up] for you to come home.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我會等你回家。

examples.sentence: Don't [wait up] too late; you need to sleep.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要等得太晚；你需要睡覺。

examples.sentence: She usually [waits up] for her children after school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她通常在放學後等她的孩子。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stop sleeping; to become alert or aware.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 停止睡覺；變得警覺或意識到。

examples.sentence: I usually [wake up] at 7 AM.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我通常在早上7點醒來。

examples.sentence: Please [wake up] and get ready for school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請醒來並準備上學。

examples.sentence: He [woke up] suddenly from a loud noise.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他從一聲巨響中驟然醒來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To enter a place by walking.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過走路進入一個地方。

examples.sentence: You can [walk in] anytime during the day.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以在白天的任何時候進來。

examples.sentence: She [walked in] without knocking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她沒有敲門就進來了。

examples.sentence: They [walk in] unannounced to surprise us.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們毫無預警地進來給我們驚喜。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To approach someone or something by walking.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過走路接近某人或某事。

examples.sentence: I will [walk up] to her and introduce myself.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我會走上前去介紹自己。

examples.sentence: He [walked up] to me with a smile.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他微笑著走向我。

examples.sentence: They often [walk up] the hill together.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們經常一起爬那座山。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To clean oneself or one's hands and face.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 清洗自己或清洗手和臉。

examples.sentence: Make sure to [wash up] before dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保在晚餐之前洗手。

examples.sentence: He always [washes up] after working in the garden.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在花園工作後總是會洗手。

examples.sentence: Please [wash up] before you eat.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請在吃飯前先洗手。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To prepare a meal quickly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 迅速準備一頓餐。

examples.sentence: I can [whip up] dinner in 30 minutes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我能在30分鐘內準備好晚餐。

examples.sentence: She [whipped up] some pancakes for breakfast.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她迅速為早餐做了些鬆餅。

examples.sentence: He loves to [whip up] desserts for his friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他喜歡為朋友們快速做甜點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To conclude or finish something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 結束或完結某事。

examples.sentence: We need to [wind up] this meeting soon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要快點結束這次會議。

examples.sentence: They [wound up] the event with a speech.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們通過一次演講結束了這個活動。

examples.sentence: Let's [wind up] this project by next week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們在下星期前結束這個項目。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To clean a surface by rubbing it with a cloth or paper.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過用布或紙擦拭來清潔表面。

examples.sentence: Please [wipe up] the spills on the table.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請擦拭桌子上的溢出物。

examples.sentence: He [wiped up] the crumbs after breakfast.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在早餐後清理了麵包屑。

examples.sentence: You should [wipe up] any spills immediately.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該馬上擦拭任何溢出物。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To focus attention on a task or project.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 專注於某個任務或項目。

examples.sentence: I need to [work on] my presentation for tomorrow.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要為明天的報告而努力。

examples.sentence: She is [working on] a new project at work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她正在為工作上的一個新項目而努力。

examples.sentence: We should [work on] our communication skills.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們應該改善我們的溝通技巧。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To complete or finish something, often in a satisfactory manner.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以令人滿意的方式完成或結束某事。

examples.sentence: We need to [wrap up] our discussion by 5 PM.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要在下午5點之前結束討論。

examples.sentence: She [wrapped up] the report before the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在截止日期之前完成了報告。

examples.sentence: Let's [wrap up] this meeting with final thoughts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們以最後的想法結束這次會議。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A phrase used to indicate permission or ability.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表示許可或能力的短語。

examples.sentence: [You can] finish your homework before dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以在晚餐前完成作業。

examples.sentence: [You can] ask for help if you need it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你需要，可以尋求幫助。

examples.sentence: [You can] join us for the movie tonight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以今晚加入我們看電影。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A colloquial expression used to advise someone to be quiet.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用來建議某人保持安靜的口語表達。

examples.sentence: When the teacher entered, I told him to [zip it]!
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當老師進來時，我告訴他保持安靜！

examples.sentence: You need to [zip it] during the movie.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你在電影期間需要保持安靜。

examples.sentence: She told him to [zip it] when he wouldn't stop complaining.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他不停抱怨時，她告訴他安靜。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To concentrate one's attention on something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 專注於某事。

examples.sentence: I need to [zone in] on my studies this week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這週我需要集中精力學習。

examples.sentence: She [zoned in] on the task at hand.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她專注於手頭的任務。

examples.sentence: You have to [zone in] if you want to succeed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想成功，你必須專注。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To focus closely or magnify an image or details.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聚焦或放大一個圖像或細節。

examples.sentence: You can [zoom in] on the picture to see more details.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以放大圖片以查看更多細節。

examples.sentence: He [zoomed in] on the important parts of the document.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他放大了文件的重要部分。

examples.sentence: Make sure to [zoom in] for a better view.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保放大以獲得更好的視野。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A phrase indicating that someone is listening attentively.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表示某人專心聆聽的短語。

examples.sentence: [All ears], I waited for her to start speaking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我專心等待她開始說話。

examples.sentence: He said he was [all ears] for my story.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他說他在專心聽我的故事。

examples.sentence: They were [all ears] when I mentioned the surprise.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我提及驚喜時，他們都專心聽著。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To withdraw from an agreement or commitment.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 撤回協議或承諾。

examples.sentence: She had to [back out] of the deal at the last minute.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她不得不在最後一刻退出交易。

examples.sentence: He [backed out] of the agreement without explanation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他沒有解釋地退出了協議。

examples.sentence: They might [back out] of the event due to bad weather.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於天氣不佳，他們可能會退出活動。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To help someone out of a difficult situation, often financially.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 幫助某人擺脫困境，通常是財務上的。

examples.sentence: He had to [bail out] his friend in the emergency.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不得不在緊急情況下幫助他的朋友。

examples.sentence: She [bailed out] the company during tough times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在艱難時期幫助了公司。

examples.sentence: They often [bail out] people in need.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們經常幫助有需要的人。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To support or confirm something, especially a statement or claim.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 支持或確認某事，特別是聲明或主張。

examples.sentence: The witness will [bear out] the defendant's alibi.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 證人將證實被告的不在場證明。

examples.sentence: Her research [bore out] the initial hypothesis.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的研究證實了最初的假設。

examples.sentence: These documents should [bear out] the claims made.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這些文件應該支持所提出的主張。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To fend off or repel an attack.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 抵擋或擊退攻擊。

examples.sentence: He managed to [beat off] the attackers.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他設法擊退了攻擊者。

examples.sentence: She [beat off] the cold wind with her jacket.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她用外套抵擋著寒風。

examples.sentence: They worked together to [beat off] the competition.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們合作抵擋競爭對手。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To defeat someone in a competition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在比賽中擊敗某人。

examples.sentence: Our team [beat out] the champions in the finals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們的隊伍在決賽中擊敗了冠軍。

examples.sentence: She [beat out] her rivals to win the top prize.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她擊敗了競爭對手贏得了最高獎項。

examples.sentence: He managed to [beat out] the competition in sales.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他成功在銷售中擊敗了競爭對手。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To sing something loudly and with enthusiasm.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 大聲而熱情地唱某事。

examples.sentence: They [belted out] their favorite songs at the karaoke.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在卡拉OK裡大聲唱出他們最喜歡的歌曲。

examples.sentence: She [belted out] the national anthem with pride.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她自豪地唱出了國歌。

examples.sentence: We [belted out] tunes around the campfire.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在營火旁大聲唱歌。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To assimilate or match with surroundings or a group.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 與環境或團體協調或匹配。

examples.sentence: He tried to [blend in] with the locals during his trip.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他試圖在旅行中與當地人融合在一起。

examples.sentence: The new student managed to [blend in] quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新學生成功迅速融入。

examples.sentence: You should [blend in] when attending formal events.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 參加正式活動時你應該與之融合。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To ignore or dismiss something; to not follow through on a commitment.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 忽視或拒絕某事；不遵守承諾。

examples.sentence: He decided to [blow off] the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定不參加會議。

examples.sentence: Don't [blow off] your responsibilities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要忽視你的責任。

examples.sentence: She tends to [blow off] her workout sessions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她往往忽視她的健身課程。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To extinguish something, especially a flame.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 熄滅某事，特別是火焰。

examples.sentence: Please [blow out] the candles before you leave.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請在你離開之前熄滅蠟燭。

examples.sentence: She [blew out] the match after lighting it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她點燃後熄滅了火柴。

examples.sentence: They asked him to [blow out] the fireworks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們讓他熄滅煙火的火苗。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To enter a place illegally or without permission.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非法或未經允許進入某地。

examples.sentence: They tried to [break in] through the back door.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們試圖從後門闖入。

examples.sentence: He was arrested for attempting to [break in] to a house.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他因試圖闖入一所房子而被捕。

examples.sentence: Don't [break in] while we're discussing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我們討論時不要打斷。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To end a relationship or connection.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 結束一段關係或連結。

examples.sentence: They decided to [break up] after years of dating.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在交往多年後決定分手。

examples.sentence: It's hard to [break up] with someone you love.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 與你愛的人分手是很難的。

examples.sentence: He got emotional when they [broke up].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在他們分手時變得情緒化。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To introduce something or someone, especially to a group or organization.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將某事或某人引入，特別是到一個團體或組織中。

examples.sentence: They will [bring in] a new manager next month.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們下個月將引入一位新經理。

examples.sentence: We need to [bring in] fresh ideas for the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要將新想法引入這個項目。

examples.sentence: She was [brought in] to help with the negotiations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她被引入來幫助進行談判。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To cause something, especially something negative or unpleasant, to happen.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某事發生，特別是負面或不愉快的事。

examples.sentence: His actions [brought on] a lot of stress for everyone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的行為給每個人帶來了很多壓力。

examples.sentence: The storm [brought on] power outages across the city.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這場風暴導致全城停電。

examples.sentence: She didn't mean to [bring on] such a conflict.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她無意造成這樣的衝突。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To direct someone's attention to a particular issue or topic.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將某人的注意力引導到特定問題或主題上。

examples.sentence: Can you [bring to] my attention the deadline for the project?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能把該項目的截止日期引起我的注意嗎？

examples.sentence: She [brought to] our attention the need for more resources.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她引起了我們對更多資源需求的注意。

examples.sentence: Please [bring to] their notice any updates.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請告訴他們任何更新的情況。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To mention or introduce a topic for discussion.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 提及或引入一個討論的主題。

examples.sentence: I wanted to [bring up] the budget cuts during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想在會議期間提及預算削減。

examples.sentence: She [brought up] an interesting point about teamwork.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她提出了一個關於團隊合作的有趣觀點。

examples.sentence: He finally [brought up] his concerns with management.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他最終向管理層提出了他的擔憂。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To improve or refresh knowledge or skills.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 改善或更新知識或技能。

examples.sentence: I need to [brush up] on my Spanish before the trip.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在出行之前，我需要複習我的西班牙語。

examples.sentence: She [brushed up] on her networking skills for the new job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她為了新的工作更新了自己的網絡技能。

examples.sentence: Before the exam, I will [brush up] on important topics.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在考試之前，我會復習重要的主題。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To incorporate a feature or element into the design of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將某個特徵或元素納入某物的設計中。

examples.sentence: The architect decided to [build in] more windows in the plan.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 建築師決定在設計中多建一些窗戶。

examples.sentence: They [built in] safety features into the new cars.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們將安全功能納入新車的設計中。

examples.sentence: You should [build in] flexibility in the schedule.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該在計劃中增加彈性。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To use something as a foundation for further development or improvement.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將某物作為進一步發展或改進的基礎。

examples.sentence: We can [build on] the success of the previous project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們可以在先前項目的基礎上繼續發展。

examples.sentence: The team plans to [build on] their achievements.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 團隊計劃在他們的成就上進一步發展。

examples.sentence: You should [build on] your strengths.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該在你的優勢上進行發展。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To increase or enhance something gradually.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 逐漸增加或增強某物。

examples.sentence: You need to [build up] your endurance for the marathon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要逐步增加你的耐力以參加馬拉松。

examples.sentence: They [built up] their savings over the years.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們多年的存款逐漸增加。

examples.sentence: She wants to [build up] her reputation in the industry.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她想在行業中提升自己的聲譽。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To eliminate or use up energy, often through physical activity.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過體育活動消耗或使用能量。

examples.sentence: You can [burn off] calories by exercising regularly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以通過定期運動來消耗卡路里。

examples.sentence: I like to [burn off] stress by going for a run.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我喜歡通過慢跑來釋放壓力。

examples.sentence: She [burned off] a lot of energy during the hike.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在徒步旅行中消耗了很多能量。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become extremely tired or exhausted, often due to overwork.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 因過度工作而變得極度疲憊或精疲力竭。

examples.sentence: If you don't take breaks, you'll [burn out].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你不休息的話，你會精疲力竭。

examples.sentence: She [burned out] after working long hours for weeks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在幾個星期長時間工作後變得精疲力竭。

examples.sentence: Many teachers experience [burn out] due to high demands.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於高要求，許多老師都經歷過精疲力竭。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To accept an idea or plan, especially after considering it carefully.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 接受一個想法或計劃，尤其是在仔細考慮之後。

examples.sentence: I finally [bought into] the new marketing strategy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我最終接受了這個新的市場策略。

examples.sentence: She won't [buy into] the gossip about her.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她不會相信關於她的小道消息。

examples.sentence: They [bought into] the vision for the future.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們接受了對未來的願景。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To require or demand something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 要求或需要某事

examples.sentence: This situation [calls for] immediate action.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這種情況要求立即行動。

examples.sentence: The recipe [calls for] two cups of flour.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這道食譜需要兩杯麵粉。

examples.sentence: Her performance [calls for] an encore.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的表現要求加演。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To cancel something that was scheduled.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 取消原定的事情

examples.sentence: They decided to [call off] the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們決定取消會議。

examples.sentence: The game was [called off] due to rain.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為下雨，這場比賽被取消了。

examples.sentence: She [called off] her wedding plans.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她取消了婚禮計劃。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To shout or speak loudly to someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 大聲呼喊某人

examples.sentence: He [called out] her name in the crowd.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在擁擠的人群中呼喊她的名字。

examples.sentence: She [called out] to her friend across the street.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在街對面對朋友呼喊。

examples.sentence: The teacher [called out] the students' names.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 老師大聲叫了學生們的名字。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have an affection or liking for someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某人或某事有好感或喜愛

examples.sentence: Do you [care for] a cup of tea?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你想要一杯茶嗎？

examples.sentence: She [cares for] her elderly parents.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她照顧她年邁的父母。

examples.sentence: I [don't care for] loud music.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不喜歡大聲音樂。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To continue doing something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 繼續做某事

examples.sentence: Please [carry on] with your work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請繼續你的工作。

examples.sentence: They [carried on] despite the challenges.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管面臨挑戰，他們仍然繼續前進。

examples.sentence: She [carries on] with her studies after school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她放學後繼續學習。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To convert a form of payment into cash.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將支付方式轉換為現金

examples.sentence: He decided to [cash out] his winnings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定兌現他的獎金。

examples.sentence: You can [cash out] your chips at the end of the game.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以在比賽結束時兌現你的籌碼。

examples.sentence: She [cashes out] when she reaches a certain point.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在達到某個點時兌現。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become popular or widely accepted.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得受歡迎或被廣泛接受

examples.sentence: This trend has really [caught on] lately.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個趨勢最近真的變得非常受歡迎。

examples.sentence: It took a while for the idea to [catch on].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個想法花了一段時間才受到接受。

examples.sentence: The song [caught on] quickly after its release.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這首歌在發行後迅速流行起來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To reach someone or something that is ahead.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 趕上在前面的人或事

examples.sentence: I need to [catch up] on my studies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要趕上我的學業。

examples.sentence: Let's meet to [catch up] with each other.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們見面聊聊進展如何。

examples.sentence: She finally [caught up] with her competitors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她終於趕上了競爭對手。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A dilemma or situation where one cannot escape due to contradictory rules.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一種矛盾規則導致無法逃脫的困境或情況

examples.sentence: Getting a job requires experience, but you need a job to gain experience—it's a real [catch-22].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 找工作需要經驗，但你需要工作來獲得經驗——這是一個真正的困境。

examples.sentence: In this [catch-22], the laws prevent any solution from being implemented.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這種困境中，法律阻止任何解決方案的實施。

examples.sentence: Every option seems to lead back to this [catch-22].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每個選擇似乎都導致這個困境。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To provide what is desired or needed by someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 提供某人所需或所想要的事物

examples.sentence: They aim to [cater to] the needs of their customers.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們的目標是滿足客戶的需求。

examples.sentence: The restaurant [caters to] a diverse clientele.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這家餐廳迎合各種顧客。

examples.sentence: She prefers to [cater to] her family rather than herself.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她更願意滿足她家庭的需求而非自己的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To achieve or record something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 獲得或記錄某事

examples.sentence: He [chalked up] another victory last night.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他昨晚又獲得了一場勝利。

examples.sentence: They managed to [chalk up] significant results.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們成功獲得了顯著的成果。

examples.sentence: She [chalks up] her success to hard work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她將自己的成功歸功於努力工作。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To pursue someone to obtain something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 追尋某人以獲得某事

examples.sentence: I need to [chase up] the deliveries.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要追蹤送貨。

examples.sentence: Please [chase up] your payment.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請追蹤你的付款。

examples.sentence: She [chased up] her friends for the party details.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她為派對的細節追尋她的朋友。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To register upon arrival at a location.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 到達某地時登記

examples.sentence: We need to [check in] at the hotel by 3 PM.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要在下午3點之前到酒店登記。

examples.sentence: Please [check in] with the receptionist.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請與接待員登記。

examples.sentence: They [checked in] for their flight online.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在線上登記了航班。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To encourage someone by cheering.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 透過歡呼來鼓勵某人

examples.sentence: The crowd [cheered on] the athletes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人群為運動員加油。

examples.sentence: She [cheered on] her team from the stands.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在看台上為她的團隊加油。

examples.sentence: Let's [cheer on] our friends in the competition.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們在比賽中為朋友加油吧。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become happier or to make someone happier.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得更快樂或使某人更快樂

examples.sentence: She tried to [cheer up] her friend.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她試著讓朋友開心起來。

examples.sentence: The news should [cheer you up].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個消息應該會讓你高興。

examples.sentence: He [cheers up] whenever he hears that song.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每當他聽到那首歌，他就會變得快樂。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a place tidy and neat.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某地整齊乾淨

examples.sentence: It's time to [clean up] the house.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候打掃房子了。

examples.sentence: She asked the kids to [clean up] their toys.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她請孩子們收拾他們的玩具。

examples.sentence: They [cleaned up] after the party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在派對後打掃了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make something clear or free from confusion.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某事明晰或不再困惑

examples.sentence: We need to [clear up] this misunderstanding.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要澄清這個誤解。

examples.sentence: Could you [clear up] the details for me?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能為我澄清細節嗎？

examples.sentence: The weather should [clear up] later.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 天氣稍後應該會好轉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To hold on tightly to something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 緊緊握住某物

examples.sentence: She [clung on] to the railing as she climbed the stairs.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在爬樓梯時緊緊握住欄杆。

examples.sentence: He [clings on] to his beliefs despite criticism.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管受到批評，他仍然堅持自己的信仰。

examples.sentence: They [clung on] to hope during difficult times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在困難時期，他們仍然抱有希望。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To hold on to something tightly or persistently.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 緊緊或堅持地握住某物

examples.sentence: He [clung to] the memories of his childhood.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他緊緊握住童年的回憶。

examples.sentence: She [clings to] her traditions during holidays.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在節日期間堅持她的傳統。

examples.sentence: They [cling to] their beliefs despite the challenges.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管面臨挑戰，他們堅持自己的信仰。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To move closer to someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 向某人或某物靠近

examples.sentence: The storm clouds [closed in] quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 暴風雲迅速逼近。

examples.sentence: As night [closes in], it gets colder.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 夜幕降臨時，天氣變得更冷。

examples.sentence: He felt someone [closing in] behind him.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他感覺到有人在他身後靠近。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To block or seal something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 阻塞或封閉某物

examples.sentence: Please [close up] the box carefully.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請小心地封閉箱子。

examples.sentence: The company decided to [close up] the shop.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該公司決定關閉這家商店。

examples.sentence: He [closes up] at the end of the day.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在一天結束時封閉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To succeed or to happen as planned.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 成功或按計劃發生

examples.sentence: The event [came off] without a hitch.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 活動進行得非常順利。

examples.sentence: She hopes her plans [come off] as expected.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她希望她的計劃如預期般實現。

examples.sentence: Did the presentation [come off] well?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 報告進行得怎麼樣？

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become known or to be revealed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得被知道或被揭示

examples.sentence: The truth will [come out] eventually.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 真相最終會被揭示。

examples.sentence: When will the results [come out]?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 結果什麼時候會出來？

examples.sentence: Her book [came out] last month.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的書上個月出版了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stop working or to cease to function.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 停止運作或失去功能

examples.sentence: My car [conked out] on the highway.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我的車在高速公路上拋錨了。

examples.sentence: The computer [conks out] when it overheats.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 電腦過熱時會停止運作。

examples.sentence: He [conked out] during the movie.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在看電影時睡著了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become cooler or to calm down.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得更涼爽或平靜下來

examples.sentence: Let's [cool off] in the shade.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們在陰影中降溫。

examples.sentence: He needs to [cool off] after that argument.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他需要在爭吵後冷靜下來。

examples.sentence: The soup must [cool off] before serving.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 湯必須在上菜前降溫。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To include someone or something in a total.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將某人或某物包含在內

examples.sentence: Make sure to [count in] everyone for the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保把每個人都算進會議裡。

examples.sentence: He forgot to [count in] his expense report.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他忘了把費用報告算在內。

examples.sentence: Don't forget to [count in] the supplies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要忘記把供應品算在內。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To rely on someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 依賴某人或某物

examples.sentence: You can [count on] me to help you.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以依賴我來幫助你。

examples.sentence: She [counts on] her friends for support.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她依賴她的朋友支持。

examples.sentence: We all [count on] each other in tough times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在艱難時期，我們彼此依賴。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To total or add together the numbers of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將某事物的數量合計或加起來

examples.sentence: We need to [count up] the sales for this month.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要統計這個月的銷售數據。

examples.sentence: Can you [count up] the votes?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能把選票合計起來嗎？

examples.sentence: They [counted up] all the money raised.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們統計了所有籌集的資金。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 無法控制地大笑

examples.sentence: I always [crack up] at his jokes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我總是對他的笑話忍俊不禁。

examples.sentence: She [cracked up] after hearing the punchline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 聽到笑話的點，讓她爆笑不已。

examples.sentence: They [crack up] whenever they watch that movie.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每當他們看那部電影時都會笑得停不下來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To raise a false alarm or to call for help when it is not needed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 發出虛假的警報或在不需要時呼救

examples.sentence: If you keep [crying wolf], no one will believe you.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你繼續發出虛假警報，沒有人會相信你。

examples.sentence: He [cried wolf] too many times before.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他之前發出虛假警報太多次了。

examples.sentence: Don't [cry wolf] unless it's an emergency.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 除非是緊急情況，否則不要發出虛假警報。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To reduce the amount or number of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 減少某事物的數量或數量

examples.sentence: They need to [cut back] on expenses.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們需要減少開支。

examples.sentence: She [cuts back] on her sugar intake.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她減少糖的攝入量。

examples.sentence: We should [cut back] our meetings this month.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個月我們應該減少會議。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lessen the amount of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 減少某物的數量

examples.sentence: He needs to [cut down] on junk food.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他需要減少垃圾食品的攝入。

examples.sentence: You should [cut down] your screen time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該減少屏幕時間。

examples.sentence: She [cuts down] on caffeine for her health.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了健康，她減少攝入咖啡因。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To interfere or take away from something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 干擾或減少某事物

examples.sentence: Don't let distractions [cut into] your study time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要讓干擾影響學習時間。

examples.sentence: Her phone calls often [cut into] her work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的電話經常影響到她的工作。

examples.sentence: He felt that his overtime [cut into] his family time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他覺得加班占用了他的家庭時間。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To leave quickly or hurriedly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 匆忙或急忙離去

examples.sentence: I need to [dash off] to my meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要匆忙去開會。

examples.sentence: They [dashed off] before anyone could stop them.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在任何人能阻止他們之前他們就匆忙離開了。

examples.sentence: She [dashes off] when she hears her name.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她一聽到自己的名字就匆忙離開。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To gradually become quieter or weaker.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 逐漸變得安靜或較弱

examples.sentence: The sound of the music [died away] slowly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 音樂的聲音慢慢地變得安靜。

examples.sentence: His enthusiasm [dies away] after a while.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的熱情過了一會兒後就消失了。

examples.sentence: The applause [died away] after the performance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 表演結束後，掌聲漸漸消退。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lessen in intensity or degree.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在強度或程度上減少

examples.sentence: The storm is expected to [die down] by evening.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 預計這場暴風雨在晚上會減弱。

examples.sentence: His anger [dies down] after talking it through.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過商量後他的怒氣減少了。

examples.sentence: The noise finally [died down] after midnight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 午夜過後，噪音終於減弱了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To persist stubbornly or remain unchanged.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 固執地堅持或保持不變

examples.sentence: Old habits [die hard].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 舊習慣難以改變。

examples.sentence: He believes that principles [die hard].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他認為信念難以動搖。

examples.sentence: Some prejudices [die hard] in society.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 社會上有些偏見難以消除。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To delve into or investigate something thoroughly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 深入或徹底調查某事

examples.sentence: I want to [dig into] this topic more.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想更深入探討這個主題。

examples.sentence: She plans to [dig into] the records for clues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她計劃深入研究這些記錄以尋找線索。

examples.sentence: They [dig into] their family history.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們深入調查自己的家族歷史。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To serve food to others or to distribute something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 給他人提供食物或分發某物

examples.sentence: She loves to [dish out] food at parties.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她喜歡在派對上提供食物。

examples.sentence: They [dish out] advice to anyone who asks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們給任何尋求建議的人提供意見。

examples.sentence: He [dishes out] compliments generously.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他慷慨地發表讚美。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To completely change direction or opinion.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 徹底改變方向或意見

examples.sentence: She did a 180 on her decision to move.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她徹底改變了搬家的決定。

examples.sentence: After that incident, he did a 180 on his views.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在那起事件之後，他改變了看法。

examples.sentence: They had to [do a 180] after realizing their mistake.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在意識到錯誤後不得不改變方向。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To prolong or extend a situation or conversation unnecessarily.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不必要地延長或延伸一個情況或對話。

examples.sentence: Please don't [drag out] the meeting; we have other things to do.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請不要不必要地延長會議；我們有其他事情要做。

examples.sentence: She tends to [drag out] her explanations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她傾向於不必要地延長她的解釋。

examples.sentence: I wish he wouldn't [drag out] this discussion any longer.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望他不要再延長這次討論了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To wear formal or fancy clothing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 穿著正式或華麗的衣服。

examples.sentence: We decided to [dress up] for the party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們決定為派對穿著正式。

examples.sentence: He always [dresses up] for special occasions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是在特別場合作為穿著正式。

examples.sentence: The kids love to [dress up] as their favorite characters.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 孩子們喜歡打扮成他們最喜愛的角色。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To finish drinking something completely.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 完全喝完某物。

examples.sentence: Please [drink up]; we need to leave soon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請完全喝完；我們很快就要離開。

examples.sentence: He quickly [drank up] his soda before the movie started.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在電影開始之前，他迅速喝完了他的汽水。

examples.sentence: Don't forget to [drink up] the water after your workout.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 練習後別忘了將水完全喝完。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To aim or intend to communicate something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 目標或意圖傳達某事。

examples.sentence: What are you trying to [drive at] with your comments?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 您想通過您的評論目標傳達什麼?

examples.sentence: I didn't understand what he was [driving at].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不明白他想傳達什麼。

examples.sentence: She kept [driving at] the same point during the discussion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在討論中不斷重申同一點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To deliver someone or something to a specific destination.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 把某人或某物送到特定目的地。

examples.sentence: Can you [drop me off] at the station?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能帶我到車站嗎？

examples.sentence: He [dropped off] the package at my house yesterday.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他昨天把包裹送到我家。

examples.sentence: Please don't forget to [drop off] the documents at the office.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請別忘了把文件送到辦公室。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To withdraw from a course, school, or program before completion.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在完成之前退出課程、學校或計劃。

examples.sentence: She decided to [drop out] of college to pursue her career.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定輟學以追求她的職業。

examples.sentence: Many students [dropped out] last semester.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多學生上學期輟學了。

examples.sentence: You cannot [drop out] without informing your advisor.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果不告知你的顧問，你不能輟學。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To think or talk about something for a long time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 長時間思考或談論某事。

examples.sentence: You need to stop [dwelling on] past mistakes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要停止對過去錯誤的思考。

examples.sentence: He kept [dwelling on] the negative feedback he received.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他一再思考他收到的負面反饋。

examples.sentence: Don't [dwell on] your failures; focus on your successes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要專注於失敗，而要專注於成功。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become less severe or intense.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得不那麼嚴重或強烈。

examples.sentence: The pressure at work has started to [ease off].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 工作的壓力開始減輕。

examples.sentence: Try to [ease off] on the caffeine; it's not good for you.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘量減少咖啡因攝入；這對你不好。

examples.sentence: I hope the weather will [ease off] soon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望天氣很快會緩和。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To admit that one was wrong after taking a strong position.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 承認自己錯了，之前採取了強硬立場。

examples.sentence: After the mistake was found, he had to [eat crow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 發現錯誤後，他不得不承認錯誤。

examples.sentence: She finally decided to [eat crow] and apologize.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她終於決定承認錯誤並道歉。

examples.sentence: It's difficult for him to [eat crow] in front of his peers.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在同儕面前，對他來說承認錯誤是困難的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To gradually become less visible, audible, or intense.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 逐漸變得不那麼可見、可聽或強烈。

examples.sentence: The music began to [fade out] at the end of the song.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 音樂在歌曲結尾時開始逐漸變弱。

examples.sentence: As the lights [fade out], the stage will be empty.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當燈光逐漸變暗時，舞台將空無一人。

examples.sentence: The story's tension began to [fade out] towards the conclusion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 故事的緊張感在結局時開始逐漸減弱。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be deceived by something or someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 被某事或某人欺騙。

examples.sentence: I can't believe I [fell for] that scam.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我無法相信我被那個詐騙所欺騙。

examples.sentence: She always [falls for] his charming ways.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是被他的魅力所吸引。

examples.sentence: Don't [fall for] their tricks; they're not trustworthy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 別被他們的把戲欺騙；他們不值得信任。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become detached or to drop from a higher position.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 脫落或從高處掉下。

examples.sentence: Be careful not to [fall off] the ladder.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 小心別從梯子上摔下來。

examples.sentence: The leaves began to [fall off] the trees in autumn.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 樹葉在秋天開始脫落。

examples.sentence: Don't let your grades [fall off]; keep studying hard.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要讓你的成績下滑；繼續努力學習。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To happen or become separated from a group or situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 從一個團體或情況中發生或分離。

examples.sentence: Many students [fell out] of the program due to poor performance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於表現不佳，許多學生退出了該計劃。

examples.sentence: As friends, we had a fight and [fell out].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 作為朋友，我們吵了一架而疏遠了。

examples.sentence: The details of our plan [fell out] during the discussion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們的計劃細節在討論中洩露了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To complete a form or document by providing the necessary information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過提供必要的信息來填寫表格或文件。

examples.sentence: Make sure to [fill out] your application correctly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保正確填寫您的申請表。

examples.sentence: She took her time to [fill out] the survey thoroughly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她花了時間仔細填寫調查表。

examples.sentence: I forgot to [fill out] my tax return last year.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我去年忘記填寫納稅申報表。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To discover or learn something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 發現或了解某事。

examples.sentence: I hope to [find out] the truth soon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望能很快知道真相。

examples.sentence: Have you [found out] how to solve the problem?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你查出怎麼解決那個問題了嗎？

examples.sentence: She is trying to [find out] more about the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她正試圖了解該項目的更多信息。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To suddenly become extremely upset or angry.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 突然變得非常不安或生氣。

examples.sentence: When he heard the news, he [flipped out].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他聽到這個消息時，他非常震驚。

examples.sentence: She'll [flip out] if you tell her the truth.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你告訴她真相，她會生氣。

examples.sentence: I almost [flipped out] when I found my lost wallet.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我找到失去的錢包時，我幾乎失控了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To concentrate attention or effort on something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將注意力或精力集中在某事上。

examples.sentence: You should [focus on] your studies to improve your grades.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該專注於學習以提高自己的成績。

examples.sentence: Let's [focus on] finding a solution together.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們一起專注於尋找解決方案。

examples.sentence: We need to [focus on] our goals to achieve success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要專注於我們的目標以取得成功。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To disapprove of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不贊成某事。

examples.sentence: Many parents [frown on] excessive screen time for children.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多父母對孩子過度使用屏幕時間表示不贊成。

examples.sentence: Smoking is often [frowned on] in public places.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在公共場所吸煙通常是不被贊成的。

examples.sentence: She [frowns on] rude behavior at work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她對工作中的粗魯行為表示不贊成。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To escape or avoid something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 逃避或避免某事。

examples.sentence: They managed to [get away] from the crowd.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們成功從人群中逃脫。

examples.sentence: I hope to [get away] for a short vacation soon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望能盡快逃避一下，去短途度假。

examples.sentence: She never gets away from her responsibilities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她從不逃避自己的責任。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To return to a previous place or situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 回到先前的位置或情況。

examples.sentence: I need to [get back] to work after lunch.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我午餐後需要回去工作。

examples.sentence: He promised to [get back] to me with more information.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他承諾會再給我更多的信息。

examples.sentence: Let's [get back] to the main topic of discussion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們回到討論的主題。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lower oneself, often to a sitting position.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 降低自己，通常是坐下的姿勢。

examples.sentence: Please [get down] from the table.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請從桌子上坐下來。

examples.sentence: We finally [got down] to discussing the details.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們最終坐下來討論細節。

examples.sentence: The dog is [getting down] from the sofa.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 狗正在從沙發上跳下來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become involved in something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 開始參與某事。

examples.sentence: She wants to [get into] graphic design.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她想開始參與平面設計。

examples.sentence: He is trying to [get into] better shape by exercising.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他想通過鍛煉來改善身材。

examples.sentence: Let's [get into] the details of the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們深入討論一下這個項目的細節。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To recover from something, such as an illness or a difficult situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 從某事，如疾病或困難情況中恢復過來。

examples.sentence: It took her a while to [get over] the flu.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她花了一段時間才從流感中恢復過來。

examples.sentence: He is still trying to [get over] the loss of his pet.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他仍在努力從寵物的喪失中恢復過來。

examples.sentence: You need to [get over] your fears and try new things.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要克服恐懼，嘗試新的事物。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To emit or release something, such as a smell or light.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 散發或釋放某物，如氣味或光。

examples.sentence: The flowers [give off] a pleasant fragrance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這些花散發出令人愉悅的香氣。

examples.sentence: That lamp [gives off] a bright light.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那盞燈發出明亮的光。

examples.sentence: The cake [gave off] a delicious smell while baking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 烘焙時蛋糕散發出美味的香氣。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To distribute something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 分發某物。

examples.sentence: They will [give out] flyers at the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們將在活動中分發傳單。

examples.sentence: Can you help me [give out] the invitations?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能幫我分發邀請函嗎？

examples.sentence: The charity aims to [give out] food to those in need.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該慈善機構目的是為需要的人分發食品。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To proceed with a task or activity.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 進行某項任務或活動。

examples.sentence: How should we [go about] planning the event?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們應該如何進行活動規劃？

examples.sentence: He has a specific way to [go about] solving problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他有處理問題的特定方式。

examples.sentence: They'll need to [go about] their work carefully.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們需要小心進行工作。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To pursue or chase someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 追求或追逐某人或某物。

examples.sentence: She decided to [go after] her dreams.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定追求她的夢想。

examples.sentence: The child ran to [go after] the ball.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 孩子跑去追那顆球。

examples.sentence: They are going to [go after] the competition.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們將追求競爭對手。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To proceed, especially after receiving permission.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在獲得許可後繼續進行。

examples.sentence: You can [go ahead] and start the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以開始該項目。

examples.sentence: They were told to [go ahead] with their plan.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們被告知可以繼續他們的計劃。

examples.sentence: If you're ready, you can [go ahead] and present your idea.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你準備好了，可以提出你的想法。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To agree with someone or something; to proceed together.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 同意某人或某事；一起進行。

examples.sentence: I'll [go along] with your suggestion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我會同意你的建議。

examples.sentence: They decided to [go along] with the plan.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們決定遵循該計劃。

examples.sentence: We can [go along] together to the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們可以一起去活動。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To fail or be destroyed, often referring to businesses.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 失敗或被毀，通常指企業。

examples.sentence: The company may [go under] if sales continue to drop.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果銷售持續下降，該公司可能會失敗。

examples.sentence: Due to mismanagement, the business is likely to [go under].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於管理不善，該企業很可能會失敗。

examples.sentence: Many small businesses [went under] during the recession.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多小企業在經濟衰退期間倒閉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A good person; someone who is kind and trustworthy.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 好人；善良且可信賴的人的意思。

examples.sentence: He's a real [good egg]; everyone likes him.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他真的是一個好人；每個人都喜歡他。

examples.sentence: I always knew she was a [good egg].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我一直知道她是一個好人。

examples.sentence: We need more [good eggs] in this world.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要更多的好人。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become too large for something; to develop beyond a stage.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得對某物過大；發展過一個階段。

examples.sentence: He has [grown out] of his old clothes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他已經不再適合他的舊衣服了。

examples.sentence: The child will [grow out] of this toy eventually.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那個孩子最終會不再適用這個玩具。

examples.sentence: She has [grown out] of her childhood habits.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她已經不再保持兒時的習慣了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To distribute or give something to people.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 向人們發放或給予某物。

examples.sentence: The volunteers will [hand out] food to the needy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 志願者將向有需要的人分發食物。

examples.sentence: Can you [hand out] these flyers at the event?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能在活動上發放這些傳單嗎？

examples.sentence: They plan to [hand out] the awards during the ceremony.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們打算在頒獎典禮上分發獎項。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To spend time relaxing or socializing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 花時間放鬆或社交。

examples.sentence: Do you want to [hang out] this weekend?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你想在這個週末一起出去玩嗎？

examples.sentence: They usually [hang out] at the park after school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們通常在放學後去公園玩。

examples.sentence: We can [hang out] at my place and watch a movie.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們可以在我這裡放鬆一下，看電影。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To move toward a particular direction or destination.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 朝著特定的方向或目的地移動。

examples.sentence: We need to [head for] the nearest gas station.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要朝最近的加油站前進。

examples.sentence: She [headed for] the exit as soon as the movie ended.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 電影結束後，她立即朝出口走去。

examples.sentence: Let's [head for] the beach this weekend.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個週末我們去海灘吧。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To prevent something from happening.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 防止某事發生。

examples.sentence: We need to [head off] any potential problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要防止任何潛在的問題。

examples.sentence: He [headed off] the difficulties by preparing in advance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過提前準備，他防止了困難事態的發生。

examples.sentence: Let's [head off] those issues before they escalate.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在問題升級之前，我們來防止它們發生。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To retaliate or respond to an attack or criticism.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 報復或回擊攻擊或批評。

examples.sentence: When insulted, he knew how to [hit back].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當被侮辱時，他知道如何回擊。

examples.sentence: She decided it was time to [hit back] after being attacked.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在受到攻擊後，她決定是時候回擊了。

examples.sentence: It's best not to [hit back] in anger.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最好不要憤怒地反擊。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To delay something or to wait before taking action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 延遲某事或在採取行動之前等待。

examples.sentence: We should [hold off] on making a decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們應該延遲做出決定。

examples.sentence: Can you [hold off] the presentation until tomorrow?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能等到明天再進行演示嗎？

examples.sentence: Let's [hold off] on sending the email for now.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們暫時延遲發送郵件。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To extend something or to remain firm in a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 延伸某物或在某種情況下保持堅定。

examples.sentence: They decided to [hold out] for a better offer.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們決定堅持尋求更好的報價。

examples.sentence: She was able to [hold out] until help arrived.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她能堅持到幫助來到。

examples.sentence: Will you [hold out] your hand for me?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能把手伸出來給我嗎？

meanings.meaning_en_US: To move or act quickly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 快速移動或行動。

examples.sentence: You need to [hurry up] if you want to catch the bus.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想趕上巴士，你需要快點。

examples.sentence: She always [hurries up] when she's late.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是遲到時快速行動。

examples.sentence: Let's [hurry up] and finish this task.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們快點完成這項任務。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To resolve or clarify difficulties or issues.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 解決或澄清困難或問題

examples.sentence: We need to [iron out] our differences before the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議之前，我們需要解決我們的分歧。

examples.sentence: The team worked late to [iron out] the issues in the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 團隊加班以解決項目中的問題。

examples.sentence: Let's [iron out] the details of our plan.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們解決我們計劃的細節。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To write something quickly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 快速寫下某事

examples.sentence: I always [jot down] notes during the lecture.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我總是在講座中迅速做筆記。

examples.sentence: Make sure to [jot down] your ideas before they slip away.
