meanings.meaning_en_US: A significant achievement or event that fulfills a long-held wish.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 實現長期願望的重要成就或事件

examples.sentence: Winning the championship was a [dream come true] for the team.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 贏得冠軍對這支團隊來說是個夢想成真。

examples.sentence: For her, being a published author is a [dream come true].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對她來說，成為一名已出版的作者是夢想成真。

examples.sentence: Traveling the world has always been a [dream come true] for him.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 環遊世界一直是他的夢想成真。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Dressed very elegantly or stylishly, often intending to attract attention.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 穿著非常優雅或時尚，通常是為了吸引注意力

examples.sentence: She arrived at the party [dressed to kill], turning heads as she walked in.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她到達派對時穿著非常引人注目，走進來時吸引了所有人的目光。

examples.sentence: He always looks [dressed to kill] for important meetings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在重要會議上總是打扮得很入時。

examples.sentence: At the gala, everyone was [dressed to kill], showcasing their finest attire.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在晚會上，每個人都穿得很時尚，展示著他們最好的服裝。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To eat very little or to have a small appetite.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 吃得非常少或食慾小

examples.sentence: She tends to [eat like a bird] during lunch.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在午餐時通常吃得很少。

examples.sentence: Ever since he started the diet, he has been [eating like a bird].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 自從他開始節食以來，他的食量變得很少。

examples.sentence: Don't worry; kids often [eat like birds] before dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不用擔心，孩子們在晚餐前通常食量很少。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take back what one has said, especially when proven wrong.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 收回自己所說的話，尤其是在被證明錯誤的時候

examples.sentence: After seeing the evidence, he had to [eat his words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 看到證據後，他不得不收回他的話。

examples.sentence: She promised she would never do it again, but circumstances forced her to [eat her words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她承諾過不會再這樣做，但情況迫使她收回她的話。

examples.sentence: It’s not easy to [eat your words] when you have spoken publicly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在公開場合發言後，收回自己的話並不容易。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In an honest and just manner.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以公正、正直的方式

examples.sentence: She won the competition [fair and square].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她是以公正、正直的方式贏得比賽的。

examples.sentence: The election results were [fair and square].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 選舉結果是公正、正直的。

examples.sentence: We both agreed to settle the disagreement [fair and square].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們都同意以公正、正直的方式解決爭議。
others: at the drop of a hat

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lose favor or respect, often as a result of wrongdoing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 因不當行為而失去名聲或尊重

examples.sentence: After the scandal, he [fell from grace] in the eyes of the public.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在醜聞之後，他在公眾面前失去了名聲。

examples.sentence: Many celebrities [fall from grace] due to poor choices.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多名人因為糟糕的選擇而失去名聲。

examples.sentence: His corruption led him to [fall from grace].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的貪污導致他失去名聲。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A thorough and meticulous search or review.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 徹底而仔細的檢查或審查

examples.sentence: The investigator went through the documents with a [fine-tooth comb].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 調查員仔細檢查了文件。
others: let the cat out of the bag

examples.sentence: They examined the budget with a [fine-tooth comb].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們徹底檢查了預算。
others: take it with a grain of salt
by the skin of one's teeth

examples.sentence: She went through her essay with a [fine-tooth comb] before submitting it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在提交之前，她仔細檢查了她的文章。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In very good health or condition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 健康或狀態非常良好

examples.sentence: After his recovery, he felt [fit as a fiddle].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 康復後，他感覺非常健康。

examples.sentence: She exercises regularly and is [fit as a fiddle].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她定期運動，身體非常健康。

examples.sentence: He claims to be [fit as a fiddle] despite his age.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管年齡增長，他聲稱自己身體健康。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To change the situation or the usual way of doing things.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 改變情況或通常的做法

examples.sentence: The new CEO plans to [flip the script] on company policy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新任首席執行官計劃改變公司政策。

examples.sentence: He decided to [flip the script] and try a different approach.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定改變情況，嘗試不同的方法。

examples.sentence: The artist [flipped the script] by changing her style entirely.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這位藝術家完全改變了風格。
others: hit the nail on the head
put all one's eggs in one basket

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who observes a situation without being noticed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在不被注意的情況下觀察情況的人

examples.sentence: I wish I could be a [fly on the wall] during their meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望我能在他們會議期間悄悄觀察。

examples.sentence: Being a [fly on the wall] can give you insights into people’s opinions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 作為一個悄悄觀察的人可以讓你洞察人們的看法。

examples.sentence: She felt like a [fly on the wall] at the family gathering.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在家庭聚會上，她覺得自己像個隱形人。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Full of nonsense or empty talk.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 充滿無稽之談或空洞的言論

examples.sentence: His promises were just [full of hot air].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的承諾只是無稽之談。

examples.sentence: Don't believe her; she's [full of hot air].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要相信她；她的話都是空洞的。

examples.sentence: Critics called the speech [full of hot air].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 評論家稱這演講充滿無稽之談。
others: saw the writing on the wall

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become uncontrollable or chaotic.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得無法控制或混亂

examples.sentence: The party [got out of hand] after too many drinks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 派對在喝太多酒後變得失控。

examples.sentence: Things [got out of hand] during the meeting when tempers flared.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議期間，情況因情緒失控而變得無法控制。
others: take the bull by the horns

examples.sentence: The situation quickly [got out of hand] at the protest.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在抗議活動中，局勢迅速失控。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A plea for leniency or to ask someone not to be so harsh.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 請求寬容或請人不要如此苛刻

examples.sentence: When he complained about the task, I thought, 'Give me a break!'
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他抱怨這項任務時，我心想：'讓我喘口氣！'

examples.sentence: Just [give me a break]; I’m doing my best!
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請讓我喘口氣；我正在全力以赴！

examples.sentence: She rolled her eyes and said, 'Oh, give me a break!'
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她翻了翻眼睛說：'哦，讓我喘口氣！'

meanings.meaning_en_US: To attempt to salvage a situation by trying anything, even if it is unlikely to succeed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 即使不太可能成功也試圖挽救情況

examples.sentence: In desperation, he started to [grasp at straws].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在絕望中，他開始試圖挽救情況。

examples.sentence: She felt like she was [grasping at straws] during the crisis.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她覺得在危機中像是試圖挽救情況。

examples.sentence: Trying to convince him was just [grasping at straws].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 試圖說服他只是無濟於事。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Extremely envious or jealous.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 極度嫉妒

examples.sentence: She was [green with envy] when she saw her friend's new car.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她看到朋友的新車時，她非常嫉妒。

examples.sentence: I could see he was [green with envy] after my promotion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我看得出他在我升遷後非常嫉妒。

examples.sentence: They were [green with envy] at the couple's vacation photos.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們對這對情侶的度假照片感到嫉妒。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A poorly thought-out idea or plan.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 經過粗糙考慮的想法或計劃

examples.sentence: That [half-baked idea] won't solve the problem.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那個經過粗糙考慮的想法無法解決問題。
others: strike while the iron is hot

examples.sentence: We need to avoid [half-baked ideas] in our proposal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要避免在提案中出現經過粗糙考慮的想法。
others: hit the nail on the head
let the cat out of the bag

examples.sentence: He always comes up with [half-baked ideas] for the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是提出經過粗糙考慮的想法來進行項目。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very happy or content.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常快樂或滿足

examples.sentence: She was [happy as a clam] at the beach.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在海灘上非常快樂。

examples.sentence: After the surprise party, he felt [happy as a clam].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在驚喜派對後，他感到非常快樂。

examples.sentence: The kids were [happy as clams] while playing games.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 孩子們在玩遊戲時非常快樂。
others: if it ain't broke, don't fix it

meanings.meaning_en_US: Completely in love.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 完全陷入愛情

examples.sentence: He is [head over heels] in love with her.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他完全愛上了她。

examples.sentence: She fell [head over heels] for him at first sight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她一見鍾情，完全愛上了他。

examples.sentence: They were [head over heels] together for years.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在一起多年，完全陷入愛情。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To reach the lowest point in a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在一個情況中達到最低點

examples.sentence: After losing his job, he felt he had [hit rock bottom].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 失去工作後，他感覺自己達到了最低點。

examples.sentence: She finally realized she had [hit rock bottom] when her health declined.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她的健康惡化時，她終於意識到自己達到了最低點。

examples.sentence: He felt like he [hit rock bottom] after the breakup.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 分手後，他感覺自己達到了最低點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have great success or good fortune.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 取得重大成功或運氣好

examples.sentence: He really [hit the jackpot] with his new invention.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的新發明取得了重大成功。
others: put all your eggs in one basket
cross the bridge when you come to it

examples.sentence: Winning that award was like [hitting the jackpot] for her.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 獲得那個獎項對她來說簡直是意外之喜。

examples.sentence: They [hit the jackpot] with their investment in the startup.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在投資初創公司時取得了重大成功。
others: burn the candle at both ends

meanings.meaning_en_US: Over a long period; eventually.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 持續一段長時間後；最終

examples.sentence: Investing wisely benefits you [in the long run].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 明智的投資在長期內會給你帶來好處。
others: at the drop of a hat
put all your eggs in one basket

examples.sentence: It’s important to stay healthy, as it will help you [in the long run].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 保持健康很重要，因為這會在長期內幫助你。
others: by the skin of one's teeth

examples.sentence: Changes made now will benefit the company [in the long run].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 現在做的改變將在長期內對公司有利。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be alert to watch for something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持警覺以尋找某物

examples.sentence: Please [keep an eye out] for my bag while I step away.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請注意一下我的包，當我暫時離開時。

examples.sentence: You should [keep an eye out] for job openings in your field.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該保持警覺以留意你領域的職位空缺。

examples.sentence: I’ll [keep an eye out] for your message.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我會注意查看你的信息。
others: take it with a grain of salt

meanings.meaning_en_US: To guide others by demonstrating appropriate behavior.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過示範適當的行為來引導他人

examples.sentence: Good leaders [lead by example] to inspire their teams.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 好的領導者通過示範來激勵他們的團隊。

examples.sentence: He believes in [leading by example] for effective teamwork.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他相信引導他人示範行為以促進有效的團隊合作。

examples.sentence: To earn respect, you must [lead by example].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 要贏得尊重，你必須示範適當的行為。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To learn how to do a job or task.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 學習如何做一項工作或任務

examples.sentence: It took him a while to [learn the ropes] of the new job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他花了一些時間來學習新工作的流程。

examples.sentence: She is eager to [learn the ropes] of the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她渴望學習這個項目的流程。
others: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: New employees must [learn the ropes] before starting regular work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新員工必須學習流程才能開始正式工作。
others: take it with a grain of salt

meanings.meaning_en_US: To anticipate with pleasure.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 愉快地期待

examples.sentence: I [look forward to] the weekend every week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我每週都期待週末的到來。

examples.sentence: She [looks forward to] her birthday every year.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她每年都期待自己的生日。

examples.sentence: We [look forward to] seeing you at the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們期待在活動中見到你。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lose the skill or ability to do something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 失去做某事的技能或能力

examples.sentence: He feels he has [lost his touch] in playing the piano.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他覺得自己失去了彈鋼琴的能力。
others: go out on a high note

examples.sentence: Many athletes fear they will [lose their touch] as they age.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多運動員擔心隨著年齡增長會失去技能。

examples.sentence: She thinks she might have [lost her touch] in her art.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她認為自己在藝術上可能失去了才華。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Dishonest or mischievous behavior.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不誠實或惡作劇的行為

examples.sentence: That kind of [monkey business] isn’t tolerated here.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這種不誠實的行為在這裡是不可容忍的。

examples.sentence: The boss warned against any more [monkey business].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 老闆警告不要再有任何誠實的行為。

examples.sentence: He was fired for engaging in [monkey business] at work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為在工作中從事不誠實的行為而被解雇。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a noticeable difference or impact.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 產生明顯的變化或影響

examples.sentence: We need to [move the needle] on our sales this quarter.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要在本季度的銷售中產生明顯的變化。
others: take it with a pinch of salt

examples.sentence: This strategy will not [move the needle] in terms of market share.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這一策略在市場佔有率方面不會產生明顯的影響。

examples.sentence: We have to [move the needle] to reach our goals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們必須產生明顯的影響以達成目標。

meanings.meaning_en_US: On a very small budget.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在非常小的預算下

examples.sentence: They managed to travel [on a shoestring].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在非常小的預算下成功旅行。

examples.sentence: Living [on a shoestring] can be challenging sometimes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時生活在非常小的預算下會很有挑戰性。

examples.sentence: He started the business [on a shoestring].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他以非常小的預算開始了這個生意。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An expression of approval or praise.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表達贊同或讚揚的方式

examples.sentence: She received a [pat on the back] for her hard work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她因辛勤工作而獲得讚揚。

examples.sentence: The team got a [pat on the back] after winning the championship.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 團隊在贏得冠軍後獲得了鼓勵。

examples.sentence: A little [pat on the back] goes a long way in motivating people.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 小小的讚揚能在激勵人方面有很大的作用。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Ideal or flawless in appearance or condition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在外觀或狀態上理想或完美

examples.sentence: The wedding was [picture perfect].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 婚禮是完美的。
others: make a mountain out of a molehill

examples.sentence: Her garden is [picture perfect].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的花園是理想的。

examples.sentence: They had a [picture perfect] vacation in Hawaii.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在夏威夷度過了一次理想的假期。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Perfectly attractive or aesthetically pleasing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在外觀上完美吸引人或美觀

examples.sentence: The view from the mountain was [picture-perfect].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 山上的風景非常迷人。

examples.sentence: The couple shared a [picture-perfect] moment together.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這對情侶共享了一個完美的時刻。

examples.sentence: Her outfit was [picture-perfect] for the occasion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的服裝在這場合中非常合適。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To deceive someone in a clever way.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用巧妙的方式欺騙某人

examples.sentence: He tried to [pull a fast one] but got caught.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他試圖用巧妙的方式欺騙，但被抓住了。

examples.sentence: They [pulled a fast one] on their friends during the prank.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在惡作劇期間巧妙地欺騙了朋友。

examples.sentence: Don't try to [pull a fast one] on me.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要試圖在我面前耍花招。
others: take the bull by the horns

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stop or limit something from continuing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 阻止或限制某事繼續

examples.sentence: I wish he would [put a lid on it] and stop complaining.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望他能停止抱怨。
others: cross that bridge when you come to it
take it with a grain of salt

examples.sentence: The manager decided to [put a lid on it] after the argument.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過爭論後，經理決定停止這一切。

examples.sentence: We need to [put a lid on it] before things get out of hand.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在事情失控之前，我們需要把事情限制住。
others: go back to the drawing board

meanings.meaning_en_US: Intelligent or very clever.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聰明或非常聰慧

examples.sentence: He's [sharp as a tack] when it comes to mathematics.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在數學方面，他非常聰明。

examples.sentence: She is [sharp as a tack] and always has the right answer.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她聰明過人，總是能找出正確的答案。

examples.sentence: Everyone knows he’s [sharp as a tack] at solving problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每個人都知道他善於解決問題，很聰明。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An encouraging boost to something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某事的鼓舞或促進

examples.sentence: The new project was a [shot in the arm] for the company.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個新項目對公司是個鼓舞。

examples.sentence: Winning the award was a [shot in the arm] for her career.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 獲獎對她的職業生涯是一個鼓舞。

examples.sentence: His support was a [shot in the arm] for the team's morale.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的支持鼓舞了團隊的士氣。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take time to appreciate the beauty of life.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 花時間欣賞生活的美好

examples.sentence: Sometimes it's good to [smell the roses] and relax.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候，花點時間欣賞生活的美好是好事。

examples.sentence: He needs to [smell the roses] rather than rushing through life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他需要花時間欣賞生活的美好，而不是匆匆而過。

examples.sentence: Don't forget to [smell the roses] during your busy day.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在忙碌的一天中，別忘了欣賞生活的美好。
others: keep your back against the wall

meanings.meaning_en_US: To reveal a secret or disclose information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 透露秘密或披露信息

examples.sentence: He accidentally [spilled the beans] about the surprise party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不小心透露了驚喜派對的秘密。

examples.sentence: Don't [spill the beans] before the announcement!
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在公佈之前不要透露秘密！
others: take it with a grain of salt

examples.sentence: I hope you didn't [spill the beans] to anyone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望你沒有對任何人透露這個秘密。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To continue on the current path or plan of action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 繼續當前的路徑或計劃

examples.sentence: Despite challenges, they decided to [stay the course].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管面臨挑戰，他們決定堅持下去。

examples.sentence: It's essential to [stay the course] for long-term success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了長期成功，堅持是至關重要的。

examples.sentence: They must [stay the course] and not give up.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們必須堅持下去，不要放棄。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take a short break or pause.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 短暫休息或暫停

examples.sentence: I needed to [take a breather] after the long meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要在長會議後暫時休息一下。

examples.sentence: Let's [take a breather] before we continue working.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們先短暫休息一下再繼續工作。

examples.sentence: You should [take a breather] if you're feeling overwhelmed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你感到不知所措，應該稍作休息。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a decision to do something difficult or risky.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 決定去做某件困難或冒險的事情

examples.sentence: After much consideration, he decided to [take the plunge].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過深思熟慮，他決定冒險一試。

examples.sentence: She finally [took the plunge] and started her own business.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她最終決定冒險一試，開始自己的生意。

examples.sentence: Sometimes, you just have to [take the plunge] and see what happens.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候，你必須冒險一試，看看會發生什麼。
others: take it with a grain of salt

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something without attracting attention.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在不引起注意的情況下做某事

examples.sentence: He prefers to work [under the radar].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他更喜歡在不被注意的情況下工作。

examples.sentence: She managed to stay [under the radar] while making big moves.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在進行大舉措時成功沒有引起注意。

examples.sentence: Some companies operate [under the radar] to keep their strategies secret.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了保持策略的秘密，有些公司在不引人注意的情況下運營。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In secret or hidden from view, often referring to illicit or unethical practices.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 秘密地或隱匿的，通常指非法或不道德的行為

examples.sentence: They paid him [under the table] to avoid taxes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了避稅，他們暗中支付了他報酬。

examples.sentence: There were rumors of [under the table] deals in the business.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 商界流傳有暗中交易的傳言。

examples.sentence: She accepted a gift [under the table] without reporting it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她接受了一份未申報的秘密贈品。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Right in front of someone, but unnoticed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 就在某人面前，但未被注意

examples.sentence: The solution was right [under your nose], but you missed it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 解決方案就在你的面前，但你卻錯過了它。
others: between a rock and a hard place

examples.sentence: He found his keys [under his nose] on the table.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他發現了就擺在桌子上的鑰匙。
others: let the cat out of the bag

examples.sentence: Sometimes the best opportunities are right [under your nose].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時最好的機會就在你的面前。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To think or use one's intelligence.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 運用你的智慧、思考

examples.sentence: You need to [use your noodle] to solve this puzzle.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要運用你的智慧來解決這個謎題。

examples.sentence: If you [use your noodle], you can come up with a solution.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你運用你的智慧，你可以找到解決辦法。

examples.sentence: Don't just follow along; [use your noodle] and think for yourself.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 別只是隨波逐流，運用你的智慧，為自己思考。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be anxious about the time passing, usually because one wants something to end.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 焦急地看著時間，通常是因為想結束某事

examples.sentence: I can't concentrate in class; I keep [watching the clock].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我在課堂上無法集中注意力，我不斷地看著時間。

examples.sentence: During the long meeting, many participants were [watching the clock].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在漫長的會議中，許多參加者都在焦急地看著時間。

examples.sentence: She began [watching the clock] as the deadline approached.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨著截止日期的臨近，她開始焦急地看著時間。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be careful and cautious because danger may be nearby.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 小心提防，因為可能有危險

examples.sentence: In this business, you always have to [watch your back].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這行，你總是得小心提防。

examples.sentence: You should [watch your back] when working with that team.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 與那個團隊合作時，你應該小心提防。

examples.sentence: She learned to [watch her back] after a few bad experiences.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在幾次不好的經歷之後，她學會了小心提防。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To work very hard.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常努力地工作

examples.sentence: He has been [working like a dog] to meet the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他一直在非常努力地工作以趕上截止日期。

examples.sentence: They [worked like dogs] all summer on the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們整個夏天都在為這個項目非常努力地工作。

examples.sentence: If you [work like a dog], you will surely see results.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你非常努力地工作，你確定會看到成果。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An act that is too ambitious or beyond what is achievable.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一次過於雄心壯志或超出可實現範圍的行為

examples.sentence: The project's demands were viewed as [a bridge too far].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個項目的要求被視為一次過於雄心壯志的行為。

examples.sentence: His proposal was considered [a bridge too far] by the board.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的提議被董事會認為是一次過於野心勃勃的行為。

examples.sentence: They felt trying to expand so quickly was [a bridge too far].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們認為如此快速擴張是一個過於雄心壯志的行為。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In spite of difficulties or challenges.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 儘管面對困難

examples.sentence: She succeeded [against all odds] in the competition.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在比賽中儘管面對困難仍然成功了。

examples.sentence: They managed to finish the project [against all odds].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們設法在困難中完成了這個項目。

examples.sentence: But he persevered [against all odds].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 但他在困難中堅持了下來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In spite of unfavorable circumstances.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 儘管情況不利

examples.sentence: He managed to win the match [against the odds].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在面對不利情況下成功贏得了比賽。

examples.sentence: She achieved her goals [against the odds].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在不利情況下實現了她的目標。

examples.sentence: The team pulled through [against the odds].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該隊在面對不利情況下仍然挺過來了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A situation where previous agreements or conditions are no longer valid.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 之前的協議或條件不再有效的情況

examples.sentence: Once the rules changed, [all bets were off].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦規則改變，之前的所有協議都失效了。

examples.sentence: After the latest developments, [all bets are off].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在最新事件發展後，之前的所有協議都無效了。

examples.sentence: With the new evidence, [all bets are off].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨著新證據的出現，之前的所有協議都失效了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An extremely high cost.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 極其高昂的成本

examples.sentence: That car costs [an arm and a leg].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那輛車的價格高得驚人。

examples.sentence: I can't afford to pay [an arm and a leg] for a vacation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我無法支付高昂的度假費用。

examples.sentence: He paid [an arm and a leg] for his education.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的教育費用高昂。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A subject or issue causing disagreement or conflict.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 引起分歧或衝突的主題或問題

examples.sentence: The new policy became the [apple of discord] among team members.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新政策成為團隊成員之間的爭議焦點。

examples.sentence: Money is often the [apple of discord] in relationships.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 金錢常常是人際關係中的爭議焦點。

examples.sentence: Their disagreement over resources is the [apple of discord].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們對資源的分歧是爭議的焦點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: 24 hours a day; constantly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一天二十四小時；不斷地

examples.sentence: The store is open [around the clock].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這家商店二十四小時開放。

examples.sentence: They worked [around the clock] to finish the project on time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們努力不懈地工作，以便按時完成項目。

examples.sentence: Help is available [around the clock].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有幫助隨時提供。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very confident and brave; not afraid to take risks.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常自信和勇敢；不怕冒險

examples.sentence: She approached the challenge [as bold as brass].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她以非常自信的態度迎接挑戰。

examples.sentence: He spoke [as bold as brass] in front of the crowd.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在群眾面前非常自信地發言。

examples.sentence: They made their decision [as bold as brass].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們以非常自信的方式作出了決定。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very active or busy.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常活躍或繁忙

examples.sentence: She has been [as busy as a bee] preparing for the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她為了活動一直非常忙碌。

examples.sentence: I've been [as busy as a bee] with work lately.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我最近工作非常繁忙。

examples.sentence: He's always [as busy as a bee] during the holiday season.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在假日季節一直非常繁忙。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Perfectly fine; in good condition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 完全好；狀態良好

examples.sentence: After a good rest, I'm [as right as rain].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過良好的休息後，我感覺非常好。

examples.sentence: Her car is [as right as rain] after the repair.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的車在修理後狀態良好。

examples.sentence: He was [as right as rain] after the surgery.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在手術後完全好轉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To refrain from speaking, especially to avoid saying something inappropriate.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持沉默，特別是為了避免說出不當言論

examples.sentence: Sometimes you need to [bite your tongue] and not respond.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時你需要保持沉默，不要回應。

examples.sentence: I had to [bite my tongue] to avoid an argument.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不得不保持沉默以避免爭吵。

examples.sentence: She wished she had learned to [bite her tongue] earlier.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她希望自己能早些學會保持沉默。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be very angry or frustrated, often to the point of losing one's temper.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常生氣或沮喪，通常到失去冷靜的地步

examples.sentence: You can argue [until you're blue in the face], but it won't change anything.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以爭論到非常生氣，但這不會改變任何事情。

examples.sentence: She shouted [until she was blue in the face] trying to get his attention.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她大聲呼喊以至於非常生氣，試圖引起他的注意。

examples.sentence: They could plead [until they were blue in the face] but still wouldn't get a raise.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們可以極其氣憤地懇求，但仍然不會加薪。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A phrase used to conclude a set of instructions or to suggest that something will happen easily.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用來結束一系列指示或建議某事將輕鬆發生的短語

examples.sentence: Just follow these steps, and [bob's your uncle].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 只需遵循這些步驟，事情就會輕鬆解決。

examples.sentence: Set the timer, push the button, and [bob's your uncle].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 設置計時器，按下按鈕，事情就會輕鬆完成。

examples.sentence: Do it this way, and [bob's your uncle] — you'll be successful.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這樣做，一切都會輕鬆成功。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To destroy one's chances of returning to a previous state or position.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 摧毀重返之前狀態或位置的機會

examples.sentence: Don't [burn your bridges] in this job; you might need references later.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這份工作中不要摧毀你的關係；你可能將來需要推薦人。

examples.sentence: If you [burn your bridges] with clients, it can damage your reputation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你與客戶摧毀關係，這可能會損害你的聲譽。

examples.sentence: He realized too late that he had [burned his bridges].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他太晚才意識到他已經摧毀了自己的橋樑。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An urgent or important question that requires an answer.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 迫切或重要的問題，需要一個答案

examples.sentence: The meeting will address the [burning question] of funding.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 會議將討論資金的迫切問題。

examples.sentence: She has a [burning question] about the project's outcome.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她對項目的結果有一個緊迫的問題。

examples.sentence: Everyone is eager to hear the answer to this [burning question].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每個人都渴望聽到這個迫切問題的答案。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make peace; to resolve a disagreement.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 和解；解決爭執

examples.sentence: It's time to [bury the hatchet] and move on.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候和解，向前走了。

examples.sentence: They finally decided to [bury the hatchet] after years of conflict.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過多年的衝突，他們最終決定和解。

examples.sentence: After the argument, they agreed to [bury the hatchet].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 爭吵後，他們同意和解。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To change one's opinion or attitude.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 改變自己的觀點或態度

examples.sentence: After seeing the results, he had to [change his tune].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在看到結果後，他不得不改變自己的看法。

examples.sentence: She often [changes her tune] depending on who she's with.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她常常根據和誰在一起而改變自己的觀點。

examples.sentence: Many people [changed their tune] about the proposal after the presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在演示後，許多人對這個提議改變了看法。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To try to find a way to escape from a difficult situation, even if it is unlikely to help.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 嘗試找到逃脫困境的方法，即使不太可能有幫助

examples.sentence: In desperation, he started to [clutch at straws].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在絕望中，他開始嘗試找到逃脫困境的方法。

examples.sentence: She realized she was just [clutching at straws] when she suggested that idea.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她意識到自己在提出那個想法時只是徒勞掙扎。

examples.sentence: When the results were disappointing, they began to [clutch at straws].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當結果令人失望時，他們開始徒勞掙扎。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To reach a point in a process that is the same as the starting point.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在一個過程中回到起點

examples.sentence: After years of traveling, she felt she had [come full circle].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過多年的旅行，她感覺自己已經回到了起點。

examples.sentence: The story [comes full circle] at the end, revealing its true meaning.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個故事在結尾處又回到了起點，揭示了它的真正意義。

examples.sentence: In reflecting on her career, she realized she had [come full circle].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在回顧她的職業生涯時，她意識到自己已經回到了起點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make someone laugh.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某人發笑

examples.sentence: His jokes always [crack me up].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的笑話總是讓我發笑。

examples.sentence: She has a way of [cracking people up] with her stories.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的故事總能讓人發笑。

examples.sentence: I love comedians who [crack up the audience].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我喜歡能讓觀眾發笑的喜劇演員。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To get to the main point quickly without wasting time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 迅速到達要點而不浪費時間

examples.sentence: Can you [cut to the chase] and tell me what happened?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能直接告訴我發生了什麼事嗎？

examples.sentence: Let's [cut to the chase] and discuss the main issue.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們直接討論主要問題。

examples.sentence: It's time to [cut to the chase] and make a decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候直接下決定了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Someone who argues a controversial point for the sake of debate.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為了辯論而針對爭議性問題發表意見的人

examples.sentence: I'll play [devil's advocate] just to hear your reasoning.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我將扮演反方角色，只是想聽聽你的推理。

examples.sentence: As the [devil's advocate], he challenged everybody’s ideas.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 作為反方角色，他挑戰了每個人的想法。

examples.sentence: She enjoys taking the [devil's advocate] position during discussions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她喜歡在討論中採取反方角色。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To look again in surprise after realizing something unexpected.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 驚訝地再看一眼，因為意識到意外的事情

examples.sentence: I did a [double take] when I saw her in a different outfit.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我看到她穿著不同的衣服時，我驚訝地再看了一眼。

examples.sentence: You might do a [double take] if you see the old building again.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你再次看到那棟老樓，你可能會驚訝地再看一眼。

examples.sentence: He always seems to [do a double take] when I tell him surprising news.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我告訴他驚人的消息時，他總是似乎驚訝地再看一眼。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To not get overly upset or angry about something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某事不必過於生氣或憤怒

examples.sentence: He told me not to [have a cow] over the minor error.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他告訴我不要因為小錯誤而過於生氣。

examples.sentence: Just [don't have a cow]; we can fix it later.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 別太過焦急，我們可以稍後再解決。

examples.sentence: She needs to learn to [not have a cow] about small problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她需要學會對小問題不必過於生氣。

synonyms: don't blow it out of proportion

meanings.meaning_en_US: Until the last moment; very close to the end.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 直到最後一刻；非常接近結束

examples.sentence: The project deadline is [down to the wire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 項目截止日期已經非常接近。

examples.sentence: The race was [down to the wire], with both competitors neck and neck.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 比賽非常接近，兩名競爭者不相上下。

examples.sentence: We're working [down to the wire] to finish on time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們正在非常接近最後期限的情況下努力按時完成。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To reveal shocking or surprising information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 揭露令人震驚或意外的信息

examples.sentence: She [dropped a bombshell] when she announced her resignation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她宣佈辭職時讓人震驚。

examples.sentence: The news report [dropped a bombshell] about the company's scandal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新聞報導揭露了公司的醜聞，令人震驚。

examples.sentence: He [dropped a bombshell] revealing his movie plans.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他揭露了他的電影計劃，讓人震驚。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To eat a lot of food.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 吃很多食物

examples.sentence: He can [eat like a horse] during dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他晚餐時能吃很多。

examples.sentence: After the workout, I tend to [eat like a horse].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 鍛煉後，我通常會吃很多食物。

examples.sentence: When he's hungry, he really [eats like a horse].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他餓的時候，他真的是吃很多。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To fit perfectly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 完美契合

examples.sentence: That dress fits you [like a glove].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那件裙子對你來說完美契合。

examples.sentence: These shoes fit [like a glove].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這雙鞋對我來說完美契合。

examples.sentence: The job description fits my skills [like a glove].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這份工作描述非常契合我的技能。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Something that shows potential but fails to last.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 顯示潛力但無法持久的事物

examples.sentence: His success was just a [flash in the pan].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的成功只是昙花一現。

examples.sentence: The trend proved to be a [flash in the pan].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這一趨勢證明只是一時的現象。

examples.sentence: Many artists are one-hit wonders, a [flash in the pan].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多藝術家只是一夥出了一首好歌的人，昙花一現。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Something that warrants consideration or reflection.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 值得考慮或反思的事情

examples.sentence: The lecture provided plenty of [food for thought].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這次講座提供了很多值得考慮的事情。

examples.sentence: His analysis gave me [food for thought] on the matter.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的分析讓我對此問題有了值得考慮的事情。

examples.sentence: These statistics serve as [food for thought] for our discussion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這些統計數據值得我們在討論中考慮。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be freed from responsibility or obligation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 脫離責任或義務

examples.sentence: He managed to [get off the hook] for the mistake.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他成功免於因這個錯誤而受到責任。

examples.sentence: She was lucky to [get off the hook] after her blunder.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的失誤後能夠逃避責任真是不幸。

examples.sentence: I hope to [get off the hook] with just a warning.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望只得到警告而免除責任。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To fight bravely to the end, even when defeat is imminent.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 即使面臨敗北也要勇敢奮起抵抗到底

examples.sentence: Even though he was losing, he [went down swinging].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 雖然他在失利，但他仍然奮力抵抗。

examples.sentence: She promised to [go down swinging] in her final match.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她承諾在她的最後一場比賽中會奮戰到底。

examples.sentence: They always [go down swinging] when faced with adversity.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 面對困難時，他們總是奮力抵抗到底。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take a risk or make a bold decision.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 冒險或做出大膽決定

examples.sentence: I’m going to [go out on a limb] and invest in that startup.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我要冒險投資那家新創公司。

examples.sentence: If you [go out on a limb], you might find great rewards.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你冒險，你可能會找到巨大的回報。

examples.sentence: She decided to [go out on a limb] and share her unique idea.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定冒險分享她獨特的想法。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To conform to the prevailing circumstances without resisting.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不反抗地適應當前情況

examples.sentence: I decided to [go with the flow] during the trip.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我決定在旅行中隨波逐流。

examples.sentence: Sometimes it’s better to just [go with the flow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候，隨和一些會更好。

examples.sentence: In chaotic situations, I prefer to [go with the flow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在混亂的情況下，我傾向於隨和。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A large payment or bonus given to someone when they leave a company.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 當某人離開公司時給予的豐厚付款或獎金

examples.sentence: He received a [golden handshake] when he retired.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他退休時收到了豐厚的退休金。

examples.sentence: Employees are sometimes offered a [golden handshake] during layoffs.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 員工在裁員時有時會被提供豐厚的遣散費。

examples.sentence: She was happy to receive a [golden handshake] as she exited the company.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她很高興在公司離開時獲得了豐厚的離職金。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To accept a difficult situation with good humor.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以好心情接受困難情況

examples.sentence: Sometimes you just have to [grin and bear it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候你只需以好心情接受。

examples.sentence: In tough times, it's best to [grin and bear it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在困難時期，最好以好心情接受。

examples.sentence: She decided to [grin and bear it] rather than vent her frustrations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定以好心情接受，而不是發洩自己的不滿。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be in a very precarious or uncertain situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於非常危險或不確定的情況

examples.sentence: The project's success is [hanging by a thread].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個項目的成功正在處於危險之中。

examples.sentence: After the accident, his health was [hanging by a thread].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 事故後，他的健康狀況非常危險。

examples.sentence: Their relationship is [hanging by a thread] after the argument.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 爭吵後，他們的關係非常不穩定。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have an enjoyable and lively time, often in a way that takes advantage of a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 享受愉快且活躍的時光，通常是利用一種情況

examples.sentence: The reporters [had a field day] with the scandal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記者們借著這個醜聞享受了愉快的時光。

examples.sentence: The kids [had a field day] at the amusement park.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 孩子們在遊樂園中享受了一天的快樂。

examples.sentence: When the team won, they [had a field day] celebrating.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當球隊獲勝時，他們慶祝得很開心。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have a special affection for someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某人或某事有特別的喜愛

examples.sentence: She has a [soft spot] for animals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她對動物特別有愛。

examples.sentence: I have a [soft spot] for classic movies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我對經典電影特別喜愛。

examples.sentence: He clearly has a [soft spot] for his little sister.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對妹妹顯然特別疼愛。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To wait or pause before taking action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在採取行動之前等待或暫停

examples.sentence: Before you decide, [hold your horses] and think it over.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在你決定之前，暫停一下好好想想。

examples.sentence: She told him to [hold his horses] before making a purchase.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她告訴他在購物前要冷靜一下。

examples.sentence: Let’s [hold our horses] until we get more information.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們等到獲得更多資訊再行動。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To remain silent or refrain from saying something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持沉默或克制不說某事

examples.sentence: You should [hold your tongue] during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該在會議中保持沉默。

examples.sentence: He managed to [hold his tongue] when they were rude.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他們無禮時，他設法保持了沉默。

examples.sentence: Sometimes it's better to [hold your tongue] than to speak.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候保持沉默比發言更好。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a state of agitation, anxiety, or excitement.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於激動、焦慮或興奮的狀態

examples.sentence: She was [hot and bothered] after the long meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過漫長的會議後，她感到煩躁不安。

examples.sentence: He gets [hot and bothered] when discussing politics.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 討論政治時，他會變得焦慮不安。

examples.sentence: The news left me feeling [hot and bothered].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那個消息讓我感到非常焦慮。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a situation that is comfortable and suited to one’s abilities.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於舒適且適合自己能力的情況

examples.sentence: He is [in his element] when he’s working with animals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他跟動物工作時，他會很自在。

examples.sentence: She was [in her element] during the performance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在表演中表現自如。

examples.sentence: They are [in their element] on the basketball court.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在籃球場上如魚得水。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In the same difficult situation as someone else.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 與他人處於相同的困境

examples.sentence: We’re all [in the same boat] with this project’s deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們大家在這個項目的截止日期上面臨著相同的困境。

examples.sentence: During the crisis, they realized they were [in the same boat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在危機期間，他們意識到自己處於相同的困境。

examples.sentence: When it comes to challenges, we’re all [in the same boat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在挑戰面前，我們大家都在同一條船上。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To assert authority and set rules to be followed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 堅定地宣佈權威並設置需遵循的規則

examples.sentence: The teacher decided to [lay down the law] about classroom behavior.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 老師決定對課堂行為制定規則。

examples.sentence: He [laid down the law] regarding late submissions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對延遲提交設置了明確的規則。

examples.sentence: It's time to [lay down the law] in this organization.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候建立這個組織的規則了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Life is a process of experiences and adventures.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 生活是一系列經歷和冒險的過程

examples.sentence: Remember that [life’s a journey], not a destination.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，生活是一段旅程，而非目的地。

examples.sentence: She embraced the ups and downs because [life’s a journey].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她接受生活中的起起伏伏，因為生活是一段旅程。

examples.sentence: Exploring new places shows that [life’s a journey].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 探索新地方表達了生活是段旅程的意義。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Life is too brief to waste time on unimportant things.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 生活太短暫，不應浪費在不重要的事情上

examples.sentence: Remember, [life’s too short] to hold grudges.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，生活太短暫，不應心懷怨恨。

examples.sentence: He quit his job because [life’s too short] to be unhappy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他辭去了工作，因為生活太短暫，不應不快樂。

examples.sentence: They traveled together, saying [life’s too short] for regrets.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們一起旅行，說生活太短暫，不應有遺憾。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To engage in a lifestyle characterized by risky or adventurous behaviors.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 從事以冒險或危險行為為特徵的生活方式

examples.sentence: He loves to [live on the edge] by skydiving every weekend.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他每個週末都喜歡跳傘，體驗冒險生活。

examples.sentence: They often [live on the edge] with extreme sports.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們經常通過極限運動來追求冒險。

examples.sentence: To her, [living on the edge] is all about the thrill.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對她來說，冒險生活全是關於刺激的體驗。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To summarize or give the main point of a longer narrative.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 簡短地總結較長的故事

examples.sentence: To make it simple, [long story short], we didn't win the game.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 簡單來說，總之，我們沒有贏得比賽。

examples.sentence: So, [long story short], she decided to move away.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 所以，簡短地說，她決定搬走。

examples.sentence: In the end, [long story short], they got married.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最後，總之，他們結婚了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Something that is pleasing or agreeable to hear.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聽起來令人愉悅或令人滿意的事物

examples.sentence: Your compliments are [music to my ears].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你的讚美對我來說非常愉快。

examples.sentence: Hearing that I got the job was [music to my ears].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 得知我獲得了工作對我來說非常愉快。

examples.sentence: The news of a pay raise was [music to my ears].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 加薪的消息聽起來非常好。

meanings.meaning_en_US: You must endure struggles or hard work to achieve desired results.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 必須忍受艱辛或辛勤工作才能取得所需的結果

examples.sentence: You have to believe that [no pain, no gain].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你必須相信沒有付出就沒有收穫。

examples.sentence: In training, just remember [no pain, no gain].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在訓練中，請記住，沒有付出就沒有收穫。

examples.sentence: For success, [no pain, no gain] is a crucial mantra.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對於成功來說，沒有付出就沒有收穫是一個重要的信條。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have the same understanding or agreement about something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某事有相同的理解或共識

examples.sentence: We need to ensure we're [on the same page] before the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要確保在會議前有相同的理解。

examples.sentence: To avoid confusion, let's get [on the same page].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了避免混淆，讓我們達成共識。

examples.sentence: It’s important that everyone is [on the same page] about the goals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每個人對目標有相同的理解非常重要。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Beyond one’s ability or understanding; unattainable.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 超過自己能力或理解的範疇；無法獲得

examples.sentence: The job offer was [out of my league] considering my experience.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 考慮到我的經驗，這份工作邀請我覺得是超出我的能力。

examples.sentence: Dating her feels [out of my league].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 追她讓我感覺超出了我的能力範疇。

examples.sentence: This challenge is definitely [out of my league].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個挑戰一定超出了我的能力范疇。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To propose marriage.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 求婚

examples.sentence: He plans to [pop the question] on their anniversary.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他打算在他們的紀念日求婚。

examples.sentence: After years together, he finally [popped the question].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在一起多年後，他終於求婚了。

examples.sentence: She was waiting for him to [pop the question].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在等待他求婚。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very fast; swiftly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常快速；迅速

examples.sentence: He solved the puzzle [quick as a flash].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他非常迅速地解決了這個謎題。

examples.sentence: She finished her exams [quick as a flash].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她迅速完成了考試。

examples.sentence: The cat darted away [quick as a flash].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那隻貓迅速逃離了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lose energy or motivation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 失去精力或動力

examples.sentence: After working for hours, I [ran out of steam].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 工作了幾個小時後，我感到精疲力竭。

examples.sentence: The project [ran out of steam] towards the end.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個項目在最後階段失去了動力。

examples.sentence: She felt like she [ran out of steam] during the marathon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在馬拉松中，她感到精疲力竭。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To refrain from speaking, especially if it is pointless.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 避免說話，特別是如果這是無意義的

examples.sentence: You can [save your breath] when trying to convince him.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 試圖說服他時，你可以不必多說。

examples.sentence: I should have [saved my breath] instead of arguing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我應該避免爭論而保持沉默。

examples.sentence: Just [save your breath]—he won’t listen.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 保持沉默就好，他是聽不進去的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A guess made with little or no information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 幾乎沒有信息的情況下做出的猜測

examples.sentence: My answer was just a [shot in the dark].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我的答案只是個隨意猜測。

examples.sentence: It was a [shot in the dark] to assume they would agree.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 假設他們會同意真的是一個隨意的猜測。

examples.sentence: Guessing the password was a [shot in the dark].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 猜測密碼簡直就是隨意的嘗試。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To sleep very deeply and soundly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 睡得非常沉且安穩

examples.sentence: After the long hike, I [slept like a log].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 長途徒步旅行後，我睡得很沉。

examples.sentence: She was so tired that she [slept like a log] all night.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她太累了，整晚都睡得很沉。

examples.sentence: He always [sleeps like a log] after exercising.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他運動後總是睡得很沉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To remain informed about something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某事保持知情

examples.sentence: It's important to [stay in the loop] about company news.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 保持了解公司新聞非常重要。

examples.sentence: He always tries to [stay in the loop] regarding project developments.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是努力保持了解項目的進展。

examples.sentence: To work effectively, we need to [stay in the loop].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了有效工作，我們需要保持了解狀況。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take a less prominent role or to allow others to take the lead.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 採取次要角色或讓他人領導

examples.sentence: In this project, I will [take a back seat] and let others lead.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這個項目中，我會退居次要位置，讓其他人主導。

examples.sentence: Sometimes it's best to [take a back seat] in discussions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時在討論中，最好是退後一步。

examples.sentence: She prefers to [take a back seat] rather than be in the spotlight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她寧願退居次要，而不是成為焦點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A subject of common discussion or interest in a community.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 社區中常見的話題或關注的主題

examples.sentence: The new cafe has become the [talk of the town].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新開的咖啡館已經成為大家議論的話題。

examples.sentence: Her performance was the [talk of the town] for weeks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的表演成為人們幾個星期來熱議的話題。

examples.sentence: The scandal was the [talk of the town] for months.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這起醜聞幾個月來都是大家茶餘飯後的話題。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To ignore something intentionally.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 故意忽視某事

examples.sentence: Sometimes it's easier to [turn a blind eye] to problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時，對問題視而不見會更容易。

examples.sentence: They chose to [turn a blind eye] to the environmental impacts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們選擇故意忽視環境影響。

examples.sentence: Instead of helping, he decided to [turn a blind eye].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他選擇視而不見，而不是提供幫助。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In plain sight; obvious and easily noticed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 明顯地，很容易被注意到

examples.sentence: The solution was right [under our noses].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 解決方案就在我們眼前。

examples.sentence: They overlooked the plans that were right [under their noses].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們忽視了就在眼前的計劃。

examples.sentence: The clues were [under our noses] all along.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 線索一直就在我們眼前。

meanings.meaning_en_US: The whole amount; everything required or possible.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 所有的一切；所有需要或可能的東西

examples.sentence: He went the [whole nine yards] to prepare for the presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他為準備演示而付出了所有的努力。

examples.sentence: They did the [whole nine yards] for the charity event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們為慈善活動做了完全的準備。

examples.sentence: For her wedding, she planned the [whole nine yards].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對於她的婚禮，她計劃了所有的細節。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A futile pursuit or endeavor.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 徒勞的追求或努力

examples.sentence: Searching for that lost file turned into a [wild goose chase].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 尋找那個丟失的文件變成了一場徒勞的追尋。

examples.sentence: His attempts to find out the truth became a [wild goose chase].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他試圖找出真相的努力成為了一場徒勞的追尋。

examples.sentence: The detective's investigation was a [wild goose chase].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 偵探的調查是一場徒勞的追尋。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A general overview or perspective from a high vantage point.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 從高處觀察的整體概覽或透視

examples.sentence: From the top of the hill, we had a [bird's-eye view] of the valley.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 從山頂上，我們可以俯瞰到山谷的全貌。

examples.sentence: The presentation provided a [bird's-eye view] of the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這次報告為這個項目提供了全面的視角。

examples.sentence: We need a [bird's-eye view] of the situation to make a decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要對這種情況有一個整體概覽，以便做出決定。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a race against time; under time pressure.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在與時間賽跑；在時間壓力之下

examples.sentence: They are working [against the clock] to meet the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在與時間賽跑，以趕上截止日期。

examples.sentence: Completing the project [against the clock] was stressful.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在時間壓力下完成這個項目讓人感到壓力。

examples.sentence: She finished her work [against the clock].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在時間緊迫的情況下完成了工作。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In contrast to what is normal or expected.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 與正常或預期的情況相反

examples.sentence: His opinions often go [against the grain] of popular belief.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的觀點往往與大眾的信念相悖。

examples.sentence: To innovate, you often have to go [against the grain].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 要實現創新，往往需要逆潮流而行。

examples.sentence: Choosing sustainability can sometimes feel [against the grain].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 選擇可持續性有時會感到逆流而動。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a more advantageous position than others.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 比他人更具優勢的位置

examples.sentence: By planning ahead, she’s [ahead of the game].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過提前計劃，她在競爭中佔據了主動。

examples.sentence: Staying informed keeps you [ahead of the game].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 保持了解使你在競爭中占據優勢。

examples.sentence: He invests early to stay [ahead of the game].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他及早投資以保持優勢。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Everyone's participation is needed to address a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 每個人都需要參與以應對某種情況

examples.sentence: During the emergency, it was [all hands on deck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在緊急情況下，大家都需要參與。

examples.sentence: For the project deadline, we need [all hands on deck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了這個項目的截止日期，我們需要大家的合作。

examples.sentence: When the storm hit, it was [all hands on deck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當暴風雨來臨時，大家都需參與。

meanings.meaning_en_US: The concept of exact retribution or payback.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 精確報復或報仇的概念

examples.sentence: He believes in [an eye for an eye] when it comes to justice.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在正義的問題上，他相信以牙還牙的理念。

examples.sentence: The law often follows [an eye for an eye] principle.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 法律通常遵循以牙還牙的原則。

examples.sentence: In conflicts, she prefers [an eye for an eye].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在衝突中，她偏好以牙還牙的解決方式。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Near; upcoming soon.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 靠近；即將到來

examples.sentence: The holiday is just [around the corner].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 假期即將到來。

examples.sentence: Spring is [around the corner], so get ready.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 春天即將來臨，準備好吧。

examples.sentence: The deadline is [around the corner], so hurry up!
examples.translation_zh_TW: 截止日期快到了，快點！

meanings.meaning_en_US: Unable to see; very blind.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 無法看到；非常失明

examples.sentence: Without my glasses, I am [as blind as a bat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 沒有我的眼鏡，我就是毫無視力。

examples.sentence: He walked around [as blind as a bat] in the dark.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在黑暗中，他四處走動就像一隻失明的蝙蝠。

examples.sentence: After the accident, she felt [as blind as a bat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 事故後，她感到非常失明。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very happy or euphoric, often due to intoxication.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 因醉酒而高興或極度快樂

examples.sentence: She was [as high as a kite] after winning the lottery.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 中獎後，她興奮得像隻快樂的風箏。

examples.sentence: After the party, he felt [as high as a kite].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 派對後，他感到無比快樂。

examples.sentence: Winning the game left them [as high as a kite].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 贏得比賽讓他們興奮不已。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very smooth; without any difficulty.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常光滑；毫不費力

examples.sentence: The operation went [as smooth as silk].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 手術進行得非常順利。

examples.sentence: Her presentation was [as smooth as silk].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的簡報進行得毫不費力。

examples.sentence: The negotiation went [as smooth as silk].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 談判過程非常順利。

meanings.meaning_en_US: The shortest distance between two points, measured in a straight line.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 兩點之間的最短直線距離

examples.sentence: The town is only 10 miles away, [as the crow flies].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個小鎮距離只有10英里，按最短直線距離計算。

examples.sentence: He prefers to calculate distances [as the crow flies].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他更喜歡以最短距離計算距離。

examples.sentence: The destination isn't too far, [as the crow flies], but the roads can be tricky.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 目的地並不太遠，按最短距離計算，但道路可能很棘手。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a state of extreme frustration or confusion from not knowing what to do.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感到極度沮喪或困惑，不知道該怎麼辦

examples.sentence: After trying to solve the problem for hours, she was [at her wit’s end].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在努力解決問題幾個小時後，她感到極度沮喪。

examples.sentence: He threw his hands up in frustration, clearly [at his wit’s end].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他無奈地舉起手，顯然是感到極度沮喪。

examples.sentence: The teacher was [at her wit’s end] with the noisy students.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 老師對這群吵鬧的學生感到極度沮喪。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A naive or inexperienced person who is vulnerable in a complex or dangerous situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在複雜或危險情況下，天真或缺乏經驗的人

examples.sentence: Without any preparation, he felt like a [babe in the woods] at his first job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 沒有任何準備，他在第一份工作中感覺就像一個天真的人。

examples.sentence: When she moved to the big city, she quickly realized she was a [babe in the woods].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她搬到大城市時，她迅速意識到自己是一個天真的人。

examples.sentence: The new intern was a real [babe in the woods] during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議中，這位新實習生是一個真正的天真者。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To continue to discuss or pursue a topic or issue that has already been settled or is no longer relevant.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 持續討論或追求已經解決或不再相關的主題或問題

examples.sentence: There's no need to [beat a dead horse], we've already made a decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 沒有必要再討論這個問題，我們已經做出決定了。

examples.sentence: She felt like they were [beating a dead horse] during the endless debate.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這場無止境的辯論中，她覺得他們在抓住不放。

examples.sentence: Stop [beating a dead horse] and let’s focus on the new plan.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 別再無意義地討論了，我們來專注於新計劃。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To understand a deeper or hidden meaning that is not explicitly stated.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 理解未明言的更深或隱含的意義

examples.sentence: If you read [between the lines], you can see her true feelings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你細讀，可以看出她的真實感受。

examples.sentence: The report is very formal, but if you look [between the lines], there's a warning.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這份報告很正式，但如果你仔細看，有一個警告。

examples.sentence: Reading [between the lines] can help you understand the author's intent.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 細讀可以幫助你理解作者的意圖。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To destroy relationships or opportunities that cannot be repaired.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 摧毀無法修復的關係或機會

examples.sentence: You don’t want to [burn your bridges] with your boss.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不想和你的老闆撕破臉。

examples.sentence: He realized that quitting without notice could [burn his bridges] with the company.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他意識到不提前通知辭職可能會斷絕他與公司的關係。

examples.sentence: Once you leave a job, think carefully so you don't [burn your bridges].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦你離開工作，仔細考慮，以免斷絕與他人的關係。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be discovered while doing something wrong or illegal.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在做錯事或違法時被發現

examples.sentence: He was [caught in the act] of stealing cookies from the jar.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在偷擺放餅干的罐子時被發現。

examples.sentence: The kids were [caught in the act] of graffitiing the wall.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這些孩子在塗鴉牆壁時被發現。

examples.sentence: She was [caught in the act] of cheating during the exam.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在考試中作弊時被發現。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be caught in the act of committing a crime or misdeed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在犯下罪行或不端行為時被當場抓住

examples.sentence: He was [caught red-handed] trying to break into the car.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在試圖闖入汽車時被當場抓住。

examples.sentence: The thief was [caught red-handed] by the security guard.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 小偷被保安當場抓住。

examples.sentence: She was [caught red-handed] with the stolen money.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在持有被偷的錢時被抓住。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To dominate or control the entire market for a particular product or service.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 主導或控制特定產品或服務的整個市場

examples.sentence: The company managed to [corner the market] on electric cars.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該公司成功主導了電動車市場。

examples.sentence: By introducing a unique product, they hope to [corner the market].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過推出獨特產品，他們希望主導市場。

examples.sentence: To [corner the market], you need to innovate continuously.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 要主導市場，你需要持續創新。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a situation where one cannot move or succeed; ineffective or abandoned.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於無法移動或成功的狀態；無效或被丟棄

examples.sentence: Without funding, the project is [dead in the water].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果沒有資金，這個項目就是無法推進了。

examples.sentence: The negotiations were [dead in the water] after the last meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在上次會議後，談判陷入了僵局。

examples.sentence: If we don't act now, our plan will be [dead in the water].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果我們現在不採取行動，我們的計劃將無法實施。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To refuse to change your mind or to be obstinate.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 拒絕改變主意或固執己見

examples.sentence: He tends to [dig his heels in] during discussions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在討論中傾向於堅持自己的觀點。

examples.sentence: When confronted, she [dug her heels in] and refused to budge.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 面對質疑時，她堅定不移地站在自己的立場。

examples.sentence: You can't [dig your heels in] if you want to work effectively in a team.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想在團隊中有效工作，就不能固執己見。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A competitive environment where people act ruthlessly to achieve their goals.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 人們為達成目標而無情競爭的環境

examples.sentence: In a [dog-eat-dog world], only the strongest survive.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在競爭激烈的世界中，只有最強者才能生存。

examples.sentence: She quickly learned that it’s a [dog-eat-dog world] in corporate business.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她迅速意識到企業界是一個競爭激烈的世界。

examples.sentence: You need to be prepared for a [dog-eat-dog world] if you want to succeed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想成功，必須準備好迎接激烈競爭的世界。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Feeling sad or depressed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感到悲傷或沮喪

examples.sentence: She has been [down in the dumps] since her team lost the game.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 自從她的球隊輸掉比賽後，她一直感到沮喪。

examples.sentence: After his breakup, he was [down in the dumps] for weeks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 分手後，他沮喪了好幾個星期。

examples.sentence: I’ve been feeling [down in the dumps] lately due to work stress.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最近因為工作壓力，我感到沮喪。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Looking sad or unhappy.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 看起來悲傷或不快

examples.sentence: He walked around [down in the mouth] after receiving the bad news.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在收到壞消息後，他愁眉苦臉地走來走去。

examples.sentence: You can tell she’s [down in the mouth] just by looking at her expression.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 光看她的表情就能知道她看起來不高興。

examples.sentence: Everyone was [down in the mouth] after the disappointing performance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每個人在表現失望之後都看起來很沮喪。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have an angry or fierce expression.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 面露憤怒或兇狠的表情

examples.sentence: She walked in with a [face like thunder] after the argument.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 爭吵後她面露怒容地走進來。

examples.sentence: His [face like thunder] scared the children.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他憤怒的表情嚇到了孩子們。

examples.sentence: You could see she was upset just by looking at her [face like thunder].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你光看她憤怒的表情就知道她很不高興。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be ignored or not heard.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 被忽視或聽不見

examples.sentence: Her advice seemed to [fall on deaf ears] during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的建議在會議中似乎被忽視了。

examples.sentence: Unfortunately, my warnings about the deadline [fell on deaf ears].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不幸的是，我對截止日期的警告沒有被傾聽。

examples.sentence: When he pleaded for help, his cries [fell on deaf ears].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他懇求幫助時，他的呼救聲被忽視了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who is uncomfortable or out of place in their surroundings.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在環境中感到不舒服或不合適的人

examples.sentence: He felt like a [fish out of water] at the fancy gala.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這場華麗的舞會上，他感到格格不入。

examples.sentence: Moving to a new city can make you feel like a [fish out of water].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 搬到一個新城市會讓你感到不習慣。

examples.sentence: In the boardroom, she seemed like a [fish out of water].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議室裡，她看起來格格不入。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To pursue one's feelings and desires rather than following others' opinions.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 追尋自己的感受和願望而不跟隨他人的意見

examples.sentence: You should always [follow your heart] when making decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在做決定時，你應該始終追隨自己的內心。

examples.sentence: She decided to [follow her heart] and pursue her passion for art.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定追隨自己的內心，追求對藝術的熱情。

examples.sentence: It’s important to [follow your heart] and do what makes you happy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 追隨自己的心聲，做讓自己快樂的事是很重要的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To enjoy or derive pleasure from something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 享受或從某事中獲得快樂

examples.sentence: I really [get a kick out of] watching comedies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我真的很享受看喜劇。

examples.sentence: She [gets a kick out of] trying new foods.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她喜歡嘗試新食物。

examples.sentence: He always [gets a kick out of] telling funny stories.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是喜歡講搞笑的故事。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To regain energy or motivation after fatigue.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在疲倦後重新獲得活力或動力

examples.sentence: After a short break, I finally [got a second wind] and finished the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 短暫休息後，我終於重新獲得了動力，完成了項目。

examples.sentence: He always [gets a second wind] when he's close to the finish line.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他接近終點時，他總能重新獲得能量。

examples.sentence: Once she had some water, she [got a second wind] and ran the final lap.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦她喝水，她便重新獲得了活力，跑完了最後一圈。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To avoid someone or something intentionally.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 故意避開某人或某事

examples.sentence: It's best to [give a wide berth] to that drama.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最好的辦法是遠離那場戲劇。

examples.sentence: I decided to [give a wide berth] to the noisy crowd.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我決定避開那群嘈雜的人群。

examples.sentence: When it comes to politics, I tend to [give a wide berth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 談到政治時，我通常會保持距離。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To fail spectacularly or to end in disaster.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以壯觀失敗或災難結束

examples.sentence: The project went [down in flames] due to lack of support.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於缺乏支持，這個項目以失敗告終。

examples.sentence: After a series of mistakes, the proposal [went down in flames].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過一系列錯誤，這個提案以失敗告終。

examples.sentence: His reputation [went down in flames] after the scandal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在醜聞之後，他的名聲以失敗告終。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make more effort than is expected or necessary.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 付出超出預期或必要的努力

examples.sentence: She always [goes the extra mile] to help her friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是額外付出以幫助朋友。

examples.sentence: If you want to succeed, you need to [go the extra mile].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想成功，你需要多付出一些努力。

examples.sentence: They are known for [going the extra mile] for customer satisfaction.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們以努力提升顧客滿意度而聞名。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Rushing can lead to mistakes or poor quality.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 急躁可能導致錯誤或質量差

examples.sentence: I learned that [haste makes waste] after my rushed essay was full of errors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我在匆忙寫的論文裡滿是錯誤後，領悟到急躁會導致浪費。

examples.sentence: When you're in a hurry, remember that [haste makes waste].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你匆忙時，記住急躁會導致浪費。

examples.sentence: Her experience taught her that [haste makes waste] in the workplace.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的經驗告訴她，工作中的急躁會導致浪費。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To wait or be patient, especially before taking action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 等候或保持耐心，尤其是在採取行動之前

examples.sentence: You need to [hold your horses] before making a decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在做出決定之前，你需要保持耐心。

examples.sentence: Hold your horses! It's not time to leave yet.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 等等！還不是離開的時候。

examples.sentence: Before you send that email, [hold your horses] and think it through.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在發送那封郵件之前，稍等並好好考慮。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Recently printed or published; brand new.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 最近印刷或出版；全新

examples.sentence: I just got this [hot off the press] news article last night.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我昨晚剛得到這篇新鮮出爐的新聞文章。

examples.sentence: This book is [hot off the press] and just released this week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這本書是本周剛剛出版的。

examples.sentence: Stay updated with what's [hot off the press].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請隨時關注最新消息。

meanings.meaning_en_US: All at once; in a single action or event.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一舉完成；一次性行動或事件

examples.sentence: She finished her degree and got a job [in one fell swoop].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她一舉完成學位並找到工作。

examples.sentence: The company cut costs and laid off workers [in one fell swoop].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這家公司一次性削減成本並裁員。

examples.sentence: They cleaned the house [in one fell swoop] before the guests arrived.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在客人到達之前，他們一次性清理了房子。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a situation that is too difficult to handle or manage.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於無法應對或管理的情況

examples.sentence: He realized he was [in over his head] with that project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他意識到自己在那個項目中難以應對。

examples.sentence: I felt [in over my head] when I took on too many responsibilities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我承擔過多責任時，我感到無法應對。

examples.sentence: Sometimes people get [in over their heads] with finances.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時人們在財務方面感到不堪重負。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To remain optimistic and positive, especially during difficult times.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在困難時期保持樂觀和積極

examples.sentence: Even when times are tough, you should [keep your chin up].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 即使在艱難時期，你也應該保持樂觀。

examples.sentence: She always tells her friends to [keep their chins up] during hard times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是告訴朋友在艱難時期保持積極心態。

examples.sentence: It’s hard to [keep your chin up] after facing setbacks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在遭遇挫折後保持樂觀是很困難的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who is lively and energetic, making social gatherings enjoyable.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個充滿活力和能量的人，讓社交聚會變得愉快

examples.sentence: He's always the [life of the party] with his jokes and stories.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是以他的笑話和故事成為聚會的中心。

examples.sentence: At the wedding, she was the [life of the party], dancing and laughing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在婚禮上，她是聚會的靈魂，跳舞和歡笑。

examples.sentence: To be the [life of the party], you need to interact with everyone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 想要成為聚會裡的靈魂，你需要與每個人互動。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To allow others to behave as they wish, without interference.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 允許他人按他們的意願行事，無需干預

examples.sentence: He believes in [live and let live], letting everyone choose their own paths.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他相信活讓活的理念，讓每個人都選擇自己的路。

examples.sentence: In her opinion, it's best to [live and let live] to avoid conflicts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她看來，最好讓每個人自由行事，以避免衝突。

examples.sentence: If we all practiced [live and let live], the world would be more peaceful.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果我們都遵循活讓活的理念，世界會更和平。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lose one's sanity or ability to think clearly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 失去理智或清晰思考的能力

examples.sentence: After hours of confusion, he felt like he would [lose his marbles].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過幾個小時的困惑，他覺得自己快要失去理智了。

examples.sentence: She is afraid she might [lose her marbles] with all the work pressure.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她擔心在工作壓力下她會失去理智。

examples.sentence: If this goes on, I may just [lose my marbles] entirely.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果這繼續下去，我可能會完全失去理智。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Tasks or goals that are easy to achieve.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 容易實現的任務或目標

examples.sentence: We should start with the [low-hanging fruit] before tackling tougher issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們應該先從容易的任務入手，再處理更棘手的問題。

examples.sentence: By focusing on [low-hanging fruit], we can make quick progress.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過專注於容易實現的目標，我們可以迅速取得進展。

examples.sentence: Targeting [low-hanging fruit] helps us build momentum.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 將重點放在容易實現的目標上幫助我們建立勢頭。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be unable to act or make a decision due to restrictions.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 由於限制而無法行動或做出決定

examples.sentence: I'm sorry, but [my hands are tied] on this matter; I can't help.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 抱歉，但在這件事上我無能為力，我無法幫助。

examples.sentence: He felt like [his hands were tied] by company policy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他感到公司政策讓他無能為力。

examples.sentence: When it comes to budgets, [my hands are tied].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在預算方面，我的選擇有限。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stop a problem at an early stage before it gets worse.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在問題惡化之前及早阻止

examples.sentence: We need to [nip this in the bud] before it escalates.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要在問題升級之前及早阻止。

examples.sentence: If you see any issues, [nip them in the bud].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你發現任何問題，則及早解決。

examples.sentence: Nipping it in the bud is crucial for avoiding bigger troubles.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 及早阻止對避免更大麻煩至關重要。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Something that one does not like or prefer.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 自己不喜歡或不喜好的事物

examples.sentence: Surfing isn’t really [my cup of tea]; I prefer hiking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 衝浪並不是我喜歡的活動；我更喜歡徒步旅行。

examples.sentence: That kind of music is [not my cup of tea].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那種音樂並不是我的喜好。

examples.sentence: While some enjoy reading mystery novels, it’s just [not my cup of tea].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 雖然有些人喜歡閱讀懸疑小說，但那麻煩我就不太喜歡了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Unexpected or surprising, often in an unusual way.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 意想不到或驚訝，通常以不尋常的方式

examples.sentence: Her suggestion came [out of left field] and caught everyone off guard.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的建議讓每個人都感到驚訝，完全出乎意料。

examples.sentence: I was surprised by the news; it was totally [out of left field].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我對這消息感到驚訝；實在太出乎意料了。

examples.sentence: The ending of the movie was [out of left field] and left me speechless.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 電影的結局完全出乎意料，讓我無言以對。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Said to indicate that one will never allow something to happen.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表示某事永遠不會發生

examples.sentence: You can’t go to that party, [over my dead body]!
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不可以去那個派對，除非我死才行！

examples.sentence: They want to cut down the old tree in the park? Not [over my dead body]!
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們想要砍掉公園裡的老樹？絕對不可能！

examples.sentence: He will make changes to the rules, [over my dead body].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他想改變規則，除非我死才行。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To engage in risky or dangerous behavior.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 從事有風險或危險的行為

examples.sentence: By ignoring the rules, you're [playing with fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 忽視規則的話，你是在玩火。

examples.sentence: He knows that skipping class is [playing with fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他知道翹課就是在玩火。

examples.sentence: She’s [playing with fire] by getting involved in that feud.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 參與那一場爭吵的話，她正是在玩火。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Able to respond quickly; alert and ready to act.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 能迅速反應；警覺並隨時行動

examples.sentence: He’s always [quick on the draw] when it comes to solving problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在解決問題上，他總是反應迅速。

examples.sentence: During the meeting, she was [quick on the draw] with her ideas.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 會議中，她迅速提出了她的點子。

examples.sentence: You need to be [quick on the draw] if you want to succeed in this role.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想在這個角色中成功，你需要反應敏捷。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Immediately or without any delay.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 立即或毫不拖延

examples.sentence: She was able to start the project [right off the bat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她能夠立即開始這個項目。

examples.sentence: They told us the rules [right off the bat].
