meanings.meaning_en_US: To keep talking about the same thing without making progress.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不停地討論同樣的事情卻沒有取得進展

examples.sentence: We seem to [go around in circles] during this discussion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在這次討論中似乎不停地討論同樣的事情。

examples.sentence: Let’s stop [going around in circles] and make a decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們停止蕩來蕩去，做個決定。

examples.sentence: If we keep [going around in circles], we'll never finish the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果我們不停地討論同樣的事情，我們將永遠無法完成這個項目。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A difficult or unpleasant fact or situation that must be accepted.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 必須接受的困難或不愉快的事實或情況

examples.sentence: The news of the layoffs was a [hard pill to swallow] for everyone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 裁員的消息對每個人來說都是一個困難的真相。

examples.sentence: Accepting that you have to move away is a [hard pill to swallow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 接受你必須搬走的事實確實很困難。

examples.sentence: Realizing he broke the rules was a [hard pill to swallow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 意識到他違反了規則是一個困難的事實。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have a personal motive for doing something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 有私心的動機來做某事

examples.sentence: I trust her, but I know she has an [axe to grind] about the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我信任她，但我知道她對這個項目有私心。

examples.sentence: He always seems to have an [axe to grind] in every discussion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在每次討論中似乎總有私心。

examples.sentence: It's clear she has an [axe to grind] when talking about her former employer.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在談論她的前雇主時明顯有私心。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be very busy or occupied with something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常忙碌或被某事佔據

examples.sentence: She has her hands full with three kids at home.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在家裡有三個孩子，因此非常忙碌。

examples.sentence: I can't take on another project; I have my hands full.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不能再接手另一個項目；我非常忙碌。

examples.sentence: During the holidays, retailers usually have their hands full.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在假期期間，零售商通常非常忙碌。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In control of a situation or in a position of power.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 控制局勢或處於權力地位

examples.sentence: After the promotion, she feels like she’s [in the driver’s seat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 升遷後，她感覺自己控制著局勢。

examples.sentence: Being the team leader puts you [in the driver’s seat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 成為隊長使你掌控局勢。

examples.sentence: He loves being [in the driver’s seat] during negotiations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他喜歡在談判中控制局勢。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stay out of trouble or remain in good standing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 避免麻煩或保持良好地位

examples.sentence: If you want to avoid problems, just [keep your nose clean].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想避免問題，最好保持低調。

examples.sentence: He always tries to [keep his nose clean] at work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是試著在工作中保持良好地位。

examples.sentence: To avoid family drama, it's best to [keep your nose clean].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了避免家庭糾紛，最好保持低調。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To think carefully about the potential consequences of an action before acting.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在行動之前仔細考慮行動的潛在後果

examples.sentence: It's wise to [look before you leap] when making big decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在做出重大決策時，仔細考慮是明智的。

examples.sentence: You should always [look before you leap] in financial matters.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在財務方面，你應該總是先考慮後果。

examples.sentence: If you don’t [look before you leap], there can be serious consequences.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你不先考慮後果，可能會有嚴重的後果。

meanings.meaning_en_US: The ability to wait calmly in the face of frustration or adversity.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在面對挫折或逆境時，保持冷靜的能力

examples.sentence: In negotiations, remember that [patience is a virtue].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在談判中，請記住耐心是一種美德。

examples.sentence: Developing skills takes time; [patience is a virtue].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 發展技能需要時間；耐心是一種美德。

examples.sentence: When dealing with difficult customers, keep in mind that [patience is a virtue].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在面對困難的顧客時，記住耐心是一種美德。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To pay a very high price for something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為某物支付非常高的價格

examples.sentence: I had to [pay through the nose] for those concert tickets.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不得不為那些音樂會門票支付非常高的價格。

examples.sentence: They always [pay through the nose] for their rent in the city.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在市中心的租金總是非常高。

examples.sentence: If you want quality, you might have to [pay through the nose].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想要質量，你可能需要支付非常高的價格。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To spoil someone’s plans or fun.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 破壞某人的計劃或樂趣

examples.sentence: I didn’t mean to [rain on your parade], but that idea won't work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不是故意要破壞你的計劃，但那個主意不可行。

examples.sentence: He always manages to [rain on my parade].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是能夠破壞我的計劃。

examples.sentence: It felt like everyone was trying to [rain on my parade] after I got promoted.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我升遷後，感覺每個人都在努力破壞我的計劃。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Special treatment or hospitality for an important guest.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對重要嘉賓的特殊款待或接待

examples.sentence: The VIP guests received [red carpet treatment] at the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這次活動中，貴賓客人受到了特殊的款待。

examples.sentence: At the hotel, celebrities often enjoy [red carpet treatment].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在酒店，名人經常享受特殊的款待。

examples.sentence: During the gala, we provided [red carpet treatment] for our sponsors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這次晚會中，我們為贊助商提供了特殊的款待。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To keep money for future use, particularly for emergencies.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為未來的使用，尤其是緊急情況而儲蓄

examples.sentence: It's a good idea to [save for a rainy day] and put some money away.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儲蓄以備不時之需是一個好主意，存一些錢。

examples.sentence: She advised him to [save for a rainy day] when he started working.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她建議他在開始工作時儲蓄以備不時之需。

examples.sentence: Many people try to [save for a rainy day] by cutting their spending.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多人通過減少支出來儲蓄以備不時之需。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become deeply involved in something; to really engage with something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 深入地參與某事；真正投入某事

examples.sentence: I can't wait to [sink my teeth into] this new project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我迫不及待想深入參與這個新項目。

examples.sentence: She really wants to [sink her teeth into] her research.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她真的想深入參與她的研究。

examples.sentence: Once I finish my current tasks, I will [sink my teeth into] the new proposal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦我完成目前的任務，我就會深入參與這個新提案。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To remain neutral or non-committal in a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在情況中保持中立或不表態

examples.sentence: You can’t keep [sitting on the fence]; you need to make a decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不能保持中立；你需要做出決定。

examples.sentence: In arguments, he tends to [sit on the fence].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在爭論中，他往往保持中立。

examples.sentence: She’s been [sitting on the fence] about the issue for too long.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在這個問題上保持中立太久了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To spread rapidly or quickly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 迅速或快速地擴散

examples.sentence: The news [spread like wildfire] across the internet.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個消息在網路上迅速擴散。

examples.sentence: Rumors about the scandal [spread like wildfire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有關醜聞的謠言迅速傳播。

examples.sentence: The new trend [spread like wildfire] among young people.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個新趨勢在年輕人中迅速流行開來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take action or responsibility when needed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在需要時採取行動或承擔責任

examples.sentence: When the team needed a leader, he [stepped up to the plate].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當團隊需要一位領導者時，他承擔了責任。

examples.sentence: It's time for everyone to [step up to the plate] and contribute.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候讓每個人承擔責任並做出貢獻了。

examples.sentence: She always [steps up to the plate] when challenges arise.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當面臨挑戰時，她總是勇於承擔責任。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An opportunity has passed and is no longer available.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 機會已經過去，不再可用

examples.sentence: If you didn't apply for the job on time, [that ship has sailed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你沒有按時申請這份工作，那個機會已經過去了。

examples.sentence: The chance to invest in that project is gone; [that ship has sailed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 投資該項目的機會已經消失；那艘船已經開走了。

examples.sentence: Trying to reconcile is too late; [that ship has sailed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 試圖和解已經太晚了；那艘船已經開走了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Everything possible; the entire extent.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 所有的一切；整個範圍

examples.sentence: For his birthday, she did [the whole nine yards] to make it special.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了他的生日，她做了所有的一切以讓它特別。

examples.sentence: They went [the whole nine yards] to ensure the project's success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們為了確保項目的成功做了所有的一切。

examples.sentence: If you're going to do it, you might as well go [the whole nine yards].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你要做，就應該全力以赴。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To change one's behavior or attitude for the better.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 改變自己的行為或態度，變得更好

examples.sentence: After his mistakes, he decided to [turn over a new leaf].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在他的錯誤之後，他決定改變自己的行為。

examples.sentence: She wants to [turn over a new leaf] and start fresh.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她想改變自己的行為並重新開始。

examples.sentence: To make amends, he decided to [turn over a new leaf].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了彌補，他決定改變自己的行為。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A share of the profits or benefits from an activity.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 從活動中獲得的利潤或收益的份額

examples.sentence: He's looking to get [a piece of the action] in the new business venture.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他想在這個新商業計畫中分一杯羹。

examples.sentence: Investors want [a piece of the action] from successful startups.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 投資者希望從成功的創業公司中獲得收益。

examples.sentence: She’s excited to be involved and get [a piece of the action].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她很高興能參與其中並分一杯羹。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very intelligent or clever.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常聰明或機靈

examples.sentence: She is [as bright as a button] and always helps others.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她非常聰明，總是幫助他人。

examples.sentence: The student is [as bright as a button] in his studies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這名學生在學業上非常聰明。

examples.sentence: You can always count on him; he’s [as bright as a button].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你總是可以依賴他；他非常聰明。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Calm and composed, especially in a difficult situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持冷靜和鎮定，特別是在困難情況下

examples.sentence: Even during the crisis, he remained [as cool as a cucumber].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 即使在危機中，他仍然保持冷靜。

examples.sentence: She is [as cool as a cucumber] when faced with tough decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 面對艱難的決定時，她保持冷靜。

examples.sentence: He stays [as cool as a cucumber] in stressful situations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在壓力大的情況下，他保持冷靜。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very light in weight.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 重量非常輕

examples.sentence: This fabric is [as light as a feather], perfect for summer.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這種布料輕盈無比，非常適合夏天。

examples.sentence: The balloon felt [as light as a feather] in my hand.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 氣球在我手中感覺輕盈無比。

examples.sentence: I love how [as light as a feather] the jacket feels.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我喜歡這件外套輕盈無比的感覺。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very fast.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常快

examples.sentence: He solved the puzzle [as quick as lightning].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他非常快地解決了這個謎題。

examples.sentence: She reacted [as quick as lightning] to the unexpected news.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她對意外的消息反應非常快。

examples.sentence: The car sped down the road [as quick as lightning].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這輛車以極快的速度駛下公路。

word: at the end of the day

meanings.meaning_en_US: Ultimately; when everything is considered.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 最終；在考慮所有情況時

examples.sentence: At the end of the day, it’s about making the right choice.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最終，這是關於做出正確的選擇。

examples.sentence: At the end of the day, we have to acknowledge our limitations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最終，我們必須承認我們的限制。

examples.sentence: At the end of the day, everyone deserves respect.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最終，每個人都應該得到尊重。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stay away from something or someone very deliberately.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常故意地避免某事或某人

examples.sentence: He avoids that restaurant [like the plague] after the bad service.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在遭遇差勁的服務後，他非常故意地避開那家餐廳。

examples.sentence: She [avoids like the plague] anyone who spreads rumors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她非常故意地避開任何散播謠言的人。

examples.sentence: I [avoid like the plague] negative people.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我非常故意地避開消極的人。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a difficult or desperate situation with no options.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於困難或絕望的情況，沒有選擇

examples.sentence: With nowhere to turn, they felt their [backs against the wall].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 無路可退，他們感到處於困境中。

examples.sentence: When faced with deadlines, it's like having your [back against the wall].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當面臨截止日期時，就像是處於困境中。

examples.sentence: Feeling your [back against the wall], they fought with all their might.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 感到處於困境中，他們全力以赴地作戰。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A remark that seems like a compliment but is actually negative or insulting.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聽起來像讚美卻實際上是負面或侮辱性的話

examples.sentence: His comment was a [backhanded compliment] disguised as praise.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的評論是一個伪裝成讚美的背面讚美。

examples.sentence: She often gives [backhanded compliments] to be funny.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她經常以開玩笑的方式給出背面讚美。

examples.sentence: A [backhanded compliment] can hurt more than open criticism.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 背面讚美可能比公開的批評更具傷害性。

meanings.meaning_en_US: It is your turn to take action or make a decision.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 輪到你採取行動或做出決定

examples.sentence: I've done my part; now the [ball is in your court].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我已經盡了我的努力；現在輪到你採取行動。

examples.sentence: The [ball is in your court] regarding the next steps.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 關於下一步的行動，現在輪到你決定。

examples.sentence: Once I send the proposal, the [ball will be in your court].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦我發送提案，現在輪到你採取行動。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a difficult situation where one is at a disadvantage.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於一種不利的困境中

examples.sentence: After missing the deadline, he found himself [behind the eight ball].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在錯過截止日期後，他發現自己處於一種不利的困境中。

examples.sentence: She’s always [behind the eight ball] because of her poor planning.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於她的糟糕計畫，她總是處於不利的狀態。

examples.sentence: When you're [behind the eight ball], it's hard to make progress.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你處於不利的位置時，很難取得進展。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To boast or brag about one’s achievements.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 吹噓或自誇自己的成就

examples.sentence: He loves to [blow his own trumpet] after winning awards.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在獲獎後，他很喜歡自誇。

examples.sentence: She’s always [blowing her own trumpet] about her latest project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是自誇她最新的專案。

examples.sentence: I don’t want to [blow my own trumpet], but I think I did a great job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不想自誇，但我認為我做得很好。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To work late into the night.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 熬夜工作

examples.sentence: She had to [burn the midnight oil] to meet the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了趕上截止日期，她必須熬夜工作。

examples.sentence: He often [burns the midnight oil] during exam season.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在考試季節，他經常熬夜工作。

examples.sentence: If you want to succeed, sometimes you have to [burn the midnight oil].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想成功，有時必須熬夜工作。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A quiet period before a time of chaos or difficulty.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 混亂或困難之前的寧靜時期

examples.sentence: The office was quiet; it felt like the [calm before the storm].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 辦公室很安靜；這種感覺就像混亂前的寧靜。

examples.sentence: Before the big presentation, there was a sense of [calm before the storm].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在大演示之前，有一種混亂前的寧靜感。

examples.sentence: It’s just the [calm before the storm] before the deadline rush.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這只是截止日期前的寧靜時期。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To fail to meet expectations or requirements.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 未能滿足期望或要求

examples.sentence: He just can’t [cut the mustard] in high-pressure situations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在高壓情況下，他無法滿足期望。

examples.sentence: She recognized that she can’t [cut the mustard] in this role.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她意識到自己無法在這個角色中達到期望。

examples.sentence: If you can’t [cut the mustard], you might consider a different job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你無法滿足期望，你可以考慮換一份工作。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A sense of grievance or resentment.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不滿或怨恨的感覺

examples.sentence: He always seems to have a [chip on his shoulder] about his past.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他似乎總是對過去有些不滿。

examples.sentence: Stop having a [chip on your shoulder] and just let it go.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 別再對此心懷不滿，放下吧。

examples.sentence: If you walk around with a [chip on your shoulder], people will notice.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你心懷怨恨，人們會注意到。

word: cost an arm and a leg

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be very expensive.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常昂貴

examples.sentence: That new car [costs an arm and a leg].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那輛新車非常昂貴。

examples.sentence: The renovation [cost an arm and a leg] but it was worth it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 翻新花費非常昂貴，但值得。

examples.sentence: These designer shoes [cost an arm and a leg].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這雙設計師鞋子非常昂貴。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be upset about something that has already happened and cannot be changed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對已經發生且無法改變的事情感到沮喪

examples.sentence: There's no point in [crying over spilled milk] after the mistake.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在錯誤之後，沒有意義再對已經發生的事情沮喪。

examples.sentence: She kept [crying over spilled milk] instead of moving on.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她一直對已經發生的事情沮喪，而不是向前邁進。
others: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: Stop [crying over spilled milk] and focus on the future.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 停止對已經發生的事情沮喪，專注於未來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To describe something that is simple to say but more difficult to accomplish.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 形容說起來簡單，但實際上很難完成的事情

examples.sentence: Quitting smoking is [easier said than done].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 戒煙說起來容易，但做起來難。

examples.sentence: It's [easier said than done] to remain calm in stressful situations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在壓力情況下保持冷靜，說起來容易，但做起來難。

examples.sentence: Saving money is [easier said than done] when there are so many temptations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在有如此多誘惑時，存錢說起來容易，但做起來難。
others: hit the nail on the head

meanings.meaning_en_US: Everyone will have a moment of success or good fortune.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 每個人都會有成功或好運的時刻

examples.sentence: Don't worry, [every dog has his day] eventually.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不用擔心，每個人都會有成功的時刻。

examples.sentence: He'll get his chance; [every dog has his day].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他會有機會的；每個人都會有成功的時刻。
others: let the cat out of the bag

examples.sentence: [Every dog has his day], so keep trying.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每個人都會有成功的時刻，所以繼續努力。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have a strong intuition or feeling about something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某事有強烈的直覺或感覺

examples.sentence: I can [feel it in my bones] that something good is about to happen.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我有直覺，感覺好事即將發生。

examples.sentence: She [feels it in her bones] that he is the one.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她有直覺，他就是那個人。

examples.sentence: I don't know why, but I just [feel it in my bones].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不知道為什麼，但我就是有這種感覺。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become very upset or angry about something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某事感到非常不快或憤怒

examples.sentence: There's no need to [get bent out of shape] over small mistakes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對小錯誤感到不快是沒有必要的。

examples.sentence: He tends to [get bent out of shape] when plans change.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當計劃改變時，他容易感到不快。

examples.sentence: Try not to [get bent out of shape] over what they said.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 試著不要因為他們說的話而感到不快。
others: make a mountain out of a molehill

meanings.meaning_en_US: To say something that has been bothering you.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 說出一直困擾著你的事情

examples.sentence: You should [get it off your chest] and talk about your feelings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該說出你的感受。

examples.sentence: It's helpful to [get it off your chest] with a friend.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 與朋友談論困擾有幫助。

examples.sentence: She finally [got it off her chest] after weeks of stress.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在幾周的壓力之後，她終於說出心裡話。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To organize oneself or one's affairs more effectively.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 更有效地組織自己或事務

examples.sentence: You need to [get your act together] if you want to succeed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想要成功，你需要組織好自己。

examples.sentence: It's time to [get your act together] before the deadlines hit.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在截止日期來臨之前，是時候組織好自己了。

examples.sentence: She finally [got her act together] and started studying regularly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她終於開始有規律地學習了。
others: make it up as you go

meanings.meaning_en_US: To dismiss or reject someone, often from a job.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 解雇或拒絕某人，通常是從工作中

examples.sentence: They decided to [give him the boot] after he was late too often.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在他經常遲到後，他們決定解雇他。

examples.sentence: She was [given the boot] for not meeting the performance targets.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於未達到表現目標，她被解雇了。

examples.sentence: In this company, you can easily [get the boot] for mistakes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這家公司，因為錯誤你可以輕易被解雇。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be very busy or occupied with something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常忙碌或被某事佔據

examples.sentence: I really [have my hands full] with work this week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我這周真的非常忙碌。

examples.sentence: She [has her hands full] with three kids at home.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在家裡有三個孩子，非常忙碌。

examples.sentence: They [had their hands full] with the event preparations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們忙著活動準備，沒有其他時間。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Certain actions or situations require cooperation from two parties.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 某些行為或情況需要雙方的合作

examples.sentence: You can't blame just one person; [it takes two to tango].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不能只責怪一個人；某些情況需要雙方的合作。

examples.sentence: In relationships, [it takes two to tango] to resolve issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在關係中，某些情況需要雙方合作來解決問題。

examples.sentence: [It takes two to tango] when it comes to making decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在做決策時，某些情況需要雙方合作。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To adopt a popular activity or trend.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 採用一種流行的活動或趨勢

examples.sentence: Many companies are [jumping on the bandwagon] of eco-friendly products.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多公司正在採用環保產品這一流行趨勢。

examples.sentence: Don't just [jump on the bandwagon]; think for yourself.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要只是隨大流；要為自己思考。

examples.sentence: Once the fad started, everyone [jumped on the bandwagon].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦潮流開始，大家都隨之而來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be extremely startled or shocked.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常驚訝或震驚

examples.sentence: I nearly [jumped out of my skin] when I heard the loud noise.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我聽到那聲響時，差點嚇得我驚跳。

examples.sentence: He [jumped out of his skin] when the surprise party was revealed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當驚喜派對揭曉時，他嚇得差點跳起來。

examples.sentence: The sudden movement made her [jump out of her skin].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 突然的動作嚇得她差點跳起來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be watchful and alert.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持警惕和警覺

examples.sentence: [Keep your eyes peeled] for any signs of trouble.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 注意任何麻煩的跡象。

examples.sentence: You should [keep your eyes peeled] while walking in the city.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在城市裡走路時，你應該保持警覺。

examples.sentence: I always [keep my eyes peeled] for good deals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我總是保持警惕，尋找好交易。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To avoid interfering in a situation that is currently calm.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 避免干擾當前平靜的情況

examples.sentence: Sometimes it's best to [let sleeping dogs lie] and not bring up past issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候最好不要提起過去的問題，避免引起爭端。

examples.sentence: I decided to [let sleeping dogs lie] instead of arguing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我決定不再爭論，避免干擾當前平靜的情況。

examples.sentence: It's better to [let sleeping dogs lie] when the situation is delicate.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當情況微妙時，最好不要干擾。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Sons often resemble their fathers in behavior, appearance, or traits.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 兒子往往在行為、外貌或特徵上與父親相似

examples.sentence: He started playing football just like his dad; [like father, like son].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他開始像他爸爸一樣踢足球；兒子往往與父親相似。

examples.sentence: [Like father, like son]; both of them are great cooks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 父子倆都是廚藝高手；兒子往往在行為上和父親相似。

examples.sentence: His son is just as stubborn as he is; [like father, like son].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的兒子和他一樣固執；兒子往往在特徵上和父親相似。
others: the apple doesn't fall far from the tree
like two peas in a pod

synonyms: the apple doesn't fall far from the tree

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make someone extremely angry.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 讓某人非常生氣

examples.sentence: His rude comments [made my blood boil].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的無禮評論讓我非常生氣。

examples.sentence: Seeing injustice [makes my blood boil].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 看到不公正的事情讓我非常生氣。

examples.sentence: The unfair treatment [made her blood boil].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不公平的對待讓她非常生氣。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An explanation for actions that seem chaotic or random.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對看起來混亂或隨機的行為的解釋

examples.sentence: At first glance, it looks chaotic, but there's a [method to the madness].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 乍一看，看起來混亂，但這行為是有理由的。

examples.sentence: Sometimes there really is a [method to the madness] behind the decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候，決策背後其實是有理據的。

examples.sentence: [There's a method to the madness]; you just have to look closely.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這行為背後是有理由的，只需要仔細觀察。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do everything possible to achieve something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不惜一切努力實現某事

examples.sentence: I would [move heaven and earth] for my children's happiness.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我會不惜一切努力讓我的孩子們幸福。

examples.sentence: They [moved heaven and earth] to find a cure for the disease.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們不惜一切努力查找治療此病的方法。

examples.sentence: She would [move heaven and earth] to achieve her dreams.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她願意不惜一切努力去實現她的夢想。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To argue against a position for the sake of debate.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為了辯論而反對某種立場

examples.sentence: Just to stir up the conversation, I'll [play devil's advocate] tonight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 今晚我會故意反對來激起討論。

examples.sentence: He likes to [play devil's advocate] during meetings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他喜歡在會議上為了辯論而反對某種立場。

examples.sentence: I often [play devil's advocate] to help others consider different viewpoints.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我經常反對某種立場，以幫助他人考慮不同的觀點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make the right decisions in order to succeed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 做出正確的決策以取得成功

examples.sentence: If you [play your cards right], you could get the promotion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你做出正確的決策，你可能會得到晉升。

examples.sentence: He knows how to [play his cards right] in business.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他知道如何在商業中做出正確的決策。

examples.sentence: You need to [play your cards right] to win the game.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要做出正確的決策以贏得比賽。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To rain very heavily.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 下著很大的雨

examples.sentence: It's [raining cats and dogs] outside; we should stay in.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 外面下著大雨，我們應該待在裡面。

examples.sentence: They decided to cancel the picnic because it was [raining cats and dogs].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們決定取消野餐，因為下著很大的雨。

examples.sentence: Don't forget your umbrella; it's [raining cats and dogs] right now.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要忘了你的雨傘；現在下著很大的雨。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be in a difficult situation where you have to choose between two equally bad options.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於困難的情況中，不得不在兩個同樣糟糕的選項之間做出選擇

examples.sentence: I felt like I was [between a rock and a hard place] while making that decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在做那個決定時，我感覺自己處於困境中。

examples.sentence: Choosing between the two jobs left him [between a rock and a hard place].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在兩個工作之間的選擇讓他感到困惑。
others: enjoying the best of both worlds

examples.sentence: She was [between a rock and a hard place] when her friend asked for a favor.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她的朋友要求幫忙時，她感到很為難。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To adapt to difficult circumstances.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 適應艱難的情況

examples.sentence: It's important to [roll with the punches] when things don't go as planned.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當事情不如預期時，適應是很重要的。

examples.sentence: She decided to [roll with the punches] and make the best of the situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定適應這個情況，並盡量做到最好。

examples.sentence: Being flexible and able to [roll with the punches] is key to success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 靈活應變和適應艱難的情況是成功的關鍵。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a painful situation worse by reminding someone of it.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過提醒某人加劇痛苦的情況

examples.sentence: Bringing up her old mistakes is just [rubbing salt in the wound].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 提起她的舊錯誤只是在加劇她的痛苦。

examples.sentence: Don't [rub salt in the wound] by reminding him of his failures.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要通過提醒他的失敗讓他更加痛苦。

examples.sentence: She felt like he was [rubbing salt in the wound] when he mentioned her loss.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他提到她的損失時，她覺得他只是在讓她更加痛苦。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To begin working hard on something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 開始努力工作

examples.sentence: It's time to put your [shoulder to the wheel] and start the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候開始努力工作來進行這個項目了。

examples.sentence: They need to [shoulder to the wheel] if they want to meet the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果他們想達到截止日期，就需要開始努力工作。

examples.sentence: You must [shoulder to the wheel] to accomplish your goals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你必須開始努力工作才能實現你的目標。

meanings.meaning_en_US: The final problem in a series of issues that leads to a strong reaction.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一系列問題中的最後一個，導致強烈反應

examples.sentence: After all the delays, [that’s the last straw] for me.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在所有的延遲之後，這對我來說是最後一根稻草。

examples.sentence: He felt [that’s the last straw] when they canceled again.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他們再次取消時，他感到這是最後一根稻草。

examples.sentence: When they raised the prices again, he thought, [that’s the last straw].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他們再次漲價時，他覺得這是最後一根稻草。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An additional positive aspect to an already good situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 已經好的情況下額外的正面方面

examples.sentence: Winning the competition was great, and the prize money was [the icing on the cake].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 贏得比賽很棒，而獎金則是錦上添花。

examples.sentence: Her promotion was wonderful, but the surprise party was [the icing on the cake].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的晉升非常好，但驚喜派對則是錦上添花。

examples.sentence: A beautiful day at the beach, and finding seashells was [the icing on the cake].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在海灘渡過美好的一天，發現海螺則是它的錦上添花。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To think creatively or unconventionally.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 創造性或非常規地思考

examples.sentence: To solve the problem, we need to [think outside the box].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了解決問題，我們需要創造性地思考。

examples.sentence: The best solutions often come when we [think outside the box].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最佳解決方案通常是當我們非傳統思考時出現的。

examples.sentence: If we want innovative ideas, we have to [think outside the box].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果我們想要創新的想法，就必須創造性地思考。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Emotional pain will lessen over time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 隨著時間推移，情感上的痛苦會減少

examples.sentence: [Time heals all wounds], and one day you'll feel better.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 時間會治癒所有傷痛，總有一天你會覺得好些。

examples.sentence: It's hard now, but [time heals all wounds].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 現在很困難，但時間會治癒所有傷痛。

examples.sentence: In the end, [time heals all wounds] no matter how deep.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最後，不論傷口多麼深，時間會治癒一切。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To aggravate a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 讓情況更糟

examples.sentence: He forgot the meeting, and to [make matters worse], he lost his phone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他忘記了會議，更糟的是，他丟了手機。

examples.sentence: She was late, and to [make matters worse], it was raining.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她遲到了，更糟的是，還在下雨。

examples.sentence: The project failed, and to [make matters worse], the budget was cut.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 項目失敗了，更糟的是，預算被削減了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: One's actions will have consequences.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個人的行為會有後果

examples.sentence: If you treat people poorly, [you reap what you sow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你對人不好，將會有後果。

examples.sentence: [You reap what you sow]; so make sure to act kindly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一個人的行為會有後果；所以確保友善行事。

examples.sentence: She learned that [you reap what you sow] after her actions caught up to her.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的行為遭到報應後，她明白了每個行為都將有後果。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To tease or joke with someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 開玩笑或逗某人

examples.sentence: Are you serious or [are you just pulling my leg]?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你是認真的，還是只是在開玩笑？

examples.sentence: He was just [pulling my leg] when he said he won the lottery.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他說他贏了彩票時，只是在開玩笑。

examples.sentence: I can't tell if you're [pulling my leg] or telling the truth.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我分不清你是在開玩笑還是真話。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A seemingly negative situation that results in a positive outcome.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 看似負面的情況最終導致正面的結果

examples.sentence: Losing that job was [a blessing in disguise] because I found a better one.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 失去那份工作是一個福祉，因為我找到了更好的工作。

examples.sentence: Her injury turned out to be [a blessing in disguise] as it led her to a new skill.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的受傷其實是一個福祉，因為它讓她發現了一項新技能。

examples.sentence: That delay was [a blessing in disguise] because it gave me time to prepare.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那次延遲其實是一個福祉，因為它給了我準備的時間。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person or thing with potential that is not yet refined or developed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 潛力尚未磨練或發展的人或事物

examples.sentence: He's just [a diamond in the rough] who needs some guidance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他只是一個有潛力但還需要指導的人。

examples.sentence: That artist is [a diamond in the rough] with a unique style.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那位藝術家是一個潛力股，擁有獨特風格。

examples.sentence: With proper training, she can be [a diamond in the rough].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過培訓，她可以成為一個充滿潛力的人。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To discuss private or sensitive issues publicly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 公開討論私人或敏感的問題

examples.sentence: It's not a good idea to [air your dirty laundry] in public.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在公共場合討論私人問題不是個好主意。

examples.sentence: She tends to [air her dirty laundry] on social media.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她傾向於在社交媒體上公開私人問題。

examples.sentence: Addressing issues is fine, but don't [air your dirty laundry] in front of strangers.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 解決問題是好的，但不要在陌生人面前公開私人事務。

meanings.meaning_en_US: There are many different ways to achieve the same goal.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 有很多不同的方法來達成相同的目標

examples.sentence: No matter what method you choose, [all roads lead to rome].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 無論你選擇哪種方法，都能達到相同的目標。

examples.sentence: Effective learning can take many forms; [all roads lead to rome].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有效的學習可以有多種形式；有很多不同的方法來達成同樣的目標。

examples.sentence: [All roads lead to rome], so find what works best for you.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有很多不同的方法來達成相同的目標，所以找出最適合你的方法。

synonyms: many routes lead to the same result

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a mistake or misdirect one's efforts.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 犯錯或錯誤地引導努力

examples.sentence: If you think I took your book, you're [barking up the wrong tree].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你認為我是偷你的書，那你就錯了。

examples.sentence: He realized he was [barking up the wrong tree] with his accusations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他意識到他的指控錯了方向。

examples.sentence: If you complain to her, you're [barking up the wrong tree].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你向她抱怨，那你就錯了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: It is better to be late than to never arrive at all.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 遲到總比不來好

examples.sentence: He finally submitted his assignment; [better late than never].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他終於提交了作業，遲到總比不來好。

examples.sentence: She arrived late to the party, but [better late than never].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她遲到了派對，但遲到總比不來好。

examples.sentence: Completing the report late is okay; [better late than never].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 遲交報告也沒關係；遲到總比不來好。

synonyms: better late than not at all

meanings.meaning_en_US: Everyone will have their moment of success or recognition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 每個人都會有成功或被認可的時刻
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 不如意事總是十之八九

examples.sentence: I believe [every dog has its day], and our team will win eventually.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我相信每個人都會有成功的時刻，我們的團隊終將取勝。
others: a stitch in time saves nine

examples.sentence: After years of effort, he finally proved that [every dog has its day].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過多年的努力，他終於證明了每個人都會有成功的時刻。

examples.sentence: It's frustrating, but I know [every dog has its day] for me too.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這令人沮喪，但我知道我也會有成功的時刻。

meanings.meaning_en_US: It is wiser to be cautious than to take risks that might lead to regret.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 謹慎比冒險更明智，以免後悔

examples.sentence: I decided to double-check my work because [better safe than sorry].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我決定再次檢查我的工作，因為謹慎比冒險更明智。
others: the early bird catches the worm
hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: I wear a helmet when biking; it’s [better safe than sorry].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我騎自行車時戴頭盔；謹慎比冒險更明智。

examples.sentence: When traveling abroad, I always keep copies of my documents; [better safe than sorry].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在國外旅遊時，我總會保存文件副本；謹慎比冒險更明智。
others: a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush

meanings.meaning_en_US: A difficult or unpleasant situation that one must accept.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 必須接受的困難或不愉快的情況

examples.sentence: Losing the game was a [bitter pill to swallow] for the players.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 輸掉比賽對球員們來說是一個令人難以接受的事。

examples.sentence: Finding out the truth was a [bitter pill to swallow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 得知真相是一個必須接受的困難事。

examples.sentence: Sometimes, facing the truth is a [bitter pill to swallow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時，面對現實是一個必須接受的困難事。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be inferior or not as good as someone or something else.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 比不上某人或某事物

examples.sentence: Her skills [can’t hold a candle to] those of a professional chef.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的技能比不上專業廚師的技能。

examples.sentence: That movie [can’t hold a candle to] the one we watched last week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那部電影比不上我們上週看的那部。
others: a penny saved is a penny earned

examples.sentence: This product [can’t hold a candle to] the original.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個產品比不上原版。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who resembles their parent in some way.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在某種程度上像父母的人

examples.sentence: He's a [chip off the old block]; he looks just like his father.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他真是父母的翻版，長得和他父親一模一樣。

examples.sentence: Her talent for music shows she's a [chip off the old block].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她對音樂的天賦顯示她在某種程度上像她的父母。

examples.sentence: You can tell he’s a [chip off the old block] by how he acts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以從他的行為中看出他真是父母的翻版。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become more sociable and open.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得更外向和開放

examples.sentence: He finally [came out of his shell] and joined the group activities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他終於變得更加開放，參加了團體活動。

examples.sentence: After a few weeks, she began to [come out of her shell].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 幾周後，她開始變得更外向。

examples.sentence: It takes time for some people to [come out of their shell].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對某些人而言，需要時間才能變得更開放。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don't expect something to happen.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要期待某事發生

examples.sentence: If you think they will change their mind, don’t [hold your breath].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你認為他們會改變主意，別抱太大希望。

examples.sentence: I wouldn’t [hold my breath] for him to call back.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不會期待他回電話。

examples.sentence: You can ask, but don’t [hold your breath].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以問，但不要期待結果。

word: get a foot in the door

meanings.meaning_en_US: To gain entry into a situation or organization, often with the hope of advancing further.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 獲得進入某個情況或組織的機會，通常希望能進一步發展

examples.sentence: An internship can help you [get a foot in the door] in the industry.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 實習可以幫助你在這個行業獲得機會。

examples.sentence: She is hoping this event will help her [get a foot in the door].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她希望這個活動能幫助她獲得機會。

examples.sentence: Networking is crucial to [getting a foot in the door].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 建立聯繫對獲得機會至關重要。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To organize oneself or improve one’s performance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 讓自己有條理或改善自己的表現

examples.sentence: It's time to [get your act together] and focus on your studies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候讓自己有條理，專注於學業了。

examples.sentence: He needs to [get his act together] if he wants to pass the class.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果他想通過這門課，他需要改進自己。

examples.sentence: After several failed attempts, she finally [got her act together].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過幾次失敗後，她終於讓自己有條理。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Looking sick or unwell.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 看起來生病或不健康

examples.sentence: He looked a bit [green around the gills] after the long flight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在長途飛行後，他看起來有點不舒服。

examples.sentence: She felt [green around the gills] after eating that spoiled food.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 吃了壞掉的食物後，她感到不舒服。

examples.sentence: He’s been looking [green around the gills] lately; maybe he’s catching a cold.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最近他看起來不太好，也許他快感冒了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To change one's opinion or feelings about something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 改變對某事的看法或感受

examples.sentence: After discussing it, he had a [change of heart] about moving away.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 討論後，他對搬走的看法發生了變化。

examples.sentence: She usually decides quickly, but this time she had a [change of heart].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她通常決定很快，但這次她卻改變了主意。

examples.sentence: His [change of heart] surprised everyone in the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的改變讓會議上的每個人都感到驚訝。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To start something energetically and successfully.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以精力充沛和成功的方式開始某事

examples.sentence: When she joined the team, she [hit the ground running] from day one.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她加入團隊時，她從第一天開始就全力以赴。

examples.sentence: We need someone who can [hit the ground running] in this project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要能在這個項目中迅速起步的人。

examples.sentence: I love that she [hits the ground running] and takes charge immediately.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我喜歡她一開始就能迅速展開並立即掌控局面。

meanings.meaning_en_US: It is obvious and does not need to be mentioned.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 這是顯而易見的，無需提及

examples.sentence: It [goes without saying] that we should respect each other.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們應該互相尊重，這是顯而易見的。

examples.sentence: It [goes without saying] that she is very talented.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她非常有才華，這是顯而易見的。

examples.sentence: There are certain rules that [go without saying] in the workplace.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在工作場所有些規則是顯而易見的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To remain calm and not show emotion in difficult situations.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在困難的情況下保持冷靜，不表現情緒

examples.sentence: Even during the crisis, she managed to [keep a stiff upper lip].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 即使在危機期間，她也設法保持冷靜。

examples.sentence: In tough times, it’s important to [keep a stiff upper lip].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在艱難的時期，保持冷靜是很重要的。

examples.sentence: He [kept a stiff upper lip] throughout the entire ordeal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在整個磨難中，他保持了冷靜。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To forgive someone and forget about past offenses.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 寬恕某人並忘記過去的冒犯

examples.sentence: It's time to [let bygones be bygones] and move on.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候放下過去，繼續前進了。

examples.sentence: She decided to [let bygones be bygones] after their argument.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在爭吵後，她決定放下過去的事情。

examples.sentence: Best friends often [let bygones be bygones] after a disagreement.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最好的朋友經常在分歧後選擇放下過去。

word: like two peas in a pod

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be very similar or close.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常相似或親近

examples.sentence: The twins are [like two peas in a pod]; they do everything together.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這對雙胞胎就像一個豆莢裡的兩粒豌豆；他們什麼都一起做。

examples.sentence: My best friend and I are [like two peas in a pod].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我和我的好朋友就像一對相似的豌豆。

examples.sentence: They think alike and dress alike; they are truly [like two peas in a pod].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們思想一致，穿著相同；他們真的是非常相似的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To speak candidly or openly about something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 坦率或公開地談論某事

examples.sentence: She [made no bones about it] when she expressed her opinion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在表達意見時毫不隱瞞。

examples.sentence: He [made no bones about it] and told his boss he wanted a raise.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不掩飾地告訴他的老闆他想升職。

examples.sentence: Make no bones about it; this project needs more funding.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 毫無疑問；這個項目需要更多的資金。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To not interfere in someone else's affairs.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不干涉別人的事務

examples.sentence: You should [mind your own business] and let her handle it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該不插手她的事，讓她自己處理。

examples.sentence: Please [mind your own business] instead of prying into my life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請不干涉我的事，而是管好自己的事。

examples.sentence: It's best to [mind your own business] when it comes to rumors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當涉及謠言時，最好不干涉他人的事務。

word: off the top of my head

meanings.meaning_en_US: To say something without thinking about it too much.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在沒有充分思考的情況下說出某事

examples.sentence: Off the top of my head, I can't remember his name.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在沒有多加思考的情況下，我想不起他的名字。

examples.sentence: I can’t give you an answer [off the top of my head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我無法在沒有多加思考的情況下給你答案。

examples.sentence: He spoke [off the top of his head] during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議中，他隨口而出。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To operate with very little money.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用很少的錢運作

examples.sentence: They managed to travel the world [on a shoestring budget].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們設法以極少的預算環遊世界。

examples.sentence: Starting a business [on a shoestring budget] can be challenging.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在有限的預算下創業可能會很具挑戰性。

examples.sentence: She is known for creating great meals [on a shoestring budget].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她因為能夠以極少的預算做出美味的餐點而聞名。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To share similar thoughts and feelings.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 分享類似的想法和感受

examples.sentence: The two partners are [on the same wavelength] regarding their goals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這對伴侶在目標上是志同道合的。

examples.sentence: We often find ourselves [on the same wavelength] in discussions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在討論時經常發現自己有共鳴。

examples.sentence: Being [on the same wavelength] is essential for teamwork.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在團隊工作中，共識是至關重要的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Once you have had a bad experience, you are cautious in similar situations.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 經歷過不好的事情後，會在類似情況中變得謹慎

examples.sentence: After his last relationship, he is [once bitten, twice shy].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在他的上一段關係之後，他變得謹慎小心。

examples.sentence: She was [once bitten, twice shy] after her job loss.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在失去工作後，她變得小心謹慎。

examples.sentence: He is often [once bitten, twice shy] when investing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在投資時，他經常變得小心謹慎。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Continually practicing a skill will lead to improvement.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 持續練習某項技能會導致提升

examples.sentence: If you want to improve, remember that [practice makes perfect].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想改善，記住跟隨你練習的，才能變得完美。

examples.sentence: She believes that [practice makes perfect] in sports.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她相信在運動中，持續的練習會使人進步。

examples.sentence: He quotes, [practice makes perfect], whenever he teaches.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在教學中總是引用，持續的練習會使人進步。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do everything possible to achieve a goal.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 竭盡所能地去達成一個目標

examples.sentence: We will [pull out all the stops] to finish this project on time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們將竭盡所能按時完成這個項目。

examples.sentence: She pulled out all the stops for her wedding.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在婚禮上竭盡全力。

examples.sentence: The team [pulled out all the stops] to win the championship.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該隊竭盡全力贏得了冠軍。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To regain self-control after being upset or distressed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在感到不安或痛苦後重新掌控自己

examples.sentence: You need to [pull yourself together] before the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要在會議之前重新掌控自己。

examples.sentence: After a few minutes, she managed to [pull herself together].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 幾分鐘後，她設法重新掌控自己。

examples.sentence: It's crucial to [pull yourself together] when things get tough.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當事情變得艱難時，重新掌控自己是至關重要的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To understand the hidden meaning or implications of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 理解某事隱含的意義或含義

examples.sentence: You need to [read between the lines] to understand her true feelings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要理解她真實的感受。

examples.sentence: In his book, he wants readers to [read between the lines].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在他的書中，他希望讀者理解隱含的意思。

examples.sentence: Often, when negotiating, you must [read between the lines].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在談判中，你通常需要理解隱藏的意義。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do a favor for someone with the expectation of receiving a favor in return.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為某人做一件事，期望得到回報

examples.sentence: If you [scratch my back], I'll help you with your project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你幫我，我會幫你完成你的項目。

examples.sentence: The idea is to [scratch each other’s backs] in this business deal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這筆交易的想法是互相幫助。

examples.sentence: He always believes in [scratching backs] to get things done.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他始終相信互幫互助可以推進工作。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To receive the worse part of a deal or situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在交易或情況中得到最差的一方

examples.sentence: In this agreement, I feel like I got the [short end of the stick].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這項協議中，我覺得自己受到不公平對待。

examples.sentence: Every time they negotiate, he ends up with the [short end of the stick].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每次他們談判時，他總是得到了不利的一方。

examples.sentence: She often gets the [short end of the stick] when her coworkers conspire.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她的同事們合謀時，她經常受到不公平對待。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A hidden secret or embarrassing fact.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 隱藏的秘密或尷尬的事實

examples.sentence: Everyone has a [skeleton in the closet] they don’t want others to find out.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每個人都有不想讓別人知道的秘密。

examples.sentence: Her past was a [skeleton in the closet] that she tried to hide.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的過去是她試圖隱藏的秘密。

examples.sentence: He feared that his [skeletons in the closet] would ruin his reputation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他擔心他隱藏的秘密會毀了他的名聲。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To offend someone, especially in their area of expertise.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 冒犯某人，特別是在他們的專業領域

examples.sentence: Be careful not to [step on her toes] when discussing her project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 討論她的項目時，小心不要冒犯到她。

examples.sentence: You really [stepped on my toes] when you interrupted me.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你打斷我時，你真的冒犯了我。

examples.sentence: He often [steps on others' toes] without realizing it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他經常在不知不覺中冒犯到他人。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take a risk by speaking up or acting.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通過發言或行動冒險

examples.sentence: He was [sticking his neck out] by proposing a new idea at the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在會議上提議新點子時是在冒險。

examples.sentence: She doesn’t mind [sticking her neck out] for her beliefs.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她不介意為她的信念冒險。

examples.sentence: You’ll have to [stick your neck out] if you want to make changes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想進行改變，你必須冒險。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A small, visible part of a much larger problem.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 問題中一小部分可見的部分

examples.sentence: What you see here is just [the tip of the iceberg]; the real issues are much deeper.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你在這裡看到的只是一小部分；真正的問題要深得多。

examples.sentence: These complaints are likely just [the tip of the iceberg].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這些投訴可能只是冰山一角。

examples.sentence: If you think this is bad, remember it’s only [the tip of the iceberg].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你認為這很糟糕，那要記住這只是冰山一角。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Something from the past that is no longer important.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 過去的事不再重要

examples.sentence: What happened between us is now just [water under the bridge].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們之間發生的事現在只是過去的事情。

examples.sentence: Let's not dwell on the past; it's all [water under the bridge].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們不要再沉迷於過去；一切都已成為過去。

examples.sentence: They’ve agreed to put [water under the bridge] and move forward.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們已同意放下過去，向前邁進。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Being angry or upset about something that happened in the past.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 因過去發生的事情感到憤怒或不滿

examples.sentence: He’s always had [a chip on his shoulder] since the promotion he never received.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 自從他沒有得到升遷以來，他一直心懷不滿。

examples.sentence: You can’t go through life with [a chip on your shoulder]; let it go.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不能心懷不滿地生活，放手吧。

examples.sentence: She carries [a chip on her shoulder] regarding her past relationships.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她因為過去的關係而心中有埋怨。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a bad situation worse.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 讓糟糕的情況變得更糟

examples.sentence: Bringing up old arguments only [adds fuel to the fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 提起舊的爭論只會讓情況變得更糟。

examples.sentence: He's known for [adding fuel to the fire] in heated discussions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在激烈的討論中以加劇情況而聞名。

examples.sentence: Don't [add fuel to the fire] by making sarcastic comments.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要用諷刺的評論來讓情況更糟。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To avoid getting to the point of an issue.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 避免直截了當地談論問題

examples.sentence: Stop [beating around the bush] and just tell me what you want.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 別拐彎抹角，告訴我你想要什麼。

examples.sentence: He tends to [beat around the bush] when discussing tough topics.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在討論艱難的主題時，他傾向於拐彎抹角。

examples.sentence: If you keep [beating around the bush], we may run out of time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你繼續拐彎抹角，我們可能會沒時間了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A situation where people who are equally clueless guide each other.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在大家都無知的情况下，互相指導的情況

examples.sentence: In this project, it's like the [blind leading the blind].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這個項目中，就像無知者指導無知者。

examples.sentence: They are just the [blind leading the blind] when it comes to strategies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在策略方面，他們只是互相指導的無知者。

examples.sentence: The new team feels like the [blind leading the blind] without direction.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這支新團隊感覺像無知者互相指導，完全沒有方向。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Intense effort and hard work put into achieving something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為實現某事付出的艱辛努力

examples.sentence: The project was completed through [blood, sweat, and tears].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個項目是通過艱辛努力完成的。

examples.sentence: Success doesn't come easy; it requires [blood, sweat, and tears].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 成功不是輕而易舉的；它需要艱苦的努力。

examples.sentence: They put in [blood, sweat, and tears] to make the event successful.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們為了使活動成功付出了艱辛的努力。

meanings.meaning_en_US: No matter what happens; regardless of obstacles.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不論發生什麼；不顧障礙

examples.sentence: I'll finish this project, [come hell or high water].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 無論如何，我會完成這個項目。

examples.sentence: She plans to travel this summer, [come hell or high water].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不論發生什麼，她計劃這個夏天出行。

examples.sentence: They will win the game, [come hell or high water].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不論發生什麼，他們一定會贏得比賽。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be very similar in character or background.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在性格或背景上非常相似

examples.sentence: The two friends are [cut from the same cloth]; they share the same values.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這對朋友在性格上非常相似，他們有著相同的價值觀。

examples.sentence: They are [cut from the same cloth] in their approach to work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在工作方法上，他們非常相似。

examples.sentence: The siblings are clearly [cut from the same cloth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這對兄弟姐妹明顯非常相似。

meanings.meaning_en_US: The finer points of a plan or project are what can lead to problems.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 計劃或項目的細節可能帶來問題

examples.sentence: The project seems great, but the [devil is in the details].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個項目看起來不錯，但問題在於細節。

examples.sentence: In this agreement, the [devil is in the details].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這份協議中，問題的關鍵在於細節。

examples.sentence: Be cautious; the [devil is in the details] in any contract.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 要小心；在任何合同中的問題都在於細節。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To avoid cutting off opportunities for the future.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 避免斷絕未來的機會

examples.sentence: Think carefully before making your decision; don’t [burn your bridges].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在做決定前要仔細考慮；不要斷絕未來的機會。

examples.sentence: He was warned not to [burn his bridges] with his employer.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他被警告不要與雇主斷絕關係。

examples.sentence: When resigning, remember not to [burn your bridges].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 辭職時，記得不要斷絕未來的機會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To start discussing the essential or most important parts.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 開始討論最重要的部分

examples.sentence: Let’s [get down to brass tacks] and figure out the budget.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們開始討論最重要的預算。

examples.sentence: When negotiations begin, it's time to [get down to brass tacks].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當談判開始時，就是時候討論重點了。

examples.sentence: We need to [get down to brass tacks] to resolve this.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要開始討論最重要的部分來解決這件事。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To annoy or irritate someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某人生氣或惱火

examples.sentence: His constant talking really [gets on my nerves].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不停的講話真的讓我感到厭煩。

examples.sentence: She was [getting on my nerves] with her repeated questions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她不斷重複問題讓我感到厭煩。

examples.sentence: You seem to be [getting on his nerves] with your attitude.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你的態度似乎讓他感到不快。

word: get to the bottom of it

meanings.meaning_en_US: To understand the true facts about a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 了解情況的真實事實

examples.sentence: We need to [get to the bottom of it] to find the real issue.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要查明情況，以找出真正的問題。

examples.sentence: I won’t stop until I [get to the bottom of this].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在查明真相之前，我是不會停下來的。

examples.sentence: Let’s work together to [get to the bottom of it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們一起來查明真相。

word: get your ducks in a row

meanings.meaning_en_US: To get organized and prepared for something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為某事做好準備和組織

examples.sentence: You need to [get your ducks in a row] before the presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在演示之前，你需要做好準備

examples.sentence: She finally [got her ducks in a row] after weeks of planning.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過幾周的計劃，她最終做好了準備

examples.sentence: It's important to [get your ducks in a row] before you start the new project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在開始新項目之前，做好準備是很重要的

meanings.meaning_en_US: To go all out; to do something to the fullest extent.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 全力以赴，盡最大努力

examples.sentence: They really [went the whole nine yards] to make their wedding special.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們確實全力以赴讓婚禮變得特別

examples.sentence: If you want to succeed, you have to [go the whole nine yards].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想成功，你必須全力以赴

examples.sentence: He always [goes the whole nine yards] in everything he does.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在所做的一切中總是全力以赴

meanings.meaning_en_US: A phrase used when two people have the same idea or opinion.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 當兩個人有相同的想法或意見時所用的一個短語

examples.sentence: I thought of that idea too! [Great minds think alike].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我也想到那個主意！「聰明人想到一塊了」。

examples.sentence: When you suggested that movie, I knew you would like it. [Great minds think alike].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你建議那部電影時，我知道你會喜歡的。「聰明人想到一塊了」。

examples.sentence: We both wore the same outfit! [Great minds think alike].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們都穿了一樣的衣服！「聰明人想到一塊了」。
others: killing two birds with one stone

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have more important or more urgent matters to deal with.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 有更重要的事情要處理

examples.sentence: I can't deal with that issue now; I [have bigger fish to fry].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我現在無法處理那個問題；我有更重要的事情要做。
others: put the cart before the horse

examples.sentence: She's focusing on her career and [has bigger fish to fry].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她專注於事業，並且有更重要的事情要做。

examples.sentence: Let's not worry about that right now; we [have bigger fish to fry].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們暫時不用擔心那個；我們有更重要的事情要做。
others: put all your eggs in one basket

meanings.meaning_en_US: A phrase used to indicate that something is not very difficult.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用於表示某事不太困難的短語

examples.sentence: You can understand the instructions; [it’s not rocket science].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以理解這些說明；這不難。

examples.sentence: Don’t overthink it; [it’s not rocket science].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要過度思考；這不難。
others: bite off more than you can chew

examples.sentence: Assembling the furniture is easy; [it’s not rocket science].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 組裝家具很簡單；這不難。
others: let the cat out of the bag

meanings.meaning_en_US: To search thoroughly and exhaustively.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 徹底且詳盡地搜尋

examples.sentence: The detective [left no stone unturned] in his investigation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 偵探在調查中沒有遺漏任何線索。

examples.sentence: We will [leave no stone unturned] in finding your lost dog.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們將徹底尋找你失蹤的狗。
others: cross that bridge when you come to it

examples.sentence: They [left no stone unturned] to ensure the event's success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們為了確保活動成功而全力以赴。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To create a fair and equal situation for all participants.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為所有參與者創造公平平等的情況

examples.sentence: The new law will [level the playing field] for small businesses.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新法律將使小企業的競爭環境變得平等。
others: stick out like a sore thumb

examples.sentence: We need to [level the playing field] in education for all students.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要讓所有學生在教育上都能平等。

examples.sentence: Efforts like these [level the playing field] for disadvantaged groups.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這樣的努力為弱勢群體創造公平的環境。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To survive or continue to exist past the expected or normal lifespan.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 生存或存在超過預期或正常壽命

examples.sentence: After that accident, he felt like he was [living on borrowed time].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在那次事故後，他覺得自己像是在借來的時間生活。

examples.sentence: She knows she is [living on borrowed time] with her health problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她知道自己在健康問題上生活在借來的時間裡。
others: feel like a fish out of water

examples.sentence: He believes he has been [living on borrowed time] since his surgery.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他相信自從手術以來，他一直是在借來的時間中生活。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To summarize or condense a narrative.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 總結或簡化敘述

examples.sentence: To [make a long story short], we decided to take another route.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 總之，我們決定改變路線。

examples.sentence: Let me [make a long story short] by saying we need to leave now.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 簡而言之，我們需要現在就走。

examples.sentence: In short, to [make a long story short], it was a waste of time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 總之，這是浪費時間。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To get more value for the money spent.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 獲得花費金額的更多價值

examples.sentence: You want to get [more bang for your buck], so look for discounts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你想要獲得花費金額的更多價值，因此尋找折扣。

examples.sentence: Shopping in bulk can help you get [more bang for your buck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 批量購買可以幫助你獲得更多價值。

examples.sentence: By comparing prices, she ensures she gets [more bang for her buck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 透過比較價格，她確保獲得更多價值。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be more complex or interesting than it appears.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 比看起來更複雜或有趣

examples.sentence: The project is [more than meets the eye]; there's a lot of work involved.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個項目比看起來更複雜，裡面涉及很多工作。

examples.sentence: He seems aloof, but there's [more than meets the eye] about his personality.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他看起來冷漠，但他的個性比看起來更有深度。

examples.sentence: This book is [more than meets the eye]; it offers deep insights.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這本書比看起來更深入，提供了深刻的見解。
others: just the tip of the iceberg

meanings.meaning_en_US: An expression used to inquire what someone else is thinking.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 詢問別人所想的表達

examples.sentence: You look deep in thought; care to share? [Penny for your thoughts.]
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你看起來深思熟慮；想分享嗎？請告訴我你的想法。
others: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: After a long silence, he finally spoke, and I said, '[Penny for your thoughts?]'
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在長時間的沉默後，他終於開口，我說：‘可以告訴我你的想法嗎？’

examples.sentence: When you seem distracted, I often wonder, '[Penny for your thoughts?]'
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你看起來分心時，我經常想：‘你在想什麼？’

meanings.meaning_en_US: To correct a misunderstanding or misinformation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 糾正誤解或錯誤信息

examples.sentence: I need to [set the record straight] about what happened at the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要糾正會議上發生的事情。

examples.sentence: She spoke to the press to [set the record straight] on the rumors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她與媒體交談以糾正流言蜚語。

examples.sentence: Let's [set the record straight] before this gets out of hand.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在事情失控之前，讓我們糾正事實。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take credit for someone else's achievements or ideas.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 竊取他人的成就或想法的功勞

examples.sentence: He felt she was trying to [steal his thunder] by presenting his ideas as her own.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他覺得她企圖竊取他的成就，將他的想法當作自己的。

examples.sentence: Don't [steal my thunder] by making announcements before I'm ready.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我準備好之前，不要竊取我的風頭。

examples.sentence: By launching a new product, they seemed to [steal our thunder] at the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在活動上推出新產品，似乎是竊走了我們的風頭。

word: take a shot in the dark

meanings.meaning_en_US: To attempt something without certainty of the outcome.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在不確定結果的情況下嘗試某事

examples.sentence: I decided to [take a shot in the dark] and apply for the job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我決定冒險申請這個工作。

examples.sentence: She took a [shot in the dark] by guessing the answer on the exam.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在考試中猜答案，冒險一試。

examples.sentence: When unsure, sometimes it's best to [take a shot in the dark].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在不確定時，有時最好冒險一試。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A situation in which one can enjoy the advantages of two different things.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 同時享有兩個不同事物的優點的情況

examples.sentence: Working from home gives me [the best of both worlds]: comfort and productivity.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在家工作讓我同時享有舒適和生產力的優點。

examples.sentence: With this program, you get [the best of both worlds]—learning and hands-on experience.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有了這個計劃，你可以同時獲得學習和實踐經驗的優點。

examples.sentence: This restaurant offers [the best of both worlds]: a cozy atmosphere and gourmet food.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這家餐廳提供舒適的氛圍和美食的雙重優勢。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a bad situation worse.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使糟糕的情況變得更糟

examples.sentence: She was late to the meeting, and to [add insult to injury], she forgot the report.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她遲到了會議，並且更糟的是，她忘了報告。

examples.sentence: The car broke down, and to [add insult to injury], it started to rain.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 車子壞了，更糟的是，開始下雨了。

examples.sentence: He got a flat tire, and to [add insult to injury], he lost his wallet.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他爆胎了，更糟的是，他丟了錢包。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Good or bad things tend to happen in large groups or all at once.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 好或壞的事情往往會大量發生或同時發生

examples.sentence: When it comes to luck, sometimes [when it rains, it pours].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 談到運氣時，有時候出現一次運氣就會大量出現。

examples.sentence: After winning the lottery, he found it to be true: [when it rains, it pours].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 贏得彩票後，他發現這是真的：好運到來時是成群出現的。

examples.sentence: She faced challenges at work, and [when it rains, it pours]—she got sick too.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在工作中面對挑戰，而當壞運氣來時，恰好也生病了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To feel a sudden surge of excitement or anxiety.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感受到突然的興奮或焦慮

examples.sentence: Seeing her after so long made my [heart skip a beat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 很久不見她讓我心跳加速。

examples.sentence: When he proposed, my [heart skipped a beat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他求婚時，我的心跳加速了。

examples.sentence: I nearly missed the bus, and it made my [heart skip a beat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我差點錯過公共汽車，這讓我心跳加速。

word: a chip off the old block

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who resembles their parent in behavior, appearance, or character.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在行為、外貌或性格上像父母的人

examples.sentence: He's just like his father; a real [chip off the old block].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他和他父親一模一樣，真是一個‘如出一轍的人’。

examples.sentence: She’s a [chip off the old block], always interested in art like her mother.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她就像她母親，總是對藝術感興趣，真是一個‘如出一轍的人’。
others: take it with a grain of salt

examples.sentence: That kid is a real [chip off the old block], just like his grandfather.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那個孩子真是一個‘如出一轍的人’，就像他的祖父。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A hidden secret or shameful fact.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 隱藏的秘密或可恥的事實

examples.sentence: Everyone has a [skeleton in the closet] that they'd rather keep hidden.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每個人都有一個更願意隱藏的秘密。

examples.sentence: His past is shrouded in mystery; there's a [skeleton in the closet].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的過去籠罩在神秘之中，隱藏著一個秘密。

examples.sentence: Revealing a [skeleton in the closet] can have serious consequences.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 揭露一個秘密可能會有嚴重的後果。

word: at the end of one’s rope

meanings.meaning_en_US: At the limit of one’s patience or endurance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在耐心或忍耐的極限

examples.sentence: After weeks of stress, I feel like I'm [at the end of my rope].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 幾週的壓力後，我感覺像是快要崩潰了。

examples.sentence: He is [at the end of his rope], unable to cope with the situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他快要崩潰了，無法應付這種情況。
others: feeling on top of the world

examples.sentence: When you're [at the end of your rope], it’s important to seek help.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你快要崩潰時，尋求幫助很重要。

word: at the top of your lungs

meanings.meaning_en_US: To scream or shout as loudly as possible.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 大聲喊叫或呼喊

examples.sentence: He shouted her name [at the top of his lungs] to get her attention.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他大聲呼喊她的名字以引起她的注意。

examples.sentence: They sang [at the top of their lungs] during the concert.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在音樂會上大聲唱歌。

examples.sentence: When the team won, they cheered [at the top of their lungs].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當球隊贏的時候，他們大聲歡呼。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To deliberately keep away from something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 故意避免某事

examples.sentence: I [avoid it like the plague] when I see that person.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 看到那個人時我就會故意避開。

examples.sentence: She [avoids it like the plague] at work whenever possible.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在工作中一有可能就會故意避開。

examples.sentence: He always [avoids it like the plague] if there's confrontation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果有衝突的話，他總是會故意避開。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Physical beauty is superficial and doesn't reflect a person's true character.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 外表的美僅僅是表面的，不反映一個人的真實性格

examples.sentence: She is lovely, but remember that [beauty is only skin deep].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她很美，但記住外表的美僅僅是表面的。
others: judge a book by its cover

examples.sentence: In the end, [beauty is only skin deep], so focus on kindness.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最終，外表的美僅僅是表面的，因此專注於善良。

examples.sentence: People say [beauty is only skin deep], which is why I value personality.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人們說外表的美僅僅是表面的，所以我重視個性。
others: fall in love at first sight

word: big fish in a small pond

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who is prominent or influential in a small sphere.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在小範圍內顯著或有影響力的人

examples.sentence: In a small town, he’s considered a [big fish in a small pond].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在小鎮上，他被視為一個小範圍內的重要人物。

examples.sentence: As a top student, she feels like a [big fish in a small pond] at her school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 作為一名優秀學生，她在學校感覺自己是一個小範圍內的重要人物。

examples.sentence: He was a [big fish in a small pond], but now he wants to move to a bigger city.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他是一個小範圍內的重要人物，但現在他想搬到更大的城市。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have unrealistic dreams or plans.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 有不切實際的夢想或計劃

examples.sentence: They spend a lot of time [building castles in the air] instead of working.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們花很多時間做不切實際的夢想而不是工作。

examples.sentence: It's okay to dream, but don't just [build castles in the air].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 夢想是可以的，但不要只是停留在不切實際的幻想上。
others: keep your feet on the ground

examples.sentence: We need to focus on real goals, not [building castles in the air].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要專注於真正的目標，而不是做不切實際的夢想。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To appear unexpectedly, often in a large number.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 意外出現，通常數量很大

examples.sentence: Old friends [came out of the woodwork] to celebrate his success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 老朋友們意外出現共同慶祝他的成功。

examples.sentence: Once the news broke, critics [came out of the woodwork].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦新聞傳出，批評者們便意外出現。

examples.sentence: At the reunion, people [came out of the woodwork] to reconnect.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在同學聚會上，人們意外出現重聚。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Excessive curiosity can lead to trouble.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 過度的好奇心可能會帶來麻煩

examples.sentence: She’s always asking questions, but I tell her that [curiosity killed the cat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是問問題，但我告訴她過度的好奇心可能會帶來麻煩。

examples.sentence: He was warned that [curiosity killed the cat] when exploring unknown places.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在探索未知的地方時被警告過度的好奇心可能會帶來麻煩。
others: know where to draw the line

examples.sentence: Sometimes it's best to let things be; after all, [curiosity killed the cat].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候最好讓事情保持原樣；畢竟過度的好奇心可能會帶來麻煩。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To celebrate or gloat over someone's misfortune.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 慶祝或嘲笑某人的不幸

examples.sentence: After his failure, she couldn't help but [dance on his grave].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在他的失敗之後，她情不自禁地慶祝他的不幸。

examples.sentence: Instead of supporting him, they chose to [dance on his grave].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們選擇慶祝他的不幸，而不是支持他。

examples.sentence: It's unkind to [dance on someone's grave]; we should be more compassionate.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 慶祝某人的不幸並不仁慈；我們應該更有同情心。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Every good thing has a drawback or downside.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 每件好事都有缺陷或缺點

examples.sentence: Her promotion is fantastic, but [every rose has its thorn].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的晉升非常棒，但每件好事都有缺陷。

examples.sentence: They moved to a beautiful house, but [every rose has its thorn]—it's far from work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們搬到一個美麗的房子，但每件好事都有缺陷——那裡離工作很遠。

examples.sentence: It’s a great relationship, yet [every rose has its thorn].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這是一段美好的關係，但每件好事都有缺陷。

meanings.meaning_en_US: The first people to arrive are the first to be served.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 最早到達的人首先獲得服務

examples.sentence: At the café, it's [first come, first served]; get there early.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在咖啡館，遵循早到早服務的規則；要早去。

examples.sentence: If you want the best seats, remember [first come, first served].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想要最佳座位，記得最早到達的人優先服務。

examples.sentence: The tickets are limited, so it's [first come, first served].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 票數有限，因此早到早服務。

word: get one’s ducks in a row

meanings.meaning_en_US: To get organized or prepared.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 整理或準備好

examples.sentence: Before I leave, I need to [get my ducks in a row].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我離開之前，我需要整理好一切。

examples.sentence: It’s vital to [get your ducks in a row] before the big presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在重要的介紹之前，整理好一切至關重要。

examples.sentence: She took the time to [get her ducks in a row] for the move.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她花時間整理好以便搬家。

word: have a lot on your plate

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have many responsibilities or tasks to deal with.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 有很多責任或任務要處理

examples.sentence: With three projects due this week, I really [have a lot on my plate].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於這週有三個項目到期，我真的有很多事情要處理。

examples.sentence: She [has a lot on her plate] at work, juggling multiple deadlines.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在工作上有很多責任，努力應對多個截止日期。
others: have all the time in the world

examples.sentence: He mentioned he’s [got a lot on his plate], so he can't join us for dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他提到他有很多事情要處理，所以他不能加入我們的晚餐。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Indecision can lead to missed opportunities.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 猶豫不決可能導致錯失良機

examples.sentence: If you're thinking about investing, remember: [he who hesitates is lost].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你在考慮投資，記住：猶豫不決可能導致錯失良機。

examples.sentence: In business, [he who hesitates is lost]; act quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業中，猶豫不決會讓你失去機會；要迅速行動。

examples.sentence: When opportunities arise, keep in mind [he who hesitates is lost].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當機會出現時，牢記：猶豫不決可能導致錯失良機。

word: hit the nail on the head

meanings.meaning_en_US: To describe exactly what is causing a situation or problem.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 準確描述導致情況或問題的原因

examples.sentence: When she pointed out the mistake, she really [hit the nail on the head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她指出錯誤時，她真的準確命中了要害。

examples.sentence: He [hit the nail on the head] with his analysis of the issue.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對問題的分析準確到位。

examples.sentence: You [hit the nail on the head] when you said it was a communication problem.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你說這是一個溝通問題，真是直指要害。

word: it takes one to know one

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person can recognize a trait in another because they exhibit it themselves.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個人可識別他人的特徵是因為他們自己也表現出這種特徵

examples.sentence: She called him lazy, and I said, '[It takes one to know one].'
