examples.translation_zh_TW: 她叫他懶，我說：‘你自己也是如此。’

examples.sentence: When he criticized her, she shot back, '[It takes one to know one].'
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他批評她時，她反擊道：‘你也是如此。’

examples.sentence: If you think someone is dishonest, '[it takes one to know one].'
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你認為某人是不誠實的，這句話反映了你自己。

word: life is what you make it

meanings.meaning_en_US: One's outcomes depend on their own actions and choices.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個人的結果取決於自己的行動和選擇

examples.sentence: Remember, [life is what you make it]; you have the power to shape your path.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，生活是你所創造的；你有力量塑造你的道路。

examples.sentence: She believes strongly that [life is what you make it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她堅信生活是自己創造的。

examples.sentence: When faced with challenges, keep in mind that [life is what you make it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 面對挑戰時，記住生活是你所創造的。

word: like a fish out of water

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a situation that one is uncomfortable or unfamiliar with.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於不舒服或不熟悉的情況

examples.sentence: At the party, he felt [like a fish out of water] since he didn't know anyone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在派對上，他感到不自在因為他不認識任何人。

examples.sentence: Joining a new school can make you feel [like a fish out of water].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 轉到新學校可能會讓你感到不知所措。

examples.sentence: She was [like a fish out of water] in the corporate environment.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在公司環境中感到相當不自在。

word: not out of the woods yet

meanings.meaning_en_US: A situation that is not yet safe or fully resolved.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 情況尚未安全或完全解決

examples.sentence: Although things are improving, we're [not out of the woods yet].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管情況在改善，但我們還沒有完全安全。

examples.sentence: They still need to address some concerns; they're [not out of the woods yet].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們還需要解決一些問題；他們還沒有完全安全。

examples.sentence: We're making progress, but [not out of the woods yet].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們正在取得進展，但還沒有安全。

word: not the end of the world

meanings.meaning_en_US: A phrase used to indicate that a situation is not as serious as it seems.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用來表明情況並不像它看起來那麼嚴重的短語

examples.sentence: Even though I lost my job, it’s [not the end of the world].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 雖然我失去工作了，但這並不是世界的末日。

examples.sentence: Missing the bus is frustrating, but it's [not the end of the world].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 錯過公車讓人沮喪，但這並不是世界的末日。

examples.sentence: If the project fails, it’s [not the end of the world]; we can try again.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果項目失敗了，那並不是世界的末日；我們可以再試一次。

word: off the top of your head

meanings.meaning_en_US: To say something without thinking about it carefully.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在不仔細考慮的情況下隨意說出某事

examples.sentence: Can you give me a few ideas [off the top of your head]?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能隨便給我幾個想法嗎？

examples.sentence: I can’t think of anything [off the top of my head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我無法立即想到任何事情。

examples.sentence: Just [off the top of your head], what would you say the budget is?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨便說一下，你認為預算是多少？

meanings.meaning_en_US: To draw a logical conclusion from the available information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 從可用的信息中得出合乎邏輯的結論

examples.sentence: If you [put two and two together], you'll realize she was lying.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你能從中得出結論，你就會意識到她在說謊。

examples.sentence: Once I [put two and two together], it all made sense.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦我得出這個結論，一切都變得有意義了。

examples.sentence: She finally [put two and two together] and understood the situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她最終得出了結論，理解了情況。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An obvious problem or issue that people avoid discussing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 人們避免討論的顯而易見的問題或議題

examples.sentence: We need to address [the elephant in the room] before it gets worse.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要在情況惡化之前解決這個明顯的問題。

examples.sentence: Let’s talk about [the elephant in the room]; it’s time to face it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們討論這個不便之事；是時候直面它了。

examples.sentence: Ignoring [the elephant in the room] won’t solve our problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 忽視這個明顯的問題不會解決我們的問題。

word: the long and short of it

meanings.meaning_en_US: A summary of the main points.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 主要要點的摘要

examples.sentence: The long and short of it is that we need more time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 總的來說，我們需要更多時間。

examples.sentence: To wrap things up, the long and short of it is we succeeded.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 總結來說，我們成功了。

examples.sentence: The long and short of it is that we have a plan in place.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 總的來說，我們有一個計劃在進行中。

meanings.meaning_en_US: You have the ability and freedom to achieve great things.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 你有能力和自由去實現偉大的事情

examples.sentence: With hard work and determination, [the world is your oyster].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 憑藉努力和決心，你可以實現偉大的成就。

examples.sentence: After graduating, [the world is your oyster].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 畢業後，世界是你的舞台。

examples.sentence: For young people today, [the world is your oyster] with all the opportunities available.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對於今天的年輕人，世界是他們的舞台，有著無數機會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: When a situation becomes critically serious.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 當事情變得相當嚴重

examples.sentence: When push comes to shove, we will have to make difficult decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當事情變得相當嚴重時，我們將不得不做出艱難的決定。

examples.sentence: I hope it doesn’t come to that, but when push comes to shove, I’ll stand firm.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望不會發生那樣的事情，但當事情變得相當嚴重時，我會堅持立場。

examples.sentence: In a crisis, when push comes to shove, we’ll know who to trust.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在危機中，當事情變得相當嚴重時，我們會知道該信任誰。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Extremely valuable or beneficial.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 極具價值或有益

examples.sentence: Her advice was [worth its weight in gold] during tough times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在困難時期，她的建議極具價值。

examples.sentence: A good friend is [worth its weight in gold]; they help you through hard times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 好朋友在困難時期是極具價值的，他們幫助你度過艱難時刻。

examples.sentence: Experience is [worth its weight in gold] when starting a new job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經驗在新工作開始時極具價值。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An expression used to ask what someone is thinking.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 詢問別人所想的表達

examples.sentence: After watching the movie, I wanted to say, '[A penny for your thoughts?]'
examples.translation_zh_TW: 看完電影後，我想說：‘你在想什麼？’

examples.sentence: You seem deep in thought. Mind sharing? [A penny for your thoughts.]
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你看起來深思熟慮。願意分享嗎？‘你在想什麼？’

examples.sentence: I'll ask her directly, '[A penny for your thoughts?]'
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我將直接詢問她：‘你在想什麼？’

meanings.meaning_en_US: Being overly impatient will prevent something from happening.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 過度心急會阻礙事情的發生

examples.sentence: She is always checking her online order, but [a watched pot never boils].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是查看她的網上訂單，但過度心急會阻礙事情的發生。

examples.sentence: If you keep worrying about the project, remember that [a watched pot never boils].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你一直擔心這個專案，記得過度心急會阻礙事情的發生。

examples.sentence: Just be patient; [a watched pot never boils].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 只需耐心等待；過度心急會阻礙事情的發生。

meanings.meaning_en_US: If the outcome of a situation is good, then the difficulties that occurred before it can be overlooked.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 如果結果良好，之前的困難可以被忽略

examples.sentence: They had a rough start to their project, but [all's well that ends well] since they completed it on time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們的專案起初很艱難，但結果良好，因為他們按時完成了。

examples.sentence: Even though it was a tough journey, [all's well that ends well] after reaching the goal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 雖然過程艱辛，但結果良好，達到目標之後。

examples.sentence: Despite the challenges, [all's well that ends well] as long as we learn from them.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管有挑戰，只要我們從中學習，結果良好就是好事。

word: at the top of one’s lungs

meanings.meaning_en_US: To shout or scream very loudly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常大聲地喊叫或尖叫

examples.sentence: He yelled [at the top of his lungs] when he saw the surprise party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他看到驚喜派對時，他大聲喊叫。

examples.sentence: She sang [at the top of her lungs] during the concert.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在演唱會上非常大聲地唱歌。

examples.sentence: They cheered [at the top of their lungs] when their team won the championship.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他們的隊伍贏得冠軍時，他們高聲喝彩。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To start over and rethink a plan or idea after a failure.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在失敗後重新開始並重新考慮計劃或想法

examples.sentence: After the proposal was rejected, it was time to [go back to the drawing board].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 提議被拒絕後，是時候重新開始並重新考慮計劃。

examples.sentence: The first attempt didn't work, so we need to [go back to the drawing board].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 第一次嘗試沒有成功，所以我們需要重新考慮計劃。

examples.sentence: Let's [go back to the drawing board] and come up with a new strategy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們重新開始並提出新策略。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To sound more threatening than one really is.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聽起來比實際上更具威脅性

examples.sentence: Don’t be scared, he’s just [barking worse than his bite].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要害怕，他只是聽起來比實際上更具威脅性。

examples.sentence: She may seem aggressive, but she actually [barks worse than she bites].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她看起來可能有點具攻擊性，但她實際上只是聽起來威脅。

examples.sentence: He often [barks worse than he bites] when he feels insecure.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他感到不安時，他經常聽起來比實際上更具威脅性。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To pursue a mistaken or misguided course of action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 追求錯誤或誤導的行動路徑

examples.sentence: If you think I took your book, you are [barking up the wrong tree].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你認為是我拿了你的書，你就追求錯誤的行動路徑。

examples.sentence: He was [barking up the wrong tree] when he accused her of lying.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他指責她說謊時，他追求了錯誤的行動路徑。

examples.sentence: Think twice before acting; you might be [barking up the wrong tree].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 行動前再想清楚；你可能在追求錯誤的行動路徑。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something before someone else does.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在別人之前先做某事

examples.sentence: I wanted to ask her out, but he [beat me to the punch].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想約她，但他在我之前先做了。

examples.sentence: He made a great offer on the house, [beating us to the punch].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對那座房子提出了很好的報價，先於我們。

examples.sentence: They [beat us to the punch] with their new product launch.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們的產品發布先於我們。

meanings.meaning_en_US: People with little choice must accept what is offered.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 沒有選擇的人必須接受所提供的

examples.sentence: If you're asking for help, remember: [beggars can’t be choosers].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你在尋求幫助，記住：沒有選擇的人必須接受所提供的。

examples.sentence: After losing his job, he realized [beggars can’t be choosers].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在失去工作後，他意識到了沒有選擇的人必須接受所提供的。

examples.sentence: She knew that [beggars can’t be choosers] when she took the old car.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她知道沒有選擇的人必須接受所提供的，當她接受了那輛舊車。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who is different from others in a family or group, often in a negative way.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在家庭或團體中，與他人不同的人，通常是負面方式

examples.sentence: Everyone in her family is a doctor, but she is the [black sheep].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她家裡每個人都是醫生，但她是家庭的黑羊。

examples.sentence: Looking back, I was always the [black sheep of the family].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 回首過去，我一直是家庭的黑羊。

examples.sentence: In a family of artists, he felt like the [black sheep].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在一個藝術家家庭中，他感到自己是家庭的黑羊。

word: by the seat of your pants

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something without a plan or guide, relying on instinct or intuition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在沒有計劃或指南的情況下行事，依靠本能或直覺

examples.sentence: I had to figure it out [by the seat of my pants] during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議中，我只能依靠本能來解決問題。

examples.sentence: He made the presentation [by the seat of his pants] and it surprisingly went well.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他隨興發表了那個演示，結果出乎意料地順利。

examples.sentence: We had to navigate our trip [by the seat of our pants] since we lost the map.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為我們丟了地圖，我們不得不靈機應變地導航。

word: by the skin of your teeth

meanings.meaning_en_US: To narrowly escape or succeed, just barely.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 僥倖逃脫或成功，差得很少

examples.sentence: I passed the exam [by the skin of my teeth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我僥倖通過了考試。

examples.sentence: They won the game [by the skin of their teeth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們僥倖贏得了比賽。

examples.sentence: He escaped from the accident [by the skin of his teeth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他僥倖逃脫事故。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A method of persuasion that uses rewards and punishments.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一種使用獎勵和懲罰的說服方法

examples.sentence: The manager uses a [carrot and stick approach] to motivate the team.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經理用獎勵和懲罰的方法來激勵團隊。

examples.sentence: In negotiations, she applied the [carrot and stick approach] effectively.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在談判中，她有效地使用了獎勵和懲罰的方法。

examples.sentence: The government’s [carrot and stick approach] aimed to encourage compliance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 政府的獎勵和懲罰的方法旨在鼓勵遵從。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To find oneself unable to choose between two options.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 無法在兩個選擇之間做出選擇

examples.sentence: I feel [caught between two stools] when deciding on my career path.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在決定我的職業道路時，我感到無法在兩個選擇之間做出選擇。

examples.sentence: She was [caught between two stools] when her friends wanted different plans.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她的朋友們想要不同的計劃時，她無法在兩個選擇之間做出選擇。

examples.sentence: Being [caught between two stools] is frustrating for me.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 被迫在兩個選擇之間是令人沮喪的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don't assume success or a positive outcome before it happens.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在成功之前不要假設成功或正面結果

examples.sentence: You shouldn't [count your chickens] before the project is complete.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不應該在項目完成之前假設成功。

examples.sentence: He already spent the prize money, but I told him not to [count his chickens].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他已經花了獎金，但我告訴他不要假設成功。

examples.sentence: Don't [count your chickens] until you have the contract signed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在你簽署合同之前不要假設成功。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don't make a judgment before knowing all of the facts.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在了解所有事實之前不要做出判斷

examples.sentence: Please don’t [jump to conclusions] before hearing his side of the story.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在聽到他的講述之前請不要急於下結論。

examples.sentence: If you [jump to conclusions], you might misinterpret the situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果急於下結論，你可能會誤解情況。

examples.sentence: We need to gather more information and not [jump to conclusions].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要收集更多資訊，而不是急於下結論。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To irritate or annoy someone significantly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某人感到極度惱怒或煩躁

examples.sentence: Her constant talking is starting to [drive me up the wall].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她不斷的講話開始讓我感到極度煩躁。

examples.sentence: He’s been [driving everyone up the wall] with his complaints.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他一直因為抱怨而讓每個人感到煩躁。

examples.sentence: Don’t [drive me up the wall] with your excuses.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要用你的藉口讓我感到煩躁。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To feel very good or in excellent health.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感覺非常好或健康狀況極佳

examples.sentence: After a good night's sleep, I really [feel like a million bucks].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過一整晚的好睡眠，我真的感覺很好。

examples.sentence: She smiled and said she [felt like a million bucks] after the workout.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她微笑著說運動後她感覺很好。

examples.sentence: Once I got dressed, I [felt like a million bucks].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦我穿好衣服，我感覺很好。

synonyms: be on top of the world

meanings.meaning_en_US: To feel ill or unwell.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感到生病或不舒服

examples.sentence: I’ve been [feeling under the weather] this week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我這個星期一直感到不舒服。

examples.sentence: She stayed home because she was [feeling under the weather].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她因為感到不舒服而留在家裡。

examples.sentence: If you’re [feeling under the weather], you should rest.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你感到不舒服，你應該休息。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Every part of the world.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 世界的每一個地方

examples.sentence: People travel from the [four corners of the earth] to see this event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人們從世界的各個角落來參加這個活動。

examples.sentence: The festival attracts visitors from the [four corners of the earth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個節日吸引來自世界各地的遊客。

examples.sentence: He claimed to have traveled to the [four corners of the earth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他聲稱自己已經去過世界的每一個角落。

word: get off on the right foot

meanings.meaning_en_US: To start something well.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 良好地開始某事

examples.sentence: She [got off on the right foot] with her new boss.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她和新老闆打下了良好的基礎。

examples.sentence: Their project [got off on the right foot] after the initial meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們的計劃在初次會議後良好開始。

examples.sentence: Let’s ensure we [get off on the right foot] for the presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我們確保在演示中有個良好的開始。

word: get off on the wrong foot

meanings.meaning_en_US: To start something poorly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不良地開始某事

examples.sentence: He [got off on the wrong foot] with his teammates.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他和隊友不佳開場。

examples.sentence: Their presentation [got off on the wrong foot] due to technical issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們的演示因技術問題開始不順利。

examples.sentence: We can't afford to [get off on the wrong foot] for this project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們不能讓這個項目開個壞頭。

word: give a piece of your mind

meanings.meaning_en_US: To express one's discontent or anger about a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表達對某情況的不滿或憤怒

examples.sentence: She was so upset that she [gave a piece of her mind] to her boss.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她非常生氣，對她的老闆發表了不滿。

examples.sentence: He decided to [give a piece of his mind] regarding the unfair treatment.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定對不公平的對待表達不滿。

examples.sentence: After the meeting, she [gave a piece of her mind] about the poor decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 會後，她對這些糟糕的決策表達了不滿。

word: if the shoe fits, wear it

meanings.meaning_en_US: If something applies to you, then acknowledge it.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 若某事適用於你，則應承認它

examples.sentence: If you think that description fits you, then [if the shoe fits, wear it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你認為那個描述適用於你，那就承認吧。

examples.sentence: He said some harsh things, but if the truth hurts, [if the shoe fits, wear it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他說了一些苛刻的話，但如果真相會傷害到你，那就承認吧。

examples.sentence: She told me to think about it and [if the shoe fits, wear it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她告訴我思考一下，若適用就承認。

word: in the heat of the moment

meanings.meaning_en_US: When one is caught up in intense emotion.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在激烈情緒中

examples.sentence: He said some things he didn’t mean [in the heat of the moment].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在激烈情緒下說了一些他並不真的想說的話。

examples.sentence: They made a hasty decision [in the heat of the moment].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在激烈情緒下做了一個匆忙的決定。

examples.sentence: Reacting [in the heat of the moment] can lead to regret later.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在激烈情緒中反應可能會導致以後的遺憾。

word: keep an ear to the ground

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stay informed about what is happening.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 隨時了解正在發生的事情

examples.sentence: She always [keeps an ear to the ground] for news in the industry.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是隨時了解行業的最新消息。

examples.sentence: It’s smart to [keep an ear to the ground] about market trends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨時了解市場趨勢是智能的做法。

examples.sentence: He [keeps an ear to the ground] for potential opportunities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他隨時了解可能的機會。

word: keep your eye on the ball

meanings.meaning_en_US: To remain focused on what is important.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持對重要事物的專注

examples.sentence: During the project, it’s crucial to [keep your eye on the ball].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這個項目期間，保持對重要事物的專注是至關重要的。

examples.sentence: He reminded his team to [keep their eye on the ball] during the game.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他提醒他的隊伍在比賽中要專注。

examples.sentence: To succeed, you need to [keep your eye on the ball].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 要成功，你需要保持專注。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To hope for a positive outcome.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 希望有好的結果

examples.sentence: I’ll [keep my fingers crossed] for your interview.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我會希望你的面試成功。

examples.sentence: She [kept her fingers crossed] as the results were announced.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當結果公佈時，她希望有好的結果。

examples.sentence: Let’s [keep our fingers crossed] that it doesn’t rain tomorrow.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們希望明天不要下雨。

word: off the top of one’s head

meanings.meaning_en_US: Without having to think about it or without preparation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不加思考地或未經準備地

examples.sentence: I can’t answer that [off the top of my head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我無法不加思考地回答那個問題。

examples.sentence: He gave me the numbers [off the top of his head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不加思考地給了我那些數字。

examples.sentence: Can you name a few countries [off the top of your head]?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能不加思考地說幾個國家嗎？

word: out of sight, out of mind

meanings.meaning_en_US: When something is no longer visible, it is often forgotten.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不再可見時，常常被遺忘

examples.sentence: When he moved away, it became [out of sight, out of mind].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他搬走後，這成為不再可見，也因此被遺忘。

examples.sentence: For some people, old friends become [out of sight, out of mind].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對於某些人來說，老朋友常常被遺忘。

examples.sentence: It’s easy for things to become [out of sight, out of mind].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 事物變得不再被想起是件易事。

word: the ball is in your court

meanings.meaning_en_US: It is up to you to make the next decision or take action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 由你做出下一個決定或採取行動

examples.sentence: I’ve given you all the information, so now [the ball is in your court].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我已經給你所有的信息，所以現在由你來決定。

examples.sentence: After my advice, [the ball is in your court] now.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我給出建議後，現在由你來決定了。

examples.sentence: So, if you want to change things, remember [the ball is in your court].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 所以，如果你想改變現狀，請記住由你來決定。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take risks without worrying about the consequences.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不顧後果地冒險行事

examples.sentence: She decided to [throw caution to the wind] and start her own business.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定冒險創辦自己的公司。

examples.sentence: He [threw caution to the wind] when he invested all his savings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在投資所有儲蓄時冒險行事。

examples.sentence: They [threw caution to the wind] and booked a spontaneous trip abroad.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們冒險訂了一次突發的海外旅行。

word: a matter of life and death

meanings.meaning_en_US: An extremely serious situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個非常嚴重的情況

examples.sentence: This decision is [a matter of life and death] for the people involved.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個決定對相關的人來說至關重要。

examples.sentence: They were caught in [a matter of life and death] during the disaster.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在災難中，他們處於生死攸關的境地。

examples.sentence: In negotiations, it can become [a matter of life and death].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在談判中，這可能成為一個生死攸關的問題。

word: all’s fair in love and war

meanings.meaning_en_US: Anything goes in certain situations, especially in love or conflict.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在某些情況下特別是愛情或衝突中，任何事都是可以接受的

examples.sentence: She believed [all’s fair in love and war] when it came to her relationships.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的關係中，她相信愛情和戰爭中是沒有禁忌的。

examples.sentence: In negotiations, he felt [all’s fair in love and war].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在談判中，他認為愛與戰爭中什麼都可以。

examples.sentence: She used the saying [all’s fair in love and war] to justify her actions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她用這句話來辯解自己的行為。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An additional skill or advantage.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 額外的技能或優勢

examples.sentence: Learning to code is just [another string to your bow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 學習編程只是你額外的一項技能。

examples.sentence: Having a second language is [another string to your bow] in today’s job market.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在當今的工作市場上，掌握一門第二語言是額外的優勢。

examples.sentence: She added project management as [another string to her bow].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她將專案管理添加為額外的技能。

word: burn a hole in your pocket

meanings.meaning_en_US: To spend money quickly or impulsively.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 迅速或衝動地花錢

examples.sentence: After receiving his paycheck, the money [burned a hole in his pocket].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在收到薪水後，這筆錢迅速被他花光了。

examples.sentence: She tends to let money [burn a hole in her pocket].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她經常衝動花錢，讓錢迅速消失。

examples.sentence: Money always seems to [burn a hole in his pocket] when shopping.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在購物時，錢似乎總是會被他衝動消費。

word: by the seat of one’s pants

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something by instinct rather than by plan.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 根據直覺而非計劃行事

examples.sentence: He pilots the plane [by the seat of his pants].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他完全依賴直覺駕駛飛機。

examples.sentence: She managed to finish the project [by the seat of her pants].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她憑直覺完成了這個項目。

examples.sentence: We navigated the trip [by the seat of our pants].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們憑直覺進行這次旅行。

word: get in on the ground floor

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become involved in a project or business at an early stage.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在早期階段參與項目或業務

examples.sentence: Investing now allows you to [get in on the ground floor].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 現在投資可以讓你在早期階段參與。

examples.sentence: They’re looking for people to [get in on the ground floor] of their startup.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們正在尋找能夠參與他們新創企業早期階段的人。

examples.sentence: Joining the team early helps you [get in on the ground floor].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 早早加入團隊有助於你參與早期階段。

word: give a piece of one’s mind

meanings.meaning_en_US: To express one’s opinions, particularly when angry.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表達一個人的意見，特別是憤怒時

examples.sentence: He was upset and ready to [give a piece of his mind].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不高興，準備發表他的意見。

examples.sentence: You should [give a piece of your mind] if you disagree.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你不同意，你應該表達出來。

examples.sentence: She felt it was time to [give a piece of her mind] to her colleagues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她覺得是時候對同事們表達意見了。

word: give a run for one’s money

meanings.meaning_en_US: To offer strong competition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 提供強有力的競爭

examples.sentence: This new team will really [give us a run for our money].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這支新隊伍將真正給我們帶來競爭。

examples.sentence: We need to [give a run for our money] to stay ahead in the market.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要提供強有力的競爭才能在市場上保持領先。

examples.sentence: This competition is sure to [give everyone a run for their money].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這場比賽一定會讓每個人都面臨激烈競爭。

word: have an ace up your sleeve

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have a hidden advantage.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 擁有一個隱藏的優勢

examples.sentence: He always seems to [have an ace up his sleeve] during negotiations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在談判中似乎總是有隱藏的優勢。

examples.sentence: She knew she could [have an ace up her sleeve] if needed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她知道如果需要的話，她可以擁有隱藏的優勢。

examples.sentence: In this game, it's smart to [have an ace up your sleeve].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這個遊戲中，有隱藏的優勢是明智的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To hear rumors or unofficial information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聽到謠言或未經官方確認的信息

examples.sentence: I heard [through the grapevine] that they are moving.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我聽說他們要搬家了。

examples.sentence: She found out [through the grapevine] about the promotion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她通過聽到的消息得知了晉升的消息。

examples.sentence: They say you can always hear things [through the grapevine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們說你總是可以聽到一些消息。

word: home is where the heart is

meanings.meaning_en_US: Home is defined by the people we love and care about.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 家是由我們愛和關心的人定義的

examples.sentence: For her, [home is where the heart is].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對她來說，家是由愛的人和事物組成的。
others: a location marked on a map

examples.sentence: They say that [home is where the heart is], not about possessions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們說「家就是心之所在」，而不是財物。

examples.sentence: He feels that [home is where the heart is] while being with family.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在與家人一起時，他感到「家就是心之所在」。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Being truthful is the best way to handle situations.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 誠實是處理事情的最佳方式

examples.sentence: He believes that [honesty is the best policy] in life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他認為「誠實是處理事情的最佳方式」。

examples.sentence: In business, [honesty is the best policy] for long-term success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業中，「誠實是處理事情的最佳方式」是為了長期成功。

examples.sentence: Remember, [honesty is the best policy] in all dealings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，在所有交易中，「誠實是處理事情的最佳方式」。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To manage to survive in a difficult situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在困難的情況下設法生存

examples.sentence: He’s struggling to [keep his head above water] financially.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在財務上掙扎著求生。

examples.sentence: They are doing their best to [keep their heads above water] during the crisis.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在危機期間，他們在努力維持生存。

examples.sentence: It’s tough to [keep your head above water] with all these debts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這麼多債務下，維持生存是艱難的。

word: let the cat out of the bag

meanings.meaning_en_US: To reveal a secret or disclose information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 洩露秘密或披露信息

examples.sentence: She accidentally [let the cat out of the bag] about the surprise party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她不小心洩露了驚喜派對的秘密。

examples.sentence: He [let the cat out of the bag] about the new project plans.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他洩露了新項目的計劃信息。

examples.sentence: Don’t [let the cat out of the bag] if you want to keep it a secret.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想保守秘密，就不要洩露。

word: life is not a bed of roses

meanings.meaning_en_US: Life is not always pleasant or easy.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 生活並不總是愉快或簡單的

examples.sentence: Remember that [life is not a bed of roses].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請記住，生活並不總是輕鬆的。

examples.sentence: He learned that [life is not a bed of roses] after facing challenges.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在面對挑戰後，他認識到生活並不總是愉快的。

examples.sentence: In difficult times, it's good to remember [life is not a bed of roses].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在困難時期，記住生活並不總是美好是好的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Tasks become easier when many people work together.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 當多人一起工作時，任務會變得更輕鬆

examples.sentence: We finished the project quickly because [many hands make light work].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為有多人合作，我們很快就完成了這個項目。

examples.sentence: In our team, we believe that [many hands make light work].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我們的團隊中，我們相信多人合作能讓工作變得輕鬆。

examples.sentence: Remember, [many hands make light work] when organizing events.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，當組織活動時，合作能讓工作變得輕鬆。

word: pull a rabbit out of a hat

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something surprising or seemingly impossible.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 做一些驚人或看似不可能的事情

examples.sentence: He managed to [pull a rabbit out of a hat] and solved the problem.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他成功地做了一件驚人的事情，解決了這個問題。

examples.sentence: She always knows how to [pull a rabbit out of a hat] at work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是知道如何在工作中做出驚人的表現。

examples.sentence: We were amazed when he [pulled a rabbit out of a hat] during the presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他在演示中做出驚人表現時，我們感到震驚。

word: put the pedal to the metal

meanings.meaning_en_US: To go full speed or put in maximum effort.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 全速前進或全力以赴

examples.sentence: We need to [put the pedal to the metal] to meet the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要全力以赴來趕上截止日期。

examples.sentence: To succeed in this competition, you have to [put the pedal to the metal].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 要在這場比賽中取得成功，你必須全力以赴。

examples.sentence: They decided to [put the pedal to the metal] in the final hours of the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在項目的最後時刻決定全力以赴。

word: rome wasn’t built in a day

meanings.meaning_en_US: Important things take time to achieve.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 重要的事情需要時間去達成

examples.sentence: [Rome wasn’t built in a day], so be patient with your progress.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 『羅馬不是一天建成的』，所以要對自己的進步保持耐心。

examples.sentence: Remember, [Rome wasn’t built in a day] when you start your new project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你開始新的項目時，記住『羅馬不是一天建成的』。

examples.sentence: Achieving your dreams takes time; [Rome wasn’t built in a day].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 實現你的夢想需要時間；『羅馬不是一天建成的』。

word: take the bull by the horns

meanings.meaning_en_US: To confront a problem directly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 直接面對問題

examples.sentence: It’s time to [take the bull by the horns] and address the issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候直接面對這些問題了。

examples.sentence: She decided to [take the bull by the horns] regarding the project delays.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定直接面對項目延遲的問題。
others: take the path of least resistance

examples.sentence: If we want to succeed, we must [take the bull by the horns].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果我們想取得成功，必須直接面對問題。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Home is the most comforting place.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 家是最讓人感到舒適的地方

examples.sentence: After traveling, she realized there’s [no place like home].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在旅行後，她意識到沒有比家更好的地方了。

examples.sentence: He feels that [there’s no place like home] after a long day.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過漫長一天後，他感受到沒有地方比家更好。

examples.sentence: No matter where I go, I know [there’s no place like home].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 無論我去哪裡，我知道沒有比家更好的地方。

word: too many irons in the fire

meanings.meaning_en_US: Having too many projects or responsibilities at once.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 同時有太多項目或責任

examples.sentence: She has [too many irons in the fire] and is feeling overwhelmed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她同時有太多項目，感到很壓力。

examples.sentence: With [too many irons in the fire], he can’t focus well.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有太多項目時，他無法專心。

examples.sentence: Finding balance is key when you have [too many irons in the fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當你有太多事情時，找到平衡很重要。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Very little or no chance of success.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 成功的機會非常小或根本沒有

examples.sentence: He has a [snowball’s chance in hell] of winning the contest.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他贏得比賽的機會微乎其微。

examples.sentence: With that strategy, there’s a [snowball’s chance in hell] of success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 依據那個策略，成功幾乎是不可能的。

examples.sentence: Without proper preparation, it'll be a [snowball’s chance in hell].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 沒有做好充分的準備，成功的機會微乎其微。

word: a stitch in time saves nine

meanings.meaning_en_US: Taking prompt action can prevent bigger problems later.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 及時行動可以防止以後出現更大的問題

examples.sentence: Fixing the leak early is a good example of [a stitch in time saves nine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 及時修理漏水是「及時行動可以防止以後出現更大的問題」的好例子。

examples.sentence: Remember, [a stitch in time saves nine] with your responsibilities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，對你的責任及時行動很重要。

examples.sentence: Taking care of small issues now is [a stitch in time saves nine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 現在處理小問題是「及時行動可以防止以後出現更大的問題」。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Each day brings a new opportunity to earn.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 每天都提供賺取新機會

examples.sentence: Everyday is just [another day, another dollar].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每天都是「又一天，又一美元」。

examples.sentence: He wakes up knowing it’s [another day, another dollar].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他醒來意識到又是一個賺錢的機會。

examples.sentence: For her, [another day, another dollar] means more opportunities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對她來說，「又一天，又一美元」意味著更多的機會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Family relationships are stronger than other relationships.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 家庭關係比其他關係更強

examples.sentence: She always says, [blood is thicker than water], especially in tough times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是說「血濃于水」，特別是在艱難的時候。

examples.sentence: In her view, [blood is thicker than water] plays a crucial role in decision-making.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她看來，「血濃于水」在決策中起著至關重要的作用。

examples.sentence: He believes that [blood is thicker than water] when it comes to support.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在支持方面，他相信「血濃于水」。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A feeling of nervousness or anxiety.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感到緊張或焦慮

examples.sentence: I always get [butterflies in my stomach] before giving a presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在發表演講之前，我總是感到緊張

examples.sentence: She felt [butterflies in her stomach] on her first date.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在第一次約會時感到緊張

examples.sentence: Before the exam, I always have [butterflies in my stomach].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在考試前，我總是感到緊張

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don't waste time worrying about things that have already happened and cannot be changed.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要浪費時間擔心已經發生且無法改變的事情

examples.sentence: It's okay to make mistakes; just remember, [don’t cry over spilled milk].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 犯錯是正常的；只需記住，不要為已經發生的事情感到難過
others: save your tears for another day

examples.sentence: When I missed the train, I told myself, [don’t cry over spilled milk].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我錯過火車時，我告訴自己不要為此傷心

examples.sentence: After failing the test, I reminded myself, [don’t cry over spilled milk].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 考試失敗後，我提醒自己不要為此感到難過

meanings.meaning_en_US: Too much understanding of someone can lead to a lack of respect.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 過度了解某人可能導致缺乏尊重

examples.sentence: As people spent more time together, they started to realize that [familiarity breeds contempt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨著人們共度更多時間，他們開始意識到過度了解會導致缺乏敬重

examples.sentence: She noticed that her close friends often took her for granted; indeed, [familiarity breeds contempt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她注意到她的親密朋友經常視她為理所當然；事實上，過度了解會導致輕視

examples.sentence: In many relationships, it's true that [familiarity breeds contempt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在許多關係中，過度了解確實會導致缺乏尊重

word: from the bottom of my heart

meanings.meaning_en_US: To express genuine and heartfelt feelings.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 真誠且發自內心的感受

examples.sentence: I want to say thank you [from the bottom of my heart] for all your help.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想由衷地感謝你的所有幫助
others: from the top of my head

examples.sentence: She apologized [from the bottom of her heart] for her mistake.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她真心地為她的錯誤道歉

examples.sentence: They expressed their feelings [from the bottom of their hearts].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們衷心地表達了自己的感受

word: it never rains but it pours

meanings.meaning_en_US: Bad things often happen all at once.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 壞事往往同時發生

examples.sentence: When I lost my job, my car broke down too; [it never rains but it pours].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我失業時，我的車也壞了；壞事總是接踵而來

examples.sentence: She feels overwhelmed because [it never rains but it pours] in her life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她感到不堪重負，因為她的生活中壞事接連而至

examples.sentence: [It never rains but it pours]; that’s how I feel with all these problems at once.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 壞事總是接踵而至；我對這些問題同時發生的感覺就是這樣

meanings.meaning_en_US: To manage to survive or remain in a difficult situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在困難的情況下努力生存或保持

examples.sentence: During the financial crisis, I had to [keep my head above water].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在金融危機期間，我不得不努力生存

examples.sentence: She found it hard to [keep her head above water] while balancing work and family.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在平衡工作和家庭的時候，她發現很難保持生存

examples.sentence: It's tough, but I’m managing to [keep my head above water].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這很艱難，但我正在努力保持生存

word: like a bull in a china shop

meanings.meaning_en_US: Someone who is clumsy or awkward in a delicate situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在棘手情況下笨拙或不鋒利

examples.sentence: He entered the meeting [like a bull in a china shop], making everyone uncomfortable.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他進入會議就像一頭在瓷器店裡的公牛，使每個人都感到不自在

examples.sentence: She handled the delicate issue [like a bull in a china shop].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她處理這個棘手問題像頭公牛進了瓷器店

examples.sentence: His behavior at the party was [like a bull in a china shop], breaking things inadvertently.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在派對上的行為就像一頭公牛在瓷器店裡，無意中打破了東西

word: like a kid in a candy store

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be very excited or enthusiastic about something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某事感到非常興奮或熱衷

examples.sentence: When I saw the new gadgets, I felt [like a kid in a candy store].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我看到這些新產品時，我感到非常興奮
others: like a cat in a dog house
like a bird in a cage

examples.sentence: He was [like a kid in a candy store] when he entered the gaming arcade.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他進入遊戲廳時，感到像個孩子在糖果店裡
others: like a dog in a kennel
like a bug in the rug
like a bird in a net

examples.sentence: Finding the perfect outfit made her feel [like a kid in a candy store].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 找到完美的服裝讓她感到非常興奮
others: like a turtle in a race
like a mouse in a trap
like a cow in a field

meanings.meaning_en_US: Money is a limited resource and should be spent wisely.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 金錢是有限的資源，應該明智地花費

examples.sentence: Remember that [money doesn’t grow on trees] when you spend.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 花錢時要記住金錢不是隨處可得的

examples.sentence: He often says, [money doesn’t grow on trees], so we need to be careful.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他經常說，金錢不是隨處可得的，所以我們需要小心

examples.sentence: It’s important to understand that [money doesn’t grow on trees].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 理解金錢不是隨處可得是重要的

word: put your foot in your mouth

meanings.meaning_en_US: To say something that one regrets or that is awkward.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 說出讓人後悔或尷尬的話

examples.sentence: I really [put my foot in my mouth] when I mentioned her ex.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我提到她的前任時，我真的說出了讓我後悔的話。
others: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: He often [puts his foot in his mouth] during meetings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在會議中經常說出讓人尷尬的話。

examples.sentence: She [put her foot in her mouth] at the party last night.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她昨晚在派對上說了讓她後悔的話。
others: get off on the wrong foot

word: the devil is in the details

meanings.meaning_en_US: The small details of a project or situation are often the most important or problematic.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 專案或情況的細節通常是最重要或最棘手的

examples.sentence: When planning, remember that [the devil is in the details].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在規劃時，請記住細節在關鍵。

examples.sentence: He learned that [the devil is in the details] after the project failed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在專案失敗後，他明白了細節的重要性。
others: make a mountain out of a molehill

examples.sentence: In writing, [the devil is in the details] of proper grammar.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在寫作中，細節的文法正確性是關鍵。
others: put all your eggs in one basket

meanings.meaning_en_US: People often think other people's situations are better than their own.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 人們常常認為別人的處境比自己的更好

examples.sentence: She thinks life in the city is better, but [the grass is always greener].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她認為城市生活更好，但其實總以為別人更好。
others: strike while the iron is hot
let the cat out of the bag

examples.sentence: He always forgets that [the grass is always greener] on the other side.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是忘記了別人的草地看起來總是更綠。

examples.sentence: Thinking about moving, but [the grass is always greener] could be misleading.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 考慮搬家，但以為別人更好可能會誤導人。

word: the proof is in the pudding

meanings.meaning_en_US: The real value or quality of something can be judged only from practical experience or results.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 只有通過實際經驗或結果才能判斷某物的真實價值或質量

examples.sentence: She said it was good, but [the proof is in the pudding].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她說這很好，但實際結果才最重要。

examples.sentence: He believes in hard work, and [the proof is in the pudding] after his success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他相信努力，成功後才知道努力的回報。

examples.sentence: You can talk theory, but [the proof is in the pudding].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以講理論，但實際成果是最重要的。

word: up a creek without a paddle

meanings.meaning_en_US: In a difficult situation with no way to solve it.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 身陷困境而無法解決

examples.sentence: When my car broke down, I realized I was [up a creek without a paddle].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我的車壞了，我意識到我身陷困境。
others: take a leaf out of someone else's book

examples.sentence: Lost in the city, he felt completely [up a creek without a paddle].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在城市迷路，他感到完全無助。
others: give someone a run for their money

examples.sentence: Without a job, she's really [up a creek without a paddle].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 失業的她真的陷入了困境。
others: keep your ear to the ground
kick the can down the road

word: what goes up must come down

meanings.meaning_en_US: Things that rise or increase will eventually fall or decrease.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 上升或增加的事物最終會下降或減少

examples.sentence: The economy is booming now, but [what goes up must come down].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經濟現在繁榮，但上升的也會下降。
others: have a whale of a time

examples.sentence: Real estate prices are high now, but [what goes up must come down].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 現在房價很高，但也會回落。

examples.sentence: The team's performance was great, but [what goes up must come down] in sports.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 球隊的表現很棒，但在運動中上升的總會回落。

word: without a shadow of a doubt

meanings.meaning_en_US: Without any uncertainty; definitely.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 沒有任何不確定性；毫無疑問

examples.sentence: I can say [without a shadow of a doubt] that he is guilty.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我可以毫無疑問地說他有罪。

examples.sentence: She is [without a shadow of a doubt] the best candidate.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她無疑是最好的候選人。

examples.sentence: You are [without a shadow of a doubt] my best friend.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你是我毫無疑問的好朋友。

word: you can’t have it both ways

meanings.meaning_en_US: You cannot have two incompatible things or wishes at the same time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 你不能同時擁有兩件不相容的事物或願望

examples.sentence: If you want a high salary, you can’t [have it both ways] by working part-time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想要高薪，就不能同時兼職。

examples.sentence: She wants to travel more but also wants a stable job; she can’t [have it both ways].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她想多旅行，但又希望有穩定的工作，這兩者不能兼得。

examples.sentence: In relationships, you can’t [have it both ways] if you want honesty.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在關係中，如果你想要誠實，就不能兼得。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A group or organization that is not united will not be successful.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個不團結的團體或組織不會成功

examples.sentence: In business, remember, [a house divided cannot stand].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業中，請記住，團結的重要性。

examples.sentence: The committee failed because [a house divided cannot stand].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該委員會失敗了，因為不團結。

examples.sentence: If we want to succeed, we must remember that [a house divided cannot stand].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果我們想成功，必須記住團結的重要性。

word: a taste of your own medicine

meanings.meaning_en_US: Receiving the same treatment one gives to others, especially if it is unpleasant.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 受到與他人相同的對待，尤其是不愉快的對待

examples.sentence: After he bullied others, he finally got [a taste of his own medicine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在欺負別人之後，他終於受到了應得的報應。

examples.sentence: She always criticizes people, so it was nice for her to get [a taste of her own medicine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是批評別人，因此讓她嘗到了自己的苦果是件好事。

examples.sentence: When he lied to me, I gave him [a taste of his own medicine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他對我撒謊時，我給了他應有的報應。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Full of energy and enthusiasm; typically used to describe someone who is excited.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 充滿活力和熱情；通常用來形容興奮的人

examples.sentence: Despite the early hour, she arrived [bright-eyed and bushy-tailed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管很早，她還是興高采烈地來了。

examples.sentence: The kids were [bright-eyed and bushy-tailed] on the first day of school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 孩子們在開學第一天充滿活力。

examples.sentence: He started the new job [bright-eyed and bushy-tailed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他以充滿活力和熱情的姿態開始了新工作。

word: burn the candle at both ends

meanings.meaning_en_US: To exhaust oneself by doing too much, usually by staying up late and getting up early.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 透支自己，通常是指熬夜和早起

examples.sentence: If you keep [burning the candle at both ends], you'll be exhausted.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你繼續透支自己，你會非常疲倦。

examples.sentence: She has been [burning the candle at both ends] with work and school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在工作和學校中都在透支自己。
others: sweep the dirt under the rug

examples.sentence: I need to stop [burning the candle at both ends] to stay healthy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要停止這種透支自己的生活，以保持健康。

word: get into the swing of things

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become accustomed to a new situation or to start doing something effectively.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 習慣於新情況或有效開始做某事

examples.sentence: It took me a week to [get into the swing of things] at my new job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我花了一週時間才習慣於新工作。

examples.sentence: Once the semester starts, I will [get into the swing of things] in my studies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一旦學期開始，我會習慣於我的學業。

examples.sentence: He quickly [got into the swing of things] when the team started projects.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當球隊開始專案時，他迅速適應了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To share something that has been troubling you, usually to relieve stress or feelings.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 分享一直困擾你的事情，通常是為了緩解壓力或情緒

examples.sentence: I need to [get something off my chest] before I can relax.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要分享我的心事才能放鬆。

examples.sentence: Talking to a friend helps her [get something off her chest].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 和朋友交談幫助她舒解心事。
others: make a mountain out of a molehill

examples.sentence: Sometimes you just need to [get something off your chest].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候你只是需要分享你的心事。

word: go back to the drawing board

meanings.meaning_en_US: To start over with a new plan after a failure.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在失敗後重新開始新計畫

examples.sentence: After the project failed, we had to [go back to the drawing board].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 專案失敗後，我們不得不重新開始新的計畫。
others: see the writing on the wall

examples.sentence: He learned the hard way that he must [go back to the drawing board].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在困難中學到必須重新開始計畫的道理。
others: take it with a grain of salt

examples.sentence: Every time I try something new, I end up having to [go back to the drawing board].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每次我嘗試新事物，最終都會需要重頭開始。

word: have a chip on your shoulder

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be angry or upset about something that happened in the past.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對過去發生的事情感到憤怒或不安

examples.sentence: He has had a [chip on his shoulder] since his last promotion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 自從上次升遷以來，他就一直心懷不滿。

examples.sentence: She walks around with a [chip on her shoulder] from her childhood.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她因為童年而心懷不滿。
others: strike while the iron is hot

examples.sentence: If you keep carrying that [chip on your shoulder], you'll miss opportunities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你一直心懷不滿，你會錯過機會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Exactly what is needed; refers to something that is beneficial.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 正好是所需的；指對某事有益的東西

examples.sentence: This vacation is [just what the doctor ordered].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這次假期正是我所需要的。

examples.sentence: After that long meeting, some coffee was [just what the doctor ordered].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在那次長會議之後，喝咖啡正合適。

examples.sentence: The exercise routine was [just what the doctor ordered] for her health.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這一套運動方案正好對她的健康有幫助。

word: lay one’s cards on the table

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be open and honest about one's intentions and feelings.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對自己的意圖和感受保持開放和誠實

examples.sentence: It's time to [lay my cards on the table] and explain my plan.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候我誠實地解釋我的計畫了。

examples.sentence: He decided to [lay his cards on the table] to avoid misunderstandings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定坦率地表達，以避免誤解。

examples.sentence: In a relationship, it's important to [lay your cards on the table].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在一段關係中，誠實非常重要。

word: like water off a duck’s back

meanings.meaning_en_US: Not easily affected by criticism or negativity.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不容易受到批評或負面情緒的影響

examples.sentence: He just brushes off insults; they roll off him [like water off a duck's back].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對侮辱不以為意，這些批評對他來說都是浮雲。

examples.sentence: For her, criticism is [like water off a duck's back].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對她來說，批評沒有任何影響。
others: kill two birds with one stone
cross that bridge when we come to it

examples.sentence: He handles criticism [like water off a duck's back].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對批評的反應就像水滾鴨背。

word: not playing with a full deck

meanings.meaning_en_US: Someone who is mentally unstable or not very intelligent.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 顯示精神不穩定或不太聰明

examples.sentence: After hearing his ideas, I realized he is [not playing with a full deck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 聽了他的想法後，我意識到他的精神不太正常。

examples.sentence: She's always making strange comments; I think she’s [not playing with a full deck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是發表奇怪的評論，我認為她心智不太正常。
others: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: If you talk to him, you'll see he's [not playing with a full deck].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你與他交談，你會發現他的心智不太清晰。
others: give him a taste of his own medicine

meanings.meaning_en_US: Careful with small amounts of money but wasteful with larger amounts.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對小金額節儉，但對大金額浪費

examples.sentence: Cutting costs on small things can be [penny-wise and pound-foolish].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在小事情上削減成本可能會得不償失。

examples.sentence: He is [penny-wise and pound-foolish] by not investing in quality.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對品質的不投入其實是得不償失。

examples.sentence: Being [penny-wise and pound-foolish] is a common mistake.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 變得斤斤計較是常見的錯誤。

word: take it with a grain of salt

meanings.meaning_en_US: To view something skeptically or to not take it seriously.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以懷疑的態度看待某事，或不把它當真

examples.sentence: When she tells stories, I always [take them with a grain of salt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每當她講故事時，我總是持懷疑態度。

examples.sentence: You should [take it with a grain of salt] when reading online reviews.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 閱讀在線評價時，應持懷疑態度。
others: work your fingers to the bone

examples.sentence: I tend to [take things with a grain of salt] when it comes to gossip.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 談到八卦時，我往往不會太當真。

word: take it with a pinch of salt

meanings.meaning_en_US: Similar to 'take it with a grain of salt'; suggests skepticism.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 和“take it with a grain of salt”類似，意味著懷疑

examples.sentence: You'd better [take that claim with a pinch of salt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你最好對那個聲稱持懷疑態度。

examples.sentence: When he talks about his achievements, I always [take it with a pinch of salt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他談到他的成就時，我總是持懷疑態度。

examples.sentence: It’s wise to [take everything he says with a pinch of salt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對他所說的每一句話抱懷疑態度是明智的。

word: variety is the spice of life

meanings.meaning_en_US: Different experiences or activities make life more enjoyable.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不同的經歷或活動使生活更愉快

examples.sentence: Traveling is great because [variety is the spice of life].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 旅行很好，因為多樣性才能使生活更有趣。
others: take it with a grain of salt

examples.sentence: For her, exploring new hobbies proves that [variety is the spice of life].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對她來說，探索新的愛好證明了多樣性讓生活更有趣。

examples.sentence: He often says, [variety is the spice of life], especially at work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他常常說，變化使工作更有趣。

word: wake up and smell the coffee

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become aware of the realities or truths of a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 意識到現實或某個事情的真相

examples.sentence: She needs to [wake up and smell the coffee] about her job situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她需要對自己的工作狀況意識到現實。
others: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: He was dreaming too big; it’s time for him to [wake up and smell the coffee].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他想得太美了；是時候現實一點了。

examples.sentence: Sometimes you have to [wake up and smell the coffee] to move forward.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候你必須要意識到現實才能向前進。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To understand someone else's perspective or experiences.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 理解他人的觀點或經歷

examples.sentence: Before judging her, try to [walk in her shoes].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在評判她之前，先試著理解她的處境。

examples.sentence: He often reminds us to [walk in someone else's shoes] before making decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他經常提醒我們在做決策之前先理解他人的處境。

examples.sentence: To connect with others, you need to [walk in their shoes].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 要與他人建立聯繫，你需要理解他們的處境。

word: all that glitters is not gold

meanings.meaning_en_US: Not everything that appears valuable is truly valuable.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 並不是所有看起來珍貴的東西都是珍貴的

examples.sentence: Just because he is rich doesn’t mean he is happy; [all that glitters is not gold].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 僅僅因為他有錢並不意味著他快樂；並不是所有表面上看起來好的都是好的。

examples.sentence: Her beauty is captivating, but remember, [all that glitters is not gold].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的美麗令人著迷，但要記住，並非所有表面看起來好的都是好的。

examples.sentence: In life, [all that glitters is not gold]; you need to look deeper.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，並不是所有表面上看起來好的都是好的；你需要看得更深。

word: carry the weight of the world

meanings.meaning_en_US: To feel an overwhelming burden or responsibility.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感覺到壓倒性的負擔或責任

examples.sentence: He felt like he was [carrying the weight of the world] after his father's passing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在父親去世後，他感覺自己承擔著全世界的重擔。

examples.sentence: Sometimes, it seems like we are [carrying the weight of the world] with our responsibilities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候，我們似乎負擔著世界的重任，面對各種責任。
others: take it with a grain of salt

examples.sentence: She carries her family's expectations; it's like [carrying the weight of the world].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她承擔著家庭的期望，感覺就像承擔著全世界的重擔。

word: fly by the seat of your pants

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do something without planning or without any particular skill.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在沒有計劃或沒有特定技巧的情況下去做事

examples.sentence: I had to [fly by the seat of my pants] during that presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在那次演示中，我不得不隨機應變。

examples.sentence: He often [flies by the seat of his pants] when it comes to decision-making.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在決策時，他經常隨心所欲。

examples.sentence: Sometimes I just [fly by the seat of my pants] when cooking new recipes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候我做新食譜時就隨心所欲。

word: give the benefit of the doubt

meanings.meaning_en_US: To decide to believe someone or to assume the best in someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 決定相信某人或假設某人有善意

examples.sentence: I will [give him the benefit of the doubt] despite the rumors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管有謠言，我仍然決定給他一個機會。
others: take it with a grain of salt
keep your cards close to your chest

examples.sentence: It's important to [give others the benefit of the doubt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 給予他人機會是很重要的。

examples.sentence: Even if you doubt her claims, try to [give her the benefit of the doubt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 即使你對她的說法心存懷疑，也應該試著給她一個機會。

word: have one’s head in the clouds

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be daydreaming or not paying attention to reality.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 做白日夢或不關注現實

examples.sentence: He’s always [having his head in the clouds] instead of focusing on work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是在做白日夢，而不是關注工作。

examples.sentence: If you [have your head in the clouds], you might miss important details.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你心不在焉，你可能會錯過重要細節。

examples.sentence: Daydreaming means [having your head in the clouds].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 做白日夢就是心不在焉。
others: have your feet on the ground

word: have your cake and eat it too

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have two incompatible things at the same time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 同時擁有兩件不相容的事物

examples.sentence: You can’t [have your cake and eat it too]; you will have to choose.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不能同時擁有；必須做出選擇。

examples.sentence: In life, you often can’t [have your cake and eat it too].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，你常常不能兼得。

examples.sentence: He wants to travel and save money, but he can’t [have his cake and eat it too].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他想旅行又想存錢，但不能兼得。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To hear rumors or unofficial information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 聽到謠言或非官方資訊

examples.sentence: I heard [through the grapevine] that they are planning a surprise party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我聽說他們正計劃舉辦一個驚喜派對。

examples.sentence: She knows more than she lets on; I think she’s [been hearing it through the grapevine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她知道的比她表現出來的多；我覺得她是通過謠言知道的。

examples.sentence: He admitted that he [heard it through the grapevine] about the job opening.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他承認他是從謠言中聽到這份工作的機會。

word: kill two birds with one stone

meanings.meaning_en_US: To achieve two goals with a single action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用一個行動實現兩個目標

examples.sentence: By carpooling, I can [kill two birds with one stone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過拼車，我可以同時達到兩個目標。

examples.sentence: Studying while exercising allows you to [kill two birds with one stone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在運動的同時學習可以達到兩個目的。

examples.sentence: I plan to [kill two birds with one stone] by visiting my friends and exploring the city.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我計劃通過拜訪朋友和探索城市來達到兩個目標。

word: laugh all the way to the bank

meanings.meaning_en_US: To profit financially, especially when unexpectedly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 意外獲利，尤其是當你沒有預期時

examples.sentence: After that investment, he is [laughing all the way to the bank].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在那次投資後，他意外獲利。

examples.sentence: When the product sold out, we were [laughing all the way to the bank].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當產品售罄時，我們獲得了意外的財利。

examples.sentence: She’s [laughing all the way to the bank] after her successful business venture.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的成功商業冒險之後，她獲得了意外的利益。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Laughter has a positive effect on health and well-being.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 笑對健康和福祉有積極影響

examples.sentence: After a stressful day, a good laugh is [the best medicine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在壓力大的日子裡，開心的大笑是最好的解藥。
others: hit the nail on the head

examples.sentence: They always say, [laughter is the best medicine] for a reason.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們這樣說是有原因的，笑是最好的解藥。
others: burn the candle at both ends

examples.sentence: Whenever she feels down, she remembers that [laughter is the best medicine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每當她感到沮喪時，她會記住，笑是最好的解藥。

word: make hay while the sun shines

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take advantage of favorable conditions.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 利用有利的條件

examples.sentence: Now that the weather's nice, let's [make hay while the sun shines].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 既然天氣好，我們就應該把握時機。

examples.sentence: With this opportunity, we should [make hay while the sun shines].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這個機會下，我們應該好好把握。

examples.sentence: Remember to [make hay while the sun shines] and seize the moment.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記得要把握時機，抓住當下的機會。

word: put one’s foot in one’s mouth

meanings.meaning_en_US: To say something embarrassing or inappropriate.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 說出令人尷尬或不合適的話

examples.sentence: I really [put my foot in my mouth] when I brought up his past.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我提到他的過去時，我真的說出了不合適的話。

examples.sentence: She [put her foot in her mouth] in front of her boss during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議上，她在老闆面前說出令人尷尬的話。
others: take it with a grain of salt

examples.sentence: After he [put his foot in his mouth], everyone fell silent.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在他說出不適當的話之後，所有人都沉默了。
others: hit the nail on the head

word: put the cart before the horse

meanings.meaning_en_US: To do things in the wrong order.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 把事情做錯順序

examples.sentence: He tends to [put the cart before the horse] when planning events.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在策劃活動時，他往往會把事情做錯順序。
others: keep your feet on the ground
take it with a grain of salt

examples.sentence: You shouldn't [put the cart before the horse] by starting before the research.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在研究之前不應該急著動手。

examples.sentence: We need to avoid [putting the cart before the horse] in our project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們的專案中需要避免把事情做錯順序。

word: slow and steady wins the race

meanings.meaning_en_US: Consistent and gradual progress leads to success.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 穩定的一步步的進展會導致成功

examples.sentence: Remember, [slow and steady wins the race]; don’t rush.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，穩定的進展會導致成功；不要急。
others: make hay while the sun shines

examples.sentence: In business, [slow and steady wins the race] is a valuable lesson.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業上，穩定的進展是值得學習的經驗。
others: keep your feet on the ground

examples.sentence: Achieving goals requires effort; [slow and steady wins the race].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 實現目標需要努力；穩定的進展會導致成功。

word: two heads are better than one

meanings.meaning_en_US: Collaboration often leads to better solutions than working alone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 合作常常能比獨自工作獲得更好的解決方案。
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 一個人更能快速解決問題

examples.sentence: When solving this problem, remember that [two heads are better than one].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在解決這個問題時，記住[兩個頭腦比一個好]。

examples.sentence: We should work together on this project; [two heads are better than one].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們應該在這個專案上合作；[兩個頭腦比一個好]。

examples.sentence: I appreciate your input; truly, [two heads are better than one].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我很感謝你的意見，真的，[兩個頭腦比一個好]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: The principle that one’s actions, good or bad, will eventually return to them.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 這一原則認為，無論好壞，一個人的行為最終會回到他們身上。

examples.sentence: He learned the hard way that [what goes around comes around].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他以最慘痛的方式學會了[你怎麼做就會怎麼回報]。
others: what you see is what you get

examples.sentence: Treat people with respect; remember, [what goes around comes around].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 尊重他人；記住，[你怎麼做就會怎麼回報]。

examples.sentence: Eventually, [what goes around comes around] in life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最終，在生活中[你怎麼做就會怎麼回報]。
others: what you give is what you take

word: your guess is as good as mine

meanings.meaning_en_US: Indicates that the speaker does not know the answer either.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 表示說話者也不知答案。

examples.sentence: I have no idea why he left; [your guess is as good as mine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我不知道他為什麼離開；[你的猜測和我的一樣好]。

examples.sentence: When it comes to the weather, [your guess is as good as mine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在天氣方面，[你的猜測和我的一樣好]。

examples.sentence: If she shows up or not, [your guess is as good as mine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果她是否出現，[你的猜測和我的一樣好]。

word: fly by the seat of one’s pants

meanings.meaning_en_US: To act based on intuition or without a plan.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 根據直覺行事，或沒有計劃地行事。

examples.sentence: During the project, we had to [fly by the seat of our pants].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這個專案中，我們不得不[根據直覺行事]。

examples.sentence: I don’t have a strategy; I just [fly by the seat of my pants].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我沒有策略；我只是[根據直覺行事]。

examples.sentence: You often just [fly by the seat of your pants] when making decisions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你在做決策時常常只是[根據直覺行事]。

word: get the short end of the stick

meanings.meaning_en_US: To receive the less favorable part of a situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在情況中獲得不利的一面。

examples.sentence: He always seems to [get the short end of the stick] in negotiations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在談判中總是似乎[得到不利的一面]。

examples.sentence: Sometimes life can make you feel like you [got the short end of the stick].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時生活會讓你感覺你[得到不利的一面]。

examples.sentence: In this situation, I really [got the short end of the stick].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這種情況下，我真的[得到不利的一面]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To deliberately ignore someone or treat them with indifference.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 故意忽視某人或對其漠不關心

examples.sentence: After their argument, she decided to [give him the cold shoulder].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在他們爭吵之後，她決定故意忽視他。

examples.sentence: He felt upset when his friends [gave him the cold shoulder].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他的朋友們對他漠不關心時，他感到不安。

examples.sentence: She always [gives the cold shoulder] to people she doesn't like.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是對不喜歡的人故意忽視。

word: he who laughs last laughs best

meanings.meaning_en_US: The ultimate success of a person is what truly matters, regardless of initial setbacks or failures.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 最終的成功才是最重要的，不論最初的挫折或失敗

examples.sentence: Though he faced many challenges, [he who laughs last laughs best].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 雖然他面對許多挑戰，但最終的成功才是最重要的。

examples.sentence: In the end, [he who laughs last laughs best] after all his hard work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最終，在他所有的努力之後，最終的成功才是最重要的。

examples.sentence: Critics doubted her, but [he who laughs last laughs best] as she became successful.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 批評者們懷疑她，但最終的成功才是最重要的。

word: light at the end of the tunnel

meanings.meaning_en_US: A sign of hope or a positive outcome after a long period of difficulty.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 經歷長時間困難後的希望或積極結果

examples.sentence: After months of hard work, I finally see the [light at the end of the tunnel].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過幾個月的艱苦工作，我終於看到了希望的曙光。

examples.sentence: The team is struggling, but they believe there is [light at the end of the tunnel].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 團隊正在掙扎，但他們相信還是有希望的曙光。

examples.sentence: Although it's tough, I remind myself that there's always [light at the end of the tunnel].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 雖然很困難，但我提醒自己總會有希望的曙光。

word: like shooting fish in a barrel

meanings.meaning_en_US: An activity that is very easy to accomplish or achieve.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個極其容易完成或達成的活動

examples.sentence: Winning the game was [like shooting fish in a barrel] for them.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對他們來說，贏得比賽就像是輕而易舉。

examples.sentence: For someone experienced, solving this problem is [like shooting fish in a barrel].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對於有經驗的人來說，解決這個問題就是輕而易舉。

examples.sentence: Teaching these students is [like shooting fish in a barrel].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 教這些學生就像是輕而易舉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Small, consistent efforts can lead to significant accomplishments.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 小而持續的努力可以導致重大的成就

examples.sentence: Remember, [little strokes fell great oaks], so keep working steadily.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，小而穩定的努力可以達成重大成就，所以繼續穩步工作。

examples.sentence: Her daily writing practice shows that [little strokes fell great oaks].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她每天的寫作練習證明了小而穩定的努力可以達成重大成就。

examples.sentence: They built their business slowly, believing that [little strokes fell great oaks].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們慢慢建立了商業，堅信小而持續的努力可以導致重大的成就。

word: walk a mile in someone’s shoes

meanings.meaning_en_US: To understand someone else's experiences and perspective.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 理解別人的經歷和觀點

examples.sentence: Before judging him, try to [walk a mile in his shoes].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在評判他之前，試著理解一下他的處境。

examples.sentence: It's important to [walk a mile in someone’s shoes] to foster empathy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了培養同理心，理解別人的處境是很重要的。

examples.sentence: While discussing issues, always try to [walk a mile in their shoes].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在討論問題時，始終試著理解別人的處境。

word: wear your heart on your sleeve

meanings.meaning_en_US: To openly show and express your emotions.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 公開表達和展示情感

examples.sentence: She tends to [wear her heart on her sleeve], making her feelings clear.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她往往公開表達情感，讓她的感受變得清晰。

examples.sentence: People appreciate those who [wear their hearts on their sleeves].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人們欣賞那些公開表達情感的人。

examples.sentence: If you [wear your heart on your sleeve], others can connect with you better.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你公開表達情感，別人可以更好地與你連結。

word: a penny saved is a penny earned

meanings.meaning_en_US: Saving money is just as important as earning it.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 儲蓄錢和賺錢同樣重要

examples.sentence: Remember, [a penny saved is a penny earned] when spending.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在花錢時，記住儲蓄和賺錢一樣重要。

examples.sentence: By cutting unnecessary expenses, she believes that [a penny saved is a penny earned].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過削減不必要的開支，她堅信儲蓄和賺錢一樣重要。

examples.sentence: He lives by the motto that [a penny saved is a penny earned].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他遵循著儲蓄和賺錢同樣重要的格言。

word: a rolling stone gathers no moss

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who does not settle in one place rarely achieves success.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不在一個地方安定的人很少能達到成功
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 永遠待在一個地方是好事

examples.sentence: [A rolling stone gathers no moss], so don't be afraid to change jobs.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不在一個地方安定的人很少能達到成功，所以不要害怕換工作。

examples.sentence: He loves to travel, believing that [a rolling stone gathers no moss].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他喜歡旅行，堅信不在一個地方安定的人很少能達到成功。

examples.sentence: Remember, [a rolling stone gathers no moss], so explore new opportunities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，不在一個地方安定的人很少能達到成功，所以探索新機會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: What a person actually does is more important than what they say.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個人實際做的事情比他所說的話更重要

examples.sentence: He often promises change, but in reality, [actions speak louder than words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他經常承諾改變，但事實上，實際行動比口頭承諾更重要。

examples.sentence: They believe in the saying, [actions speak louder than words], which is why they always show kindness.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們相信‘行動勝於言辭’，因此他們總是展現友善。

examples.sentence: In our team, [actions speak louder than words], so we focus on results.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我們的團隊中，事實上，實際行動比口頭承諾更重要，因此我們專注於結果。

word: between a rock and a hard place

meanings.meaning_en_US: Being faced with two difficult choices.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 面臨兩個困難的選擇

examples.sentence: She found herself [between a rock and a hard place] when choosing between jobs.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當在選擇工作之間，她感到面臨困難的兩難選擇。

examples.sentence: In this negotiation, both options put me [between a rock and a hard place].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這次談判中，兩個選擇都讓我面臨困難的兩難選擇。

examples.sentence: When her friends asked for help, she felt [between a rock and a hard place].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她的朋友們請求幫忙時，她感到面臨兩個困難的選擇。

word: bite off more than you can chew

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take on more responsibility than one can handle.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 承擔超出自己能力範圍的責任

examples.sentence: I think I [bit off more than I can chew] by volunteering for three projects.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我覺得自己承擔了超出自己能力範圍的責任，因為我自願參加了三個項目。

examples.sentence: Many students [bite off more than they can chew] every semester.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多學生每個學期都承擔了超出自己能力範圍的責任。

examples.sentence: Before committing, I must ask myself if I am [biting off more than I can chew].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在承諾之前，我必須問自己是否承擔了超出自己能力範圍的責任。

word: burning the candle at both ends

meanings.meaning_en_US: To overwork oneself by doing too much in too little time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在短時間內做太多而使自己過度工作

examples.sentence: He has been [burning the candle at both ends] with his work schedule.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的工作時間表使他過度工作。

examples.sentence: Students often [burn the candle at both ends] during finals week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 學生們在期末考試周時經常過度工作。

examples.sentence: If you keep [burning the candle at both ends], you'll burn out quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你繼續過度工作，會很快筋疲力盡。

word: can’t judge a book by its cover

meanings.meaning_en_US: One should not judge something based solely on its appearance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物

examples.sentence: Remember, you can’t [judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，你不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: Many people forget that you can’t [judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多人忘記了不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: It’s important to remember that you can’t [judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物是很重要的。

word: can’t make heads or tails of it

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be unable to understand something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 無法理解某事

examples.sentence: I can’t [make heads or tails of it] after reading the instructions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在看完指示後，我無法理解它。

examples.sentence: He was confused and couldn’t [make heads or tails of it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他感到困惑，無法理解它。

examples.sentence: When I listen to her explanations, I can’t [make heads or tails of it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我聽她的解釋時，我無法理解它。

word: don’t judge a book by its cover

meanings.meaning_en_US: One should not judge something based solely on its appearance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物

examples.sentence: Always remember, [don’t judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 永遠記住，不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: It’s essential to [not judge a book by its cover] when meeting new people.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在認識新朋友時，重要的是不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: In life, you should [not judge a book by its cover] too quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，你不應該過快根據外表來判斷事物。

word: every cloud has a silver lining

meanings.meaning_en_US: Every negative situation has a positive aspect or outcome.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 每個消極的情況都有積極的方面或結果

examples.sentence: Even when things go wrong, [every cloud has a silver lining].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 即使事情走向錯誤，每個消極的情況都有積極的方面或結果。

examples.sentence: She always reminds herself that [every cloud has a silver lining].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是提醒自己每個消極的情況都有積極的方面。

examples.sentence: He believes that [every cloud has a silver lining] during tough times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在艱難時期，他相信每個消極的情況都有積極的方面。

word: give credit where credit is due

meanings.meaning_en_US: To acknowledge and appreciate someone's contributions or achievements.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 承認並讚賞某人的貢獻或成就

examples.sentence: You should [give credit where credit is due] to your team for the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該承認並讚賞你團隊在這個項目中的貢獻。

examples.sentence: Always [give credit where credit is due], especially in teamwork.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在團隊合作中，永遠要承認並讚賞別人的貢獻。

examples.sentence: It's crucial to [give credit where credit is due] in any organization.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在任何組織中，承認並讚賞某人的貢獻是很重要的。

word: half a loaf is better than none

meanings.meaning_en_US: It's better to have a partial advantage than to have nothing at all.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 擁有部分的好處勝過一無所有

examples.sentence: While it's not perfect, [half a loaf is better than none] in this situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 雖然這不是完美的，但在這種情況下，部分的好處勝過一無所有。

examples.sentence: [Half a loaf is better than none], so accept what you can get.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 部分的好處勝過一無所有，所以接受你能得到的。

examples.sentence: In tough times, [half a loaf is better than none] should be your goal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在困難的時期，部分的好處勝過一無所有應該是你的目標。

word: if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it

meanings.meaning_en_US: If something is functioning well, there is no need to change it.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 如果某事運行良好，就沒有必要去改變它

examples.sentence: The software is running perfectly; [if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個軟體運行得很好；如果它運行良好，就沒有必要去改變它。
