examples.sentence: Our current strategy is successful; [if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們目前的策略很成功；如果它運行良好，就沒有必要去改變它。

examples.sentence: [If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it] should apply to our processes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果某事運行良好，就沒有必要去改變它應該適用於我們的流程。

word: never judge a book by its cover

meanings.meaning_en_US: One should not judge something based solely on its appearance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物

examples.sentence: Always remember, [never judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 永遠記住，不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: It’s essential to [never judge a book by its cover] when meeting new people.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在認識新朋友時，重要的是不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: In life, you should [never judge a book by its cover] too quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，你不應該過快根據外表來判斷事物。

word: put all your eggs in one basket

meanings.meaning_en_US: To risk everything on a single venture.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在單一項目上冒險一切

examples.sentence: Investing all your money in one stock means you’re [putting all your eggs in one basket].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 把所有的錢都投資在一支股票上意味著你在單一項目上冒險一切。

examples.sentence: She decided to [put all her eggs in one basket] by starting a single business.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定創辦一家公司，因為這是她的唯一選擇。

examples.sentence: You should be careful not to [put all your eggs in one basket] when investing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在投資時，你應該小心不要在單一項目上冒險一切。

synonyms: don't put all your resources in one place

meanings.meaning_en_US: Information that comes directly from the source.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 直接來自來源的信息

examples.sentence: I heard it [straight from the horse’s mouth] that they are closing the office.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我直接聽到消息說他們要關閉辦公室。

examples.sentence: When it comes to news, I prefer to get it [straight from the horse’s mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在新聞方面，我更喜歡直接來自來源的信息。

examples.sentence: She always shares what she knows [straight from the horse’s mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是直接分享她所知道的消息。

word: the early bird catches the worm

meanings.meaning_en_US: Those who take action early will gain a reward.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 及早行動的人將會獲得回報

examples.sentence: If you want to secure a good job, remember that [the early bird catches the worm].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想獲得一份好工作，記住及早行動的人將會獲得回報。

examples.sentence: They always say [the early bird catches the worm] when it comes to opportunities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每當面對機會時，他們總是這麼說：及早行動的人將會獲得回報。

examples.sentence: In business, [the early bird catches the worm] is often true.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業中，及早行動的人將會獲得回報這通常是對的。

word: a leopard can’t change its spots

meanings.meaning_en_US: People cannot change their inherent nature.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 人無法改變他們天生的性格

examples.sentence: You can't expect him to behave differently; [a leopard can’t change its spots].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不能期望他有所改變；人無法改變他們天生的性格。

examples.sentence: [A leopard can’t change its spots], so don’t be surprised by his actions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人無法改變他們天生的性格，所以對他的行為不要感到驚訝。

examples.sentence: No matter how hard he tries, [a leopard can’t change its spots].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不管他多麼努力，人無法改變他們天生的性格。
others: no one is fixed in nature

word: all dressed up and nowhere to go

meanings.meaning_en_US: Prepared and ready but with no opportunity to act.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 準備好但卻沒有行動的機會

examples.sentence: She felt [all dressed up and nowhere to go] during the lockdown.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在禁足期間，她感到準備好但卻沒有行動的機會。

examples.sentence: With the event canceled, he was [all dressed up and nowhere to go].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為活動取消，他感到準備好但卻沒有行動的機會。

examples.sentence: Being [all dressed up and nowhere to go] made her feel frustrated.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 感到準備好但卻沒有行動的機會讓她感到沮喪。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Being clean is a virtue and reflects one's character.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 潔淨是一種美德，反映出一個人的性格

examples.sentence: She believes that [cleanliness is next to godliness] in every aspect of life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她相信潔淨是一種美德，反映出一個人的性格，適用於生活的各個方面。

examples.sentence: In our family, [cleanliness is next to godliness] is held as an important principle.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我們家，潔淨是一種美德，反映出一個人的性格，是一個重要的原則。

examples.sentence: He was taught that [cleanliness is next to godliness] from a young age.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他從小就被教導潔淨是一種美德，反映出一個人的性格。

word: don’t let the cat out of the bag

meanings.meaning_en_US: To keep a secret or not to reveal information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保密或不透露信息

examples.sentence: Please don’t [let the cat out of the bag] about the surprise party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請不要透露關於驚喜派對的消息。

examples.sentence: He accidentally [let the cat out of the bag] during the discussion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在討論中不小心透露了消息。

examples.sentence: Make sure to [not let the cat out of the bag] until it’s time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保不要在時間來臨之前透露消息。

word: don’t throw good money after bad

meanings.meaning_en_US: Do not continue to invest in a losing endeavor.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要繼續在失敗的事業上投入資金

examples.sentence: It's better to cut your losses than to [throw good money after bad].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 與其在失敗的事業上浪費金錢，不如減少損失更好。

examples.sentence: He realized he shouldn’t [throw good money after bad] trying to save that project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他意識到不應該在試圖挽救那個項目時再投入資金。

examples.sentence: In business, you shouldn’t [throw good money after bad] if something clearly isn't working.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業中，如果某事明顯不起作用，你不應該繼續投入資金。

word: keep your nose to the grindstone

meanings.meaning_en_US: To work hard and diligently.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 努力且勤奮地工作

examples.sentence: If you want to succeed, you’ll need to [keep your nose to the grindstone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想成功，你需要努力且勤奮地工作。

examples.sentence: He believes that [keeping your nose to the grindstone] leads to success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他相信努力且勤奮地工作會帶來成功。

examples.sentence: To reach her goals, she knows she must [keep her nose to the grindstone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了達成她的目標，她知道自己必須努力且勤奮地工作。

word: man does not live by bread alone

meanings.meaning_en_US: People need more than just basic necessities to be fulfilled.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 人們需要的不僅僅是基本需求才能得到滿足

examples.sentence: In life, [man does not live by bread alone]; we need love and companionship.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，人們需要的不僅僅是基本需求才能得到滿足；我們需要愛和伴侶。

examples.sentence: [Man does not live by bread alone] because spiritual fulfillment is also essential.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為靈性滿足也是必需的，人們不僅僅依賴於基本需求。

examples.sentence: The saying reminds us that [man does not live by bread alone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這句話提醒我們，單靠基本需求並不足以滿足生活。

word: the best things in life are free

meanings.meaning_en_US: The most valuable experiences and moments cannot be bought.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 最珍貴的經歷和時刻無法用金錢購買
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 所有價值都應用錢衡量

examples.sentence: She often says that [the best things in life are free].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她常說，最珍貴的經歷和時刻無法用金錢購買。

examples.sentence: His memories confirm that [the best things in life are free].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的記憶證明了最珍貴的經歷和時刻無法用金錢購買。

examples.sentence: [The best things in life are free] is a reminder to value experiences over wealth.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這句話提醒我們珍惜經歷勝於金錢。

word: the pot calling the kettle black

meanings.meaning_en_US: A situation in which someone criticizes another for a fault they themselves possess.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一個人批評另一個人有自己擁有的缺點

examples.sentence: When he called her lazy, it was just [the pot calling the kettle black].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他叫她懶惰時，這簡直就是在自我矛盾。

examples.sentence: Often, [the pot calls the kettle black] when he criticizes others.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他批評別人時，經常是自相矛盾。

examples.sentence: It's ironic when someone unpunctual points out others' tardiness; it's [the pot calling the kettle black].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當一個不守時的人指出別人遲到時，這真是諷刺，這簡直是在自我矛盾。

word: you made your bed, now lie in it

meanings.meaning_en_US: You must accept the consequences of your actions.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 你必須承擔自己行動的後果

examples.sentence: You chose to skip the meeting; [you made your bed, now lie in it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你選擇了跳過會議；你必須承擔自己行動的後果。

examples.sentence: [You made your bed, now lie in it] applies when facing the results of poor choices.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當面對不好的選擇後果時，這句話很適用。

examples.sentence: After making that decision, [you made your bed, now lie in it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在做出那個決定後，你必須承擔自己行動的後果。

word: a picture paints a thousand words

meanings.meaning_en_US: An image can convey a complex idea more effectively than words.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一幅圖畫能比語言更有效地傳達複雜的想法

examples.sentence: Looking at the photo, I thought, [a picture paints a thousand words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 看著這張照片，我想，一幅圖畫能比語言更有效地傳達複雜的想法。

examples.sentence: In presentations, remember that often [a picture paints a thousand words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在簡報中，記得通常一幅圖畫能比語言更有效地傳達複雜的想法。

examples.sentence: She explained the idea clearly, but [a picture paints a thousand words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她清楚地解釋了這個想法，但其實一幅圖畫能比語言更有效地傳達複雜的想法。

word: birds of a feather flock together

meanings.meaning_en_US: People with similar interests or characteristics tend to associate with each other.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 有共同興趣或特徵的人往往會互相聯繫

examples.sentence: In the art community, [birds of a feather flock together].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在藝術社區中，有共同興趣或特徵的人往往會互相聯繫。

examples.sentence: You’ll find that [birds of a feather flock together] in most social groups.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你會發現，在大多數社交圈中，有共同興趣或特徵的人往往會互相聯繫。

examples.sentence: In clubs, it's clear that [birds of a feather flock together].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在俱樂部中，明顯有共同興趣或特徵的人往往會互相聯繫。

word: if you can’t beat them, join them

meanings.meaning_en_US: If you cannot defeat an opponent, it might be easier to become part of them.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 如果你無法擊敗對手，那麼加入他們可能會更簡單

examples.sentence: He wanted to change the system, but realized [if you can’t beat them, join them].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他想改變體系，但意識到如果你無法擊敗對手，那麼加入他們可能會更簡單。

examples.sentence: In competitive markets, sometimes [if you can’t beat them, join them] works best.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在競爭激烈的市場中，有時如果你無法擊敗對手，那麼加入他們可能會更簡單。

examples.sentence: She found herself understanding that [if you can’t beat them, join them] was practical.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她發現，接受對手，加入他們可能會更簡單，這是實際的。

word: keep one’s nose to the grindstone

meanings.meaning_en_US: To work hard and diligently.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 努力且勤奮地工作

examples.sentence: If you want to succeed, you’ll need to [keep one’s nose to the grindstone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你希望成功，你需要努力且勤奮地工作。

examples.sentence: He believes that [keeping one’s nose to the grindstone] leads to success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他相信努力且勤奮地工作會帶來成功。

examples.sentence: To reach her goals, she knows she must [keep her nose to the grindstone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了達成她的目標，她知道自己必須努力且勤奮地工作。

word: make a mountain out of a molehill

meanings.meaning_en_US: To exaggerate the significance of a minor issue.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 誇大小問題的重要性

examples.sentence: She tends to [make a mountain out of a molehill] when stressed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她壓力大時，往往會誇大小問題的重要性。

examples.sentence: Don’t [make a mountain out of a molehill] over a simple misunderstanding.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要因為小誤會而誇大問題的重要性。

examples.sentence: He always [makes a mountain out of a molehill] with small inconveniences.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是對一些小不便誇大其詞。

word: not the sharpest tool in the shed

meanings.meaning_en_US: Referring to someone who is not very smart or clever.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 指一個人不是特別聰明或機靈

examples.sentence: He’s nice, but he’s [not the sharpest tool in the shed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他很好，但他的智力不是特別聰明。

examples.sentence: Sometimes people forget that he’s [not the sharpest tool in the shed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時人們會忘記他不是特別聰明。

examples.sentence: Don’t take it personally; he’s just [not the sharpest tool in the shed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要放在心上；他只是沒有特別聰明。

word: the squeaky wheel gets the grease

meanings.meaning_en_US: The problem that gets the most attention is often the one that is addressed first.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 最受關注的問題往往是最先被解決的
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 安靜的輪子不需要油脂
不必要的問題會被忽略

examples.sentence: If you want a raise, you should [be the squeaky wheel].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想要加薪，你應該表現得引人注意。

examples.sentence: In a meeting, the person who [is the squeaky wheel] usually gets heard.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議中，最受關注的人通常會被聽到。

examples.sentence: Sometimes you have to [be the squeaky wheel] to get what you need.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候你必須引起注意才能得到你所需要的。

word: time flies when you’re having fun

meanings.meaning_en_US: Time seems to pass more quickly when you are enjoying yourself.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 當你享受生活時，時間似乎過得特別快

examples.sentence: It’s hard to believe that the weekend is over; [time flies when you’re having fun].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 難以相信週末就結束了；當你享受時，時間過得特別快。

examples.sentence: When we were at the amusement park, [time flew] by so quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我們在遊樂園時，時間過得特別快。

examples.sentence: I lost track of time while we were chatting; [time flies when you’re having fun].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們聊天時我忘了時間；當你享受時，時間過得特別快。

word: when in rome, do as the romans do

meanings.meaning_en_US: You should adapt to the customs of the places you visit.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 你應該適應你所訪問地區的習俗

examples.sentence: While traveling, I always remember that [when in rome, do as the romans do].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 旅行時，我總是記得要適應當地的習俗。

examples.sentence: She learned to enjoy local dishes because [when in rome, do as the romans do].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她學會享受當地美食，因為要適應當地的習俗。

examples.sentence: We tried to dress appropriately because [when in rome, do as the romans do].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們努力穿著得體，因為應該適應當地的習俗。

meanings.meaning_en_US: If there are signs that something is wrong, there is likely a real problem.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 如果有徵兆表明某事有誤，那麼可能確實存在問題

examples.sentence: The rumors might be true; [where there’s smoke, there’s fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這些謠言可能是真的；如果有徵兆表明某事有誤，那麼可能確實存在問題。

examples.sentence: People are starting to wonder; [where there’s smoke, there’s fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人們開始懷疑；如果有徵兆表明某事有誤，那麼可能確實存在問題。

examples.sentence: She decided to investigate because [where there’s smoke, there’s fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定調查，因為如果有徵兆表明某事有誤，那麼可能確實存在問題。

word: a leopard doesn’t change its spots

meanings.meaning_en_US: People cannot change their innate nature.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 人無法改變其天生的性格

examples.sentence: You shouldn't trust him; [a leopard doesn’t change its spots].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不該信任他；人無法改變其天生的性格。

examples.sentence: She always ends up doing the same thing; [a leopard doesn’t change its spots].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是做同樣的事情；人無法改變其天生的性格。

examples.sentence: You can see his old habits; [a leopard doesn’t change its spots].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以看到他的舊習慣；人無法改變其天生的性格。

word: always a bridesmaid, never a bride

meanings.meaning_en_US: Refers to someone who is often in supportive roles but never reaches their own goals.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 指的是經常擔任支持角色卻從未達到自己目標的人

examples.sentence: She’s been in many relationships but remains single; [always a bridesmaid, never a bride].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她有過很多段關係，但仍然單身；指的是經常擔任支持角色卻從未達到自己目標的人。

examples.sentence: In her career, she helps others succeed but has not advanced herself; [always a bridesmaid, never a bride].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的職業生涯中，她幫助其他人成功，但自己卻未能晉升；指的是經常擔任支持角色卻從未達到自己目標的人。

examples.sentence: Despite her talents, she feels [always a bridesmaid, never a bride].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管她的才能出眾，她仍感到自己是個失敗者；指的是經常擔任支持角色卻從未達到自己目標的人。

word: butter wouldn’t melt in your mouth

meanings.meaning_en_US: Describes someone who appears innocent or demure but may be the opposite.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 形容那些表面看起來清純或害羞，但可能正好相反的人

examples.sentence: She acts so prim and proper; [butter wouldn’t melt in her mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她表現得如此端莊；形容那些表面看起來清純或害羞，但可能正好相反的人。

examples.sentence: He seems sweet and shy; [butter wouldn’t melt in his mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他看起來甜美而害羞；形容那些表面看起來清純或害羞，但可能正好相反的人。

examples.sentence: You shouldn't be fooled; [butter wouldn’t melt in her mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不應該被欺騙；形容那些表面看起來清純或害羞，但可能正好相反的人。

word: can’t see the forest for the trees

meanings.meaning_en_US: Being too involved in the details of a problem to see the overall situation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 過於專注於問題的細節而無法看清全局

examples.sentence: In her analysis, she missed the bigger picture; [can’t see the forest for the trees].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的分析中，她錯過了整體情況；過於專注於問題的細節而無法看清全局。

examples.sentence: Sometimes, people [can’t see the forest for the trees] when dealing with problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候，人們在處理問題時會過於專注細節而無法看清全局。

examples.sentence: You need to step back; otherwise, you’ll [can’t see the forest for the trees].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要退一步；否則，你會過於專注於細節而無法看清全局。

word: don’t bite the hand that feeds you

meanings.meaning_en_US: Do not harm those who help you.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要傷害那些幫助你的人

examples.sentence: Make sure to stay respectful; [don’t bite the hand that feeds you].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保對人尊重；不要傷害那些幫助你的人。

examples.sentence: He criticized his boss for years; [don’t bite the hand that feeds you].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他批評他的上司多年；不要傷害那些幫助你的人。

examples.sentence: Remember, [don’t bite the hand that feeds you] if you wish to succeed.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，如果你想成功，千萬不要傷害那些幫助你的人。

word: give someone a run for their money

meanings.meaning_en_US: To challenge someone or provide strong competition.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 向某人挑戰或提供強有力的競爭

examples.sentence: He promised to [give her a run for her money] in the upcoming race.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他承諾在即將到來的比賽中向她挑戰。

examples.sentence: The new team member is sure to [give the old one a run for their money].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新成員肯定會向舊成員挑戰。

examples.sentence: If you train hard, you’ll [give your opponents a run for their money].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你努力訓練，你就能挑戰對手。

word: good things come to those who wait

meanings.meaning_en_US: Patience is often rewarded.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 耐心往往會得到獎賞

examples.sentence: Don’t rush into decisions; [good things come to those who wait].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要急於做決定；耐心往往會得到獎賞。

examples.sentence: In life, [good things come to those who wait] applies to relationships too.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，耐心往往會得到獎賞，這也適用於人際關係。

examples.sentence: She learned that [good things come to those who wait] after many trials.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過多次考驗後，她明白了耐心往往會得到獎賞。

word: have eyes in the back of your head

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be very aware of what is happening around you, even behind you.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 非常清楚發生在你周圍的事情，甚至是背後的事情

examples.sentence: As a teacher, you need to [have eyes in the back of your head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 作為一名老師，你需要非常清楚發生在你周圍的事情，甚至是背後的事情。

examples.sentence: In a busy restaurant, the manager must [have eyes in the back of their head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在一家繁忙的餐廳中，經理必須非常清楚周圍的情況，甚至是背後的事情。

examples.sentence: If you want to succeed in business, you must [have eyes in the back of your head].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想在商業中成功，你必須非常清楚四周的情況。

word: jack of all trades, master of none

meanings.meaning_en_US: Someone who is competent at many skills but does not specialize in any.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 某個人擁有多種技能卻不專精于任何一項

examples.sentence: He can do many things but lacks depth; he is a [jack of all trades, master of none].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他能做很多事情，但缺乏深度；某個人擁有多種技能卻不專精于任何一項。

examples.sentence: In her career, she’s been a [jack of all trades, master of none].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的職業生涯中，她是一個某個人擁有多種技能卻不專精于任何一項。

examples.sentence: While helpful, being a [jack of all trades, master of none] can be frustrating.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 雖然很有幫助，卻很令人沮喪；某個人擁有多種技能卻不專精于任何一項。

word: know it like the back of your hand

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be very familiar or knowledgeable about something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某事非常熟悉或了解

examples.sentence: He knows the city well; he [knows it like the back of his hand].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對這座城市很熟悉；他對某事非常熟悉或了解。

examples.sentence: I [know this subject like the back of my hand].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我對這個主題非常熟悉或了解。

examples.sentence: You can trust her insight; she [knows it like the back of her hand].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以信任她的見解；她對某事非常熟悉或了解。

word: never bite the hand that feeds you

meanings.meaning_en_US: Do not harm those who provide for you.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要傷害那些供給你的人

examples.sentence: Always be kind to your employers; [never bite the hand that feeds you].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 永遠對雇主友善；不要傷害那些供給你的人。

examples.sentence: Remember to show gratitude; [never bite the hand that feeds you].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住要感恩；不要傷害那些供給你的人。

examples.sentence: In relationships, [never bite the hand that feeds you].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在關係中，記住不要傷害那些供給你的人。

word: the pen is mightier than the sword

meanings.meaning_en_US: The written word is more powerful than military action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 文字比武力更強大

examples.sentence: Through literature, [the pen is mightier than the sword].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過文學，文字比武力更強大。

examples.sentence: Activists know that [the pen is mightier than the sword].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 活動人士明白，文字比武力更強大。

examples.sentence: History shows that [the pen is mightier than the sword].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 歷史顯示，文字比武力更強大。

word: to err is human, to forgive divine

meanings.meaning_en_US: Making mistakes is part of being human; forgiving is a noble act.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 犯錯是人性的部分；寬恕是高尚的行為

examples.sentence: Remember, [to err is human, to forgive divine].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，犯錯是人性的部分；寬恕是高尚的行為。

examples.sentence: In our community, [to err is human, to forgive divine] is our guiding principle.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我們的社區中，犯錯是人性的部分；寬恕是高尚的行為是我們的指導原則。

examples.sentence: He learned that [to err is human, to forgive divine] after many experiences.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過許多經歷，他知道犯錯是人性的部分；寬恕是高尚的行為。

word: a picture is worth a thousand words

meanings.meaning_en_US: An image can convey a complex idea or emotion more effectively than words.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一幅圖畫能更有效地傳達複雜的想法或情感

examples.sentence: Her expression showed everything; [a picture is worth a thousand words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的表情顯示了一切；一幅圖畫能更有效地傳達複雜的想法或情感。

examples.sentence: In advertising, [a picture is worth a thousand words] is a vital principle.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在廣告中，一幅圖畫能更有效地傳達複雜的想法或情感是基本原則。

examples.sentence: Every artist knows that [a picture is worth a thousand words].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每位藝術家都知道，圖畫超越任何文字的表達。

word: absence makes the heart grow fonder

meanings.meaning_en_US: Being away makes you appreciate someone or something more.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 遠離讓你更加珍惜某人或某事

examples.sentence: Being away from family, [absence makes the heart grow fonder].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 遠離家人會讓你更加珍惜；遠離讓你更加珍惜某人或某事。
others: too much time apart brings relief

examples.sentence: After a long separation, they realized [absence makes the heart grow fonder].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過長時間的分離，他們發覺遠離讓你更加珍惜某人或某事。

examples.sentence: Sometimes, [absence makes the heart grow fonder] in friendships.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時在友誼中，遠離讓你更加珍惜某人或某事。

word: butter wouldn’t melt in one’s mouth

meanings.meaning_en_US: An expression used for someone who looks innocent but is not.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 形容看似無辜但實際上不是的人

examples.sentence: Though she appears shy, I know that [butter wouldn’t melt in her mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 雖然她看起來害羞，但我知道她表面上無辜。

examples.sentence: He has a charming smile, but [butter wouldn’t melt in his mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他有迷人的微笑，但其實他不是無辜的。

examples.sentence: You shouldn’t be deceived; [butter wouldn’t melt in her mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不應該被欺騙，她表面上無辜。

word: don’t put the cart before the horse

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don’t confuse the order of things; do not prioritize the less important over the important.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要搞混事情的順序；不要把不重要的事放在重要事之前

examples.sentence: Before making a plan, remember [don’t put the cart before the horse].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在制定計劃之前，記住不要搞混事情的順序。

examples.sentence: In decision-making, [don’t put the cart before the horse] will guide you.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在決策中，記住不要搞混事情的順序將引導你。

examples.sentence: You’ll find success if you [don’t put the cart before the horse].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你不搞混事情的順序，你會獲得成功。

word: get up on the wrong side of the bed

meanings.meaning_en_US: To start the day in a bad mood.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以壞心情開始一天

examples.sentence: He must have [got up on the wrong side of the bed] today.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他今天一定是以壞心情開始一天。

examples.sentence: She’s snapping at everyone; looks like she [got up on the wrong side of the bed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在對每個人吼；看起來她今天心情不佳。

examples.sentence: When he’s irritable like this, I know he [got up on the wrong side of the bed].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他這樣易怒時，我知道他今天心情不好。

synonyms: wake up in a bad mood

word: you can’t judge a book by its cover

meanings.meaning_en_US: You cannot evaluate something solely based on its appearance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 你無法僅根據外表來評價某事

examples.sentence: Remember, [you can’t judge a book by its cover]; get to know the person first.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，你無法僅根據外表來評價某事；先了解這個人。
others: you can tell from a glance

examples.sentence: The quiet boy in the corner is more interesting; [you can’t judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 角落裡安靜的男孩更有趣；你無法僅根據外表來評價某事。
others: the loud ones are the best

examples.sentence: They underestimated her talent; [you can’t judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們低估了她的才華；你無法僅根據外表來評價某事。

word: a fool and his money are soon parted

meanings.meaning_en_US: Foolish people tend to lose their money quickly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 愚蠢的人會很快失去金錢
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 智慧的人永遠擁有金錢

examples.sentence: He keeps gambling; [a fool and his money are soon parted].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不斷賭博；愚蠢的人會很快失去金錢。

examples.sentence: She spends without thinking; [a fool and his money are soon parted].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她毫無思考地花錢；愚蠢的人會很快失去金錢。

examples.sentence: Avoid wasteful actions; [a fool and his money are soon parted].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 避免浪費行為；愚蠢的人會很快失去金錢。

word: beauty is in the eye of the beholder

meanings.meaning_en_US: Perceptions of beauty are subjective and vary from person to person.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對美的看法是主觀的，因人而異

examples.sentence: Different people find different things attractive; [beauty is in the eye of the beholder].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不同的人會找尋不同的吸引力；對美的看法是主觀的，因人而異。

examples.sentence: What I find pretty, you might not; [beauty is in the eye of the beholder].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我覺得漂亮的，你可能不這麼認為；對美的看法是主觀的，因人而異。
others: attraction is the same for all

examples.sentence: Art proves that [beauty is in the eye of the beholder].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 藝術證明了對美的看法因人而異。

word: necessity is the mother of invention

meanings.meaning_en_US: Needs drive creativity and innovation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 需求促進創造力和創新

examples.sentence: Many great inventions came from necessity; [necessity is the mother of invention].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多偉大的發明來自需求；需求促進創造力和創新。

examples.sentence: Innovations often arise from problems; [necessity is the mother of invention].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 創新往往源於問題；需求促進創造力和創新。

examples.sentence: She learned that [necessity is the mother of invention] through her challenges.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在挑戰中學到了需求促進創造力和創新。

word: never look a gift horse in the mouth

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don’t criticize or be ungrateful for a gift.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要批評或對贈品不感恩

examples.sentence: She accepted the donation gracefully; [never look a gift horse in the mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她優雅地接受了捐贈；不要批評或對贈品不感恩。

examples.sentence: He reminded them, [never look a gift horse in the mouth]; be thankful.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他提醒他們，不要批評或對贈品不感恩；要感恩。

examples.sentence: In relationships, [never look a gift horse in the mouth] is important.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在關係中，記住，不要批評或對贈品不感恩是很重要的。

word: cross that bridge when you come to it

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don’t worry about future problems before they happen.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在問題發生之前，不要擔心未來的問題
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 未來的情況總是確定的

examples.sentence: If issues arise later, we’ll [cross that bridge when we come to it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果問題出現，我們會在適當的時候去解決。不要擔心未來的問題。

examples.sentence: She encourages us not to stress; we’ll [cross that bridge when we come to it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她鼓勵我們不要焦慮；有問題再說，不要擔心未來的問題。

examples.sentence: Everyone is anxious, but she said, [cross that bridge when you come to it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每個人都很緊張，但她說到時再說吧；在問題發生之前，不要擔心未來的問題。

word: don’t put all your eggs in one basket

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don’t concentrate all your resources in one area; diversify.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要把所有資源集中在一個地方；要多樣化

examples.sentence: If you invest, remember: [don’t put all your eggs in one basket].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你投資，記住：不要把所有資源集中在一個地方。

examples.sentence: In business, it’s wise to [not put all your eggs in one basket].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業上，明智的做法是要多樣化。

examples.sentence: She learned the hard way; [don’t put all your eggs in one basket].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她吃過苦頭；明智的做法是要多樣化。

word: give someone the benefit of the doubt

meanings.meaning_en_US: To choose to believe someone's intention is good until proven otherwise.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 選擇相信某人的意圖是好的，直到證明不是

examples.sentence: In conflicts, I try to [give them the benefit of the doubt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在衝突中，我試著選擇相信某人的意圖是好的。

examples.sentence: We should [give him the benefit of the doubt] in this situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這種情況下，我們應該選擇相信某人的意圖是好的。

examples.sentence: It’s important to [give people the benefit of the doubt].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 選擇相信某人的意圖是好的，直到證明不是是很重要的。

word: stuck between a rock and a hard place

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be in a difficult situation where there are no good choices.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於一個困難的情況，沒有好的選擇

examples.sentence: He felt [stuck between a rock and a hard place] when choosing between jobs.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在選擇工作時，他感到無法決定。

examples.sentence: In this dilemma, we are [stuck between a rock and a hard place].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這個困境中，我們無法決定。

examples.sentence: Being [stuck between a rock and a hard place] is tough for anyone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 身處困境對任何人都很困難。

word: you can’t teach an old dog new tricks

meanings.meaning_en_US: It's difficult to change someone's habits or nature, especially in older individuals.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 難以改變某人的習慣或本性，尤其是年長的人

examples.sentence: He resists any new methods; [you can’t teach an old dog new tricks].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對新方法總是抗拒；難以改變某人的習慣或本性，尤其是年長的人。

examples.sentence: With age comes stubbornness; [you can’t teach an old dog new tricks].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 年紀大了就會固執；難以改變某人的習慣或本性，尤其是年長的人。

examples.sentence: She found it hard to adapt; [you can’t teach an old dog new tricks].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她發現很難適應；難以改變某人的習慣或本性，尤其是年長的人。

word: caught between a rock and a hard place

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be in a difficult situation with no easy solutions.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於困難的情況，沒有簡單的解決方案
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 所有問題都有解決辦法

examples.sentence: She felt [caught between a rock and a hard place] with her job options.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在工作選擇上感到無法決定。

examples.sentence: Finding a mediator is key; otherwise, we’re [caught between a rock and a hard place].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 尋找中介是關鍵；否則，我們將無法找到解決方案。

examples.sentence: When faced with this choice, he felt [caught between a rock and a hard place].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 面對此選擇時，他感到無法決定。

word: between the devil and the deep blue sea

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be in a difficult situation with two unfavorable choices.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 處於一個困難的情況，面對兩個不利的選擇

examples.sentence: He felt [between the devil and the deep blue sea] about his job situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在他的工作中，他感到無法抉擇。

examples.sentence: In this scenario, you’re [between the devil and the deep blue sea].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在此情況下，你感到無法抉擇。

examples.sentence: Making a choice here leaves you [between the devil and the deep blue sea].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在這裡做出選擇使你感到無法決定。

word: born with a silver spoon in one’s mouth

meanings.meaning_en_US: Born into a wealthy and privileged family.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 出生於富裕且權利的家庭

examples.sentence: He never had to work hard; he was [born with a silver spoon in his mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他從來不必辛苦工作；他出生於富裕且權利的家庭。

examples.sentence: People assume she has an easy life; she was [born with a silver spoon in her mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人們認為她的生活很輕鬆；她出生於富裕且權利的家庭。

examples.sentence: With so many advantages, he was [born with a silver spoon in his mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 擁有這麼多的優勢，他出生於富裕且權利的家庭。

word: hear it straight from the horse’s mouth

meanings.meaning_en_US: To hear information from the original or most reliable source.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 從原始或最可靠的來源得知資訊

examples.sentence: I’d rather [hear it straight from the horse’s mouth] than trust rumors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我更願意從原始或最可靠的來源得知資訊，而不是相信流言。

examples.sentence: He got the updates; [hear it straight from the horse’s mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他得到了更新；從原始或最可靠的來源得知資訊。

examples.sentence: When it comes to news, I prefer to [hear it straight from the horse’s mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在新聞方面，我更願意從原始或最可靠的來源得知資訊。

word: out of the frying pan and into the fire

meanings.meaning_en_US: Moving from a bad situation to a worse one.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 從一個糟糕的情況轉到更糟的情況

examples.sentence: After switching jobs, he felt like he jumped [out of the frying pan and into the fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 換了工作後，他感覺像是進入了更糟糕的情況。

examples.sentence: She realized her mistake; it was [out of the frying pan and into the fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她意識到自己的錯誤；這是從一個糟糕的情況轉到更糟的情況。

examples.sentence: Be careful not to jump [out of the frying pan and into the fire].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 小心別走進更糟的情況。

word: you can’t have your cake and eat it too

meanings.meaning_en_US: You cannot have everything; there must be trade-offs.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 你無法擁有一切；必須做出取捨

examples.sentence: If you desire both freedom and security, remember, [you can’t have your cake and eat it too].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你渴望自由和安全，記住，你無法擁有一切；必須做出取捨。

examples.sentence: In business, [you can’t have your cake and eat it too]; choose wisely.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業中，必須做出取捨；明智地選擇。

examples.sentence: Realize that [you can’t have your cake and eat it too].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 意識到你無法擁有一切；必須做出取捨。

word: you scratch my back, i’ll scratch yours

meanings.meaning_en_US: Mutual assistance for mutual benefit.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 互助以達到雙方的利益

examples.sentence: In business, it's often [you scratch my back, I’ll scratch yours].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業中，這通常是互惠互利的原則。

examples.sentence: They help each other out; it’s all about [you scratch my back, I’ll scratch yours].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們互相幫忙；這是互助以達到雙方的利益的原則。

examples.sentence: Remember that [you scratch my back, I’ll scratch yours] in relationships.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，在關係中，互助以達到雙方的利益。

word: hope for the best, prepare for the worst

meanings.meaning_en_US: Maintain a positive outlook while being ready for potential difficulties.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持積極的心態，同時做好面對潛在困難的準備
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 只盡可能期待最壞的結果

examples.sentence: In projects, [hope for the best, prepare for the worst] is vital.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在項目中，保持積極的心態，同時做好面對潛在困難的準備是至關重要的。

examples.sentence: As we face uncertainty, [hope for the best, prepare for the worst] guides us.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我們面對不確定性時，保持積極的心態是導路。

examples.sentence: When planning events, [hope for the best, prepare for the worst] is essential.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在規劃活動時，保持積極的心態是非常重要的。

word: one man’s trash is another man’s treasure

meanings.meaning_en_US: What is worthless to one person may be valuable to someone else.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對一個人來說無價值的東西，對另一個人來說可能是寶貴的。

examples.sentence: To her, that old lamp is just junk, but it's [one man's trash] to him.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對她來說，那盞舊燈只是垃圾，但對他來說這是[一個人的垃圾]

examples.sentence: He turned what others deemed useless into [one man's trash] by reselling it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他把別人認為無用的東西轉變為[一個人的垃圾]透過轉售。

examples.sentence: In the world of antiques, [one man's trash] can fetch a high price.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在古董的世界裡，[一個人的垃圾]可以賣個好價錢。

synonyms: one person's loss is another's gain

word: the bigger they are, the harder they fall

meanings.meaning_en_US: The larger or more powerful someone is, the more serious their downfall or failure will be.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 越大或越有權力的人，失敗或墮落時的後果也越嚴重。

examples.sentence: When the corporation crumbled, it proved that [the bigger they are] in business, the harder they fall.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當這家公司崩潰時，證明了[越大越難]在商業上更是如此。

examples.sentence: He learned that [the bigger they are] after the athlete's unexpected defeat.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在這位運動員意外失利之後明白了[越大越難]。

examples.sentence: Politicians often discover [the bigger they are] when they lose public favor.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 政治家們常常在失去公眾支持時發現[越大越難]。

word: all work and no play makes jack a dull boy

meanings.meaning_en_US: Without time off from work, a person becomes both bored and boring.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不休息工作的人會變得既無聊又沉悶。

examples.sentence: She realized that [all work and no play] made her life monotonous.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她意識到[只有工作而無娛樂]使她的生活單調。

examples.sentence: He took a vacation because he knew that [all work and no play] was affecting his creativity.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他請了假，因為他知道[工作而不玩樂]影響了他的創意。

examples.sentence: Realizing [all work and no play] wasn't a good life philosophy, she began to socialize more.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 意識到[只有工作沒有娛樂]不是好的生活哲學後，她開始更多社交。

synonyms: too much work leads to burnout

word: give someone a taste of their own medicine

meanings.meaning_en_US: To treat someone in the same way that they have treated others, often negatively.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以他們對待他人的方式來對待某人，通常是負面的。

examples.sentence: After being rude, she was shown [a taste of her own medicine] at the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議上，她被展示了[她自己的藥味]，因為她之前不禮貌。

examples.sentence: He finally got [a taste of his own medicine] when his tricks backfired.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他的把戲反噬時，他終於得到了[他自己的藥味]。

examples.sentence: By lying to her friends, he gave himself [a taste of his own medicine] when they confronted him.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過對朋友撒謊，他在被朋友質疑時得到了[他自己的藥味]。

word: a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush

meanings.meaning_en_US: It is better to hold onto something you have than to risk losing it by trying to get something greater.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 擁有的東西比追求可能失去的更有價值。

examples.sentence: He decided to keep the job he had because [a bird in the hand] is better than taking a chance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定保留他擁有的工作，因為[手中的鳥]總比冒險好。

examples.sentence: She chose to stay with her current partner since [a bird in the hand] is more comforting than risking loneliness.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她選擇和目前的伴侶在一起，因為[手中的鳥]比冒險孤單要令人安慰。
others: every choice can lead to failure

examples.sentence: Investors often think that [a bird in the hand] is safer than chasing high-risk stocks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 投資者常常認為[手中的鳥]比追逐高風險股票來得安全。

synonyms: it's better to be content with what you have

word: don’t count your chickens before they hatch

meanings.meaning_en_US: Do not assume success before it is certain.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 未確定成功前不要假設它。

examples.sentence: He was excited about the promotion but remembered [not to count his chickens] before the interview.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對晉升感到興奮，但記住[不要計算他的小雞]在面試前。

examples.sentence: Even when everything looked good, she knew [not to count her chickens] until it was official.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 即使一切看起來都很好，她知道[不要計算她的小雞]，直到一切官宣。

examples.sentence: Parents often tell their children [not to count their chickens] when it comes to anticipated gifts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 父母經常告訴孩子們[不要計算小雞]，當涉及到期待的禮物時。

synonyms: don’t assume too much too soon

word: don’t throw the baby out with the bathwater

meanings.meaning_en_US: Don't discard something valuable along with the unnecessary.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要與不必要的東西一起扔掉有價值的東西。

examples.sentence: In her criticisms, she accidentally [threw the baby out with the bathwater].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的批評中，她不小心[把嬰兒和洗澡水一起扔了]。

examples.sentence: When restructuring, management should ensure they don't [throw the baby out with the bathwater].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在重組過程中，管理層應確保他們不會[把嬰兒和洗澡水一起扔了]。

examples.sentence: It's important when making adjustments to processes that you don't [throw the baby out with the bathwater].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在調整流程時重要的是，不要[把嬰兒和洗澡水一起扔了]。

synonyms: preserve what’s valuable in the process

word: the grass is always greener on the other side

meanings.meaning_en_US: People often believe that others' situations are better than their own.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 人們常常認為別人的情況比自己的要好。
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 好事不會發生在別人身上

examples.sentence: She thought her neighbor's life was perfect, believing [the grass is always greener].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她認為她鄰居的生活完美無瑕，認為[別處的草總是更綠]。

examples.sentence: He realized that [the grass is always greener] after visiting friends in another city.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在拜訪朋友後，他意識到[別處的草總是更綠]。

examples.sentence: In his quest for a new job, he forgot that [the grass is always greener] could be an illusion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在尋找新工作的過程中，他忘了[別處的草總是更綠]可能是幻想。

word: you can’t make an omelet without breaking eggs

meanings.meaning_en_US: You cannot achieve something valuable without making sacrifices.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 想要得到有價值的東西就不能不做出犧牲。

examples.sentence: To reach his goals, he understood that [you can't make an omelet] without hard work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了達到他的目標，他明白[你不能做出煎蛋卷]而不努力。

examples.sentence: In negotiations, [you can't make an omelet] requires some compromises.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在談判中，[你不能做出煎蛋卷]需要一些妥協。

examples.sentence: He learned that [you can't make an omelet] and that means mistakes are part of the process.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他明白了[你不能做出煎蛋卷]，這意味著錯誤是過程的一部分。

word: an ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure

meanings.meaning_en_US: Taking preventive measures is less costly than dealing with problems later.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 採取預防措施的成本低於事後解決問題的成本。

examples.sentence: Regular check-ups demonstrate that [an ounce of prevention] is true in healthcare.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 定期檢查證明了在醫療上[預防的分量]是正確的。

examples.sentence: Investing time in planning shows [an ounce of prevention] can save money later.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 花時間制定計畫表明[預防的分量]可以節省未來的開支。

examples.sentence: He emphasizes that [an ounce of prevention] prevents expensive mistakes in business.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他強調[預防的分量]能防止商業上的高昂錯誤。

word: keep your friends close and your enemies closer

meanings.meaning_en_US: It is wise to stay aware of what your enemies are doing.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保持對敵人動作的警覺是明智的。

examples.sentence: By keeping his rivals monitored, he believed [to keep his friends close] was the key.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過密切關注對手，他相信[讓朋友靠近]是成功的關鍵。

examples.sentence: The strategist advised [to keep enemies closer] in competitive environments.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 策士建議在競爭環境中[敵人應更親近]。

examples.sentence: He realized that [keeping enemies closer] gives insight into their tactics.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他意識到[拉近敵人距離]能提供他們的策略洞察。

word: never put off until tomorrow what you can do today

meanings.meaning_en_US: Do not delay tasks that can be completed now.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要延遲可以現在完成的任務。

examples.sentence: By following the advice [never put off until tomorrow], he improved his productivity.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過遵從[不要拖延到明天]的建議，他提升了生產率。

examples.sentence: She learned [never put off until tomorrow] leads to stress and missed deadlines.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她了解到[不要拖延到明天]會導致壓力和錯過截止日期。

examples.sentence: In his life, [never put off until tomorrow] became his motto for better organization.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在他的生活中，[不要拖延到明天]成為他更好組織的座右銘。

word: if you can’t stand the heat, get out of the kitchen

meanings.meaning_en_US: If you cannot cope with the pressures of a situation, then you should leave it.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 如果你無法應對壓力，那就應該離開這個情況。

examples.sentence: When faced with criticism, he realized that [if you can't stand the heat] should reconsider his role.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 面對批評時，他意識到[如果你無法承受壓力]應該重新考慮他的角色。

examples.sentence: Her boss warned her [if you can't stand the heat] may need to find a less stressful job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的老板警告她[如果你無法承受壓力]，可能需要找一份壓力更小的工作。

examples.sentence: In competitive sports, [if you can't stand the heat] should know what they signed up for.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在競技運動中，[如果你無法承受壓力]應該知道自己簽的合同。

synonyms: if you can't take the pressure, leave

word: you can’t make an omelet without breaking a few eggs

meanings.meaning_en_US: You cannot achieve something worthwhile without encountering some difficulties.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 想要達到有價值的目標，就必須面對一些困難。

examples.sentence: He learned that [you can't make an omelet] when investing always involves risks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他了解到[你不能做出煎蛋卷]，因為投資總是涉及風險。

examples.sentence: In learning new skills, [you can't make an omelet] is a tough lesson for beginners.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在學習新技能時，[你不能做出煎蛋卷]是初學者的一個艱難的教訓。

examples.sentence: His success in life proved [you can't make an omelet] often means making sacrifices.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的人生成功證明了[你不能做出煎蛋卷]通常意味著需要做出犧牲。

word: fool me once, shame on you; fool me twice, shame on me

meanings.meaning_en_US: If someone tricks you once, it's their fault, but if it happens twice, it's your fault.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 如果有人騙你一次，那是他們的錯，但如果再騙你一次，那是你的錯。

examples.sentence: After being scammed, he realized [fool me once] and resolved not to fall for it again.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在被騙之後，他意識到[fool me once]並決定不再上當。

examples.sentence: She warned him, saying, [fool me once] and you won't get a second chance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她警告他說，[fool me once]你不會再有第二次機會。

examples.sentence: He often reminded himself, [fool me once] but won't let it happen again.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他經常提醒自己，[fool me once]但不會讓它再次發生。

word: people who live in glass houses shouldn’t throw stones

meanings.meaning_en_US: Those who are vulnerable to criticism should not criticize others.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 那些容易受到批評的人不應該批評他人。

examples.sentence: After failing at her own task, she realized that [people who live in glass houses] should take it easy on others.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在自己的任務中失敗之後，她意識到[住在玻璃屋裡的人]應該對他人包容些。

examples.sentence: He learned [people who live in glass houses] criticism should be restrained.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他了解到[住在玻璃屋裡的人]的批評應該受到限制。

examples.sentence: Thinking about it, [people who live in glass houses] can end up hurting themselves if too harsh.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 仔細思考後，[住在玻璃屋裡的人]如果太苛刻最終會傷害自己。

word: you can lead a horse to water, but you can’t make it drink

meanings.meaning_en_US: You can provide opportunities or guidance, but you cannot force someone to take action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 你可以提供機會或指導，但你不能強迫某人採取行動。

examples.sentence: Despite his coaching, he realized that [you can lead a horse to water] during the match.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管他給予指導，他在比賽中意識到[你可以帶馬去水邊]。

examples.sentence: The teacher observed, [you can lead a horse to water] but students must learn themselves.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 老師觀察到[你可以帶馬去水邊]但學生必須自己學會。

examples.sentence: Through her advice, she understood that [you can lead a horse to water] during the process.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 通過她的建議，她明白[你可以帶馬去水邊]的過程。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Most importantly; more than anything else.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 最重要的是；比任何事都重要的

examples.sentence: Above all, we must stay united.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最重要的是，我們必須團結一致。

examples.sentence: She values honesty above all.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她最重視誠信。

examples.sentence: Above all, take care of yourself.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最重要的是，照顧好自己。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Not understood or beyond one’s comprehension.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 無法理解或超出某人的 comprehension 範圍

examples.sentence: The concept flew above his head.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個概念對他來說毫無意義。

examples.sentence: Her explanation went above their heads.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的解釋讓他們感到困惑。

examples.sentence: The professor's lecture was above my head.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 教授的講座我無法理解。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To go somewhere with someone or to have something occur at the same time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 與某人一起去某地或同時發生

examples.sentence: She decided to accompany him to the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定陪他去參加活動。

examples.sentence: The melody was accompanied by a beautiful harmony.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 旋律伴隨著美麗的和聲。

examples.sentence: They were accompanied by their parents on the trip.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在旅行中有父母陪伴。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Familiar with something through experience.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 因經驗而熟悉某事

examples.sentence: I am accustomed to the cold weather.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我已經習慣冷天氣。

examples.sentence: She is accustomed to waking up early.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她習慣早起。

examples.sentence: They are accustomed to working long hours.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們習慣於長時間工作。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Including other things or people.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 包括其他事物或人

examples.sentence: She received support from her friends among others.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她得到了朋友等人的支持。

examples.sentence: Among others, he spoke about climate change.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他談到了氣候變化等問題。

examples.sentence: The team won several awards among others.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該團隊獲得了幾個獎項等。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a serious or urgent request.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 提出嚴肅或緊急的請求

examples.sentence: He decided to appeal to the manager for help.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定向經理提出請求以獲得幫助。

examples.sentence: They appealed to the public for support.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們向公眾提出請求以獲得支持。

examples.sentence: The charity appeals to our sense of compassion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個慈善機構藉由激發我們的同情心來提出請求。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have a favorable opinion of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某事持贊同的看法

examples.sentence: My parents approve of my decision to study abroad.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我的父母贊同我出國留學的決定。

examples.sentence: She doesn't approve of that behavior.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她不認同那種行為。

examples.sentence: The committee approved of the project proposal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 委員會同意該專案提案。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Consequently; as a consequence of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 因此；作為某事的結果

examples.sentence: It rained heavily; as a result, the game was canceled.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 下了大雨，因此比賽被取消了。

examples.sentence: She studied hard; as a result, she passed the exam.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她努力學習，因此通過了考試。

examples.sentence: He missed the bus; as a result, he was late for work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他錯過了公車，結果遲到了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Due to; because of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 由於；因為某事

examples.sentence: The flight was delayed as a result of bad weather.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為天氣惡劣，航班被延誤。

examples.sentence: He resigned as a result of the pressure.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他因壓力辭職。

examples.sentence: As a result of her hard work, she received a promotion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為她的努力工作，她獲得了升遷。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Regarding or concerning something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 關於或涉及某事

examples.sentence: As for my opinion, I believe we should wait.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 至於我的看法，我認為我們應該等。

examples.sentence: As for the meeting, it will be held on Friday.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 關於會議，它將於星期五舉行。

examples.sentence: As for your question, I need more time to think.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 至於你的問題，我需要更多時間來思考。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Apart from; besides.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 除了；此外

examples.sentence: Aside from the price, I think it's a good deal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 除了價格，我認為這是一個好交易。

examples.sentence: Aside from her singing, she also dances beautifully.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 除了她唱歌外，她的舞蹈也很美。

examples.sentence: Aside from this issue, everything else is fine.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 除了這個問題，其他一切都很好。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Based on what is visible or evident.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 根據可見的或顯而易見的事情

examples.sentence: As it appears, he was not involved in the incident.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 看來他並未參與事件。

examples.sentence: The project is successful, as it appears.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該專案成功，看來。

examples.sentence: As it appears, the weather will improve.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 看來天氣會好轉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: According to what is commonly accepted or known.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 根據常見的認知或知識

examples.sentence: As the saying goes, time is money.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 俗話說，時間就是金錢。

examples.sentence: As it is often said, practice makes perfect.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 常常說，熟能生巧。

examples.sentence: As the story goes, there was once a great hero.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 據說，有一位偉大的英雄。

meanings.meaning_en_US: At the moment when; without delay.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在某一時刻；不延遲

examples.sentence: I'll call you as soon as I arrive.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我一到就會打給你。

examples.sentence: As soon as the bell rings, we can leave.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一響鐘聲，我們就可以離開。

examples.sentence: Please start the project as soon as possible.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請儘快開始專案。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In the same way as is normal or habitual.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 以正常或習慣的方式

examples.sentence: She arrived late as usual.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她照舊遲到了。

examples.sentence: As usual, he forgot his keys.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他像往常一樣忘了帶鑰匙。

examples.sentence: They went to the same restaurant as usual.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們去了同一家餐廳，如同往常。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In addition to; also.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 除了；也

examples.sentence: She sings beautifully as well as plays the piano.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她除了唱得很好外還能彈鋼琴。

examples.sentence: He is talented as well as hardworking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他既有才華又努力工作。

examples.sentence: We should focus on quality as well as quantity.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們應該關注質量和數量。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Regardless of the cost or risk involved.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 無論涉賠償或風險

examples.sentence: We must win this game at any cost.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 無論如何我們必須贏得比賽。

examples.sentence: I want to finish my project at any cost.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想不惜一切地完成我的專案。

examples.sentence: At any cost, he aims to achieve his dreams.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不惜一切，他旨在實現他的理想。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Under the most favorable conditions.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在最有利的條件下

examples.sentence: At best, we can arrive in two hours.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在最好的情況下，我們可能兩小時內抵達。

examples.sentence: The project will, at best, be completed next month.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該專專案在最好的情況下將於下個月完成。

examples.sentence: At best, I can help for an hour.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在最好的情況下，我只能幫忙一個小時。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Responsible for a mistake or a problem.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對錯誤或問題負責

examples.sentence: He is at fault for the accident.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對這起事故負責任。

examples.sentence: The company is at fault for the data breach.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 公司對數據洩露負責。

examples.sentence: If the process fails, I will be at fault.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果這個過程失敗，我將承擔責任。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Generally; in the broader context.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 一般來說；在更廣泛的背景下

examples.sentence: The community, at large, supports the initiative.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 整體社區支持這項倡議。

examples.sentence: The problem exists, at large, in many cities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 很多城市普遍存在這個問題。

examples.sentence: At large, the economy is recovering.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 整體經濟正在恢復。

meanings.meaning_en_US: No more than; at the maximum.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 最多；最大

examples.sentence: You will need at most three tickets.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 您最多只需三張票。

examples.sentence: This job should take at most two hours.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這份工作最多應花兩個小時。

examples.sentence: At most, only ten people can enter the room.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最多只能有十個人進入房間。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Simultaneously; without delay.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 同時；不延遲

examples.sentence: You can’t be in two places at the same time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不能同時在兩個地方。

examples.sentence: They sang and danced at the same time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們同時唱和跳。

examples.sentence: Please submit your reports at the same time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請同時提交報告。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To fight or struggle to obtain something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 為了獲得某物進行戰鬥或奮鬥

examples.sentence: They battle for control of the territory.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們為控制這片領土而戰。

examples.sentence: She is battling for her rights.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她正在為自己的權利而戰。

examples.sentence: The teams are battling for the championship title.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 各隊正在爭奪冠軍頭銜。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become involved in something, often unexpectedly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 意外地捲入某事

examples.sentence: He was caught in a storm on his way home.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在回家的路上被捲入了一場暴風雨。

examples.sentence: She got caught in the middle of the argument.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她無意中捲入了爭論。

examples.sentence: They were caught in traffic due to an accident.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因事故他們被困在交通中。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become very involved in something; often to the exclusion of other things.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 深陷於某事，通常忽視其他事物

examples.sentence: She got caught up in her work and forgot to eat.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她忙於工作，以至於忘了吃飯。

examples.sentence: He was caught up in the excitement of the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他被這個活動的興奮所吸引。

examples.sentence: Don't get caught up in rumors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要被謠言所纏住。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have an urgent desire to have or do something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 急切渴望擁有或做某事

examples.sentence: I am dying for a piece of chocolate cake.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我急切想要一塊巧克力蛋糕。

examples.sentence: She’s dying for a vacation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她急需一次假期。

examples.sentence: He's dying for some music.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他急於想聽音樂。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be so involved in something that one becomes unaware of one's surroundings.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 因為沈迷某事而無視四周

examples.sentence: He was lost in thought during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議中，他沉浸在思考中。

examples.sentence: She often gets lost in her books.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她經常沉浸在書本中。

examples.sentence: They were lost in the music at the concert.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在音樂會中陶醉於音樂中。

meanings.meaning_en_US: No longer accessible or relevant; forgotten.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不再可及或相關；被遺忘

examples.sentence: His contributions were lost to history.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的貢獻被歷史所遺忘。

examples.sentence: Her talents were lost to the world.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的才能被世界遺忘。

examples.sentence: Much of the detail was lost to time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多細節被時間所遺忘。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be given something, especially a gift or an opportunity.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 接受某物，特別是禮物或機會

examples.sentence: She was presented with an award for her hard work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她因為努力工作而被頒獎。

examples.sentence: He was presented with a unique opportunity to travel.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他獲得了一次獨特的旅行機會。

examples.sentence: The students were presented with certificates at graduation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 學生在畢業典禮上獲發證書。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To receive or be supplied with something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 接受或提供某物

examples.sentence: You will be provided with all the necessary materials.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 您將獲得所有必要的材料。

examples.sentence: Each participant was provided with a handbook.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每位參與者都獲得了一本手冊。

examples.sentence: They will be provided with accommodation during the conference.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 會議期間將提供住宿。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be related to or connected with something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 與某事相關或有關

examples.sentence: This issue is to do with our budget.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個問題與我們的預算有關。

examples.sentence: Her success is to do with hard work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的成功與努力工作有關。

examples.sentence: The delays are to do with the weather.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 延遲與天氣有關。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Having been given something beneficial or fortunate.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 擁有某物有益或幸運

examples.sentence: She is blessed with a wonderful family.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她擁有一個美好的家庭。

examples.sentence: He feels blessed with good health.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他感到擁有良好的健康是幸運的。

examples.sentence: They were blessed with opportunities to travel.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們得到了旅行的機會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become very angry.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得非常生氣

examples.sentence: He blew his top when he heard the news.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他得知這個消息時，他勃然大怒。

examples.sentence: She blows her top over minor mistakes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她對小錯誤非常生氣。

examples.sentence: They lost their job and blew their top.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們失去工作而勃然大怒。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To fail to keep a promise.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 無法遵守承諾

examples.sentence: He broke his word about helping me.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他沒有遵守幫助我的承諾。

examples.sentence: She never breaks her word.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她從不食言。

examples.sentence: Breaking my word is not something I do easily.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 毀約不是我輕易做的事情。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To end a romantic relationship.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 結束一段浪漫的關係

examples.sentence: She decided to break up with him.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定和他分手。

examples.sentence: After years together, they broke up.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過多年的相處，他們分開了。

examples.sentence: He was heartbroken when she broke up with him.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她和他分手時，他心碎了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stop being involved with someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 停止和某人或某事有關

examples.sentence: He decided to break with his old friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定和老朋友分道揚鑣。

examples.sentence: She broke with the company after many years.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在多年後與公司分開。

examples.sentence: They chose to break with the traditional methods.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們選擇放棄傳統方法。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To cause something to happen or to produce something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某事發生或產生某物

examples.sentence: The study aims to bring forth new solutions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這項研究旨在提出新解決方案。

examples.sentence: Innovations bring forth changes in society.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 創新為社會帶來變革。

examples.sentence: They brought forth evidence to support their claim.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們提供證據來支持他們的主張。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To successfully carry out or achieve something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 成功地進行或實現某事

examples.sentence: She managed to bring off the performance successfully.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她成功地完成了演出。

examples.sentence: Bringing off this project will take teamwork.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 成功完成這項工作需要團隊合作。

examples.sentence: He brought off the surprise party without a hitch.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他順利地舉辦了驚喜派對。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make something known or to show something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某事為人所知或展示某事

examples.sentence: The movie brings out important social issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這部電影揭示了重要的社會問題。

examples.sentence: This song brings out her best qualities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這首歌展現了她最好的一面。

examples.sentence: Bringing out the truth was hard for everyone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對每個人來說，揭示真相是困難的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To meet someone unexpectedly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 意外見到某人

examples.sentence: I bumped into an old friend at the store.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我在商店裡碰到了老朋友。

examples.sentence: We bumped into each other on the way to work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在上班的路上不期而遇。

examples.sentence: He bumped into his teacher after class.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在下課後遇到了老師。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Absolutely; certainly; without hesitation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 絕對；肯定；毫不猶豫地

examples.sentence: If you need help, [by all means] ask me.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你需要幫助，[毫不猶豫]地問我。

examples.sentence: You can [by all means] join us for dinner.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你[絕對]可以和我們一起吃晚餐。

examples.sentence: [By all means], take some vacation time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: [毫不猶豫]，請休假。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In comparison with something else.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 與其他事物相比

examples.sentence: The first movie was dull; [by contrast], the sequel was exciting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 第一部電影很無聊；[相比之下]，續集很刺激。

examples.sentence: Her approach was very practical; [by contrast], his was theoretical.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的方式非常實用；[相對而言]，他的則是理論性的。

examples.sentence: The weather was terrible; [by contrast], the next day was sunny.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 天氣很糟；[相比之下]，第二天陽光燦爛。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Using the hands rather than a machine.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用手而非機器

examples.sentence: This project was crafted [by hand].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個項目是[用手]製作的。

examples.sentence: She prefers to write letters [by hand].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她喜歡[用手]寫信。

examples.sentence: All of these items are made [by hand].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 所有這些物品都是[用手]製作的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Not at all; in no way.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 絕不；毫不

examples.sentence: This is [by no means] the final decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這[絕不是]最終決定。

examples.sentence: [By no means] should you take this lightly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: [絕不]應該輕視這件事。

examples.sentence: The task is [by no means] easy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這項任務[絕不]簡單。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To stop off at a place, usually briefly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通常短暫地停留在一個地方

examples.sentence: We will [call at] the store before heading home.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在回家之前會[順便停留]商店。

examples.sentence: He might [call at] my office tomorrow.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他可能明天會[順便停留]我的辦公室。

examples.sentence: They [called at] several houses during their walk.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在散步時[停留]幾個房子。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To reprimand or criticize someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 責備或批評某人

examples.sentence: The teacher [called down] the student for being late.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 老師因為學生遲到而[責備]他。

examples.sentence: She tends to [call down] her team when they make mistakes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她傾向於當團隊犯錯時[責備]他們。

examples.sentence: He was [called down] for his inappropriate comments.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他因為不當言論而被[責備]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To bring something into being or action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某事物成為現實或行動

examples.sentence: The situation may [call forth] new strategies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這情況可能[促使]新策略的出現。

examples.sentence: Her speech [called forth] a strong reaction.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的演講[引起]了強烈反應。

examples.sentence: The crisis will [call forth] leaders to take action.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 危機將[催生]領導者採取行動。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make someone notice or focus on something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 使某人注意或專注於某事

examples.sentence: I would like to [call your attention] to this matter.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想[讓你注意]這件事情。

examples.sentence: Please [call my attention] when the meeting starts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請在會議開始時[引起我的注意]。

examples.sentence: He [called my attention] to the error in the report.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他[讓我注意]報告中的錯誤。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have a concern or interest in someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某人或某事有關注或興趣

examples.sentence: Do you [care about] the environment?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你[在乎]環境嗎？

examples.sentence: She really [cares about] her friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她真的[關心]她的朋友。

examples.sentence: He doesn't [care about] his grades.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他[不在乎]他的成績。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be inclined to do something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 傾向於做某事

examples.sentence: Do you [care to] join us for dinner?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你[想]和我們一起吃晚餐嗎？

examples.sentence: She [cares to] help with the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她[願意]幫助這個項目。

examples.sentence: He doesn't [care to] elaborate on that.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他[不想]詳述那一點。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To complete or accomplish despite difficulties.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 儘管困難而完成或實現

examples.sentence: They managed to [carry through] the plan.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們成功地[完成了]這個計劃。

examples.sentence: She [carried through] her responsibilities despite the challenges.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管有挑戰，她[堅持完成]她的責任。

examples.sentence: It won't be easy, but we must [carry through].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這不會容易，但我們必須[堅持下去]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become ill with a common viral infection.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感染常見病毒而生病

examples.sentence: I think I might [catch a cold] this weekend.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想我這個週末可能會[感冒]。

examples.sentence: She always [catches a cold] in winter.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是冬天[感冒]。

examples.sentence: He caught a cold after being out in the rain.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在雨中待久了[感冒]了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To grasp, obtain, or find something or someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 抓住、獲得或找到某物或某人

examples.sentence: Can you [catch hold of] that idea for me?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能幫我[抓住]那個想法嗎？

examples.sentence: I need to [get hold of] you before the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議之前，我需要[聯繫]你。

examples.sentence: Have you [caught hold of] the latest news?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你[得到]最新消息了嗎？

meanings.meaning_en_US: To grasp or seize something firmly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 牢牢抓住或握住某物

examples.sentence: He tried to [catch hold of] the railing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他試著抓住欄杆。

examples.sentence: Make sure to [catch hold of] the rope tightly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保[牢牢抓住]繩子。

examples.sentence: I couldn't [catch hold of] my thoughts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我無法[抓住]我的思緒。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To pause briefly to regain breath, usually after exertion.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通常在運動後短暫暫停以恢復呼吸

examples.sentence: After running, I need to [catch my breath].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 跑步後，我需要[喘口氣]。

examples.sentence: He stopped to [catch his breath] after the climb.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在攀爬後停下來[喘口氣]。

examples.sentence: Take a moment to [catch your breath].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 花點時間[喘口氣]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To suddenly see or notice something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 突然看到或注意到某事

examples.sentence: Did you [catch sight of] her at the event?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你在活動中[看見]她了嗎？

examples.sentence: I finally [caught sight of] the deer in the forest.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我終於在森林裡[看見]了鹿。

examples.sentence: He hopes to [catch sight of] the sunrise tomorrow.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他希望明天[目睹]日出。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To reach someone who is ahead in progress or distance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 追趕上在進度或距離上走在前面的人

examples.sentence: I need to [catch up with] my studies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我需要[趕上]我的學業。

examples.sentence: They were able to [catch up with] the race.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們能夠[趕上]比賽。

examples.sentence: We need to [catch up with] our friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要[追上]我們的朋友。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To tidy or organize something after it has been used.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在使用後整理或清理某物

examples.sentence: You should [clean up after] the party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該[收拾]派對後的東西。

examples.sentence: I always [clean up after] my kids.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我總是[收拾]我的孩子們的東西。

examples.sentence: Don't forget to [clean up after] cooking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要忘記[整理]做飯之後的東西。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Near in space or time; not far away.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在空間或時間上很近；不遠處

examples.sentence: The store is [close to] my house.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那家商店[靠近]我的家。

examples.sentence: Our meeting is [close to] lunchtime.
examples.translation_zh_TW: [接近]午餐時間我們的會議。

examples.sentence: Is she [close to] finishing her project?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她[快要]完成她的專案了嗎？

meanings.meaning_en_US: To follow in succession or time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在順序或時間上跟隨

examples.sentence: The announcement will [come after] the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 公告將在會議後[出現]。

examples.sentence: She will [come after] her sister at the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在活動中她將[跟隨]她的妹妹。

examples.sentence: What comes [after] this chapter?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這一章之後[會是]什麼？

meanings.meaning_en_US: To criticize or reprimand someone harshly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 對某人嚴厲批評或責備

examples.sentence: The manager [came down on] the employee for missing the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經理對錯過截止日期的員工[責備]。

examples.sentence: The coach [came down on] the players for their poor performance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 教練對球員的表現不佳[責備]他們。

examples.sentence: She [came down on] her brother for being late.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她因為弟弟遲到而[責備]他。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To emerge or appear.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 出現或出現

examples.sentence: New ideas [came forth] during the discussion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在討論中出現了新想法。

examples.sentence: The truth will [come forth] eventually.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 真相最終[會浮現]。

examples.sentence: She always [comes forth] with creative solutions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是提供創造性解決方案。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To receive something, typically criticism or praise.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 通常得到某物，特別是批評或讚美

examples.sentence: The movie [came in for] a lot of criticism.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這部電影[遭到了]許多批評。

examples.sentence: He always [comes in for] praise for his hard work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是因為辛勤工作[受到]讚賞。

examples.sentence: They [came in for] scrutiny after the scandal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在醜聞之後，他們[遭受了]審查。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To occur to someone as a thought or idea.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 作為思想或想法發生在某人腦海中

examples.sentence: A great idea [came into my head] during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在會議中，一個好想法[出現在我的腦海中]。

examples.sentence: Did a specific thought [come into your head] at that moment?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在那一刻，是否有個特定的想法[進入你的腦海]？

examples.sentence: Something unexpected [came into their heads].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一些意想不到的事情[在他們的腦海中出現]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To result or happen as a consequence.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 作為結果或後果發生

examples.sentence: There’s no telling what will [come of] this project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 沒人知道這個項目[會得到什麼結果]。

examples.sentence: What [came of] his efforts?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的努力[得到了什麼結果]？

examples.sentence: She wonders what will [come of] their friendship.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她想知道他們的友誼[會怎麼樣]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To express opposition to something publicly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 公開表達對某事的反對

examples.sentence: Several politicians [came out against] the new law.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 幾位政治家[公開反對]這項新法律。

examples.sentence: He [came out against] the proposed changes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他[公開反對]這些提議的變化。

examples.sentence: The organization [came out against] the policy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該組織[公開反對]該政策。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To conclude or finish.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 結束或完成

examples.sentence: The show will [come to an end] next week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個節目將在下週[結束]。

examples.sentence: The agreement finally [came to an end].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 協議最終[結束]。

examples.sentence: When will the war [come to an end]?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 戰爭將在何時[結束]？

meanings.meaning_en_US: To regain consciousness or awareness.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 恢復意識或自我覺察

examples.sentence: He took a moment to [come to himself] after the shock.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在震驚後，他花了點時間[恢復意識]。

examples.sentence: She had to [come to herself] before making a decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在做決定之前，她必須[恢復意識]。

examples.sentence: It took him a while to [come to himself] after the fall.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 摔倒後，他花了一段時間[恢復意識]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become a reality; to materialize.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 成為現實；實現

examples.sentence: Her dreams eventually [came true].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的夢想最終[實現]了。

examples.sentence: The proposal [came true] after much discussion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這項提案經過多次討論後[變成現實]。

examples.sentence: I hope my wishes [come true] this year.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我希望我的願望在今年[實現]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To encounter or discover by chance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 偶然遇到或發現

examples.sentence: I [came upon] an old friend while walking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我在散步時[偶然遇到]了一位老朋友。

examples.sentence: They [came upon] a beautiful scene during their hike.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在健行時[偶然發現]了一個美麗的景色。

examples.sentence: She often [comes upon] interesting books at the library.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她經常在圖書館[發現]有趣的書籍。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To approach or reach someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 接近或到達某人或某物

examples.sentence: Please [come up to] the front of the class.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請[走到]班級的前面。

examples.sentence: He [came up to] me and introduced himself.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他[走到]我面前自我介紹。

examples.sentence: They always [come up to] the challenges head-on.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們總是[面對]挑戰。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To vie or contend with someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 與某人或某物競爭

examples.sentence: They will [compete against] each other in the tournament.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們將在比賽中[互相競爭]。

examples.sentence: Our team will [compete against] the champions next week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們的團隊下週將[與]冠軍隊伍[競爭]。

examples.sentence: You need to [compete against] your fears.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要[和你的恐懼競爭]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To seek to win or achieve something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 尋求贏得或實現某物

examples.sentence: We are [competing for] the championship this year.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們今年正在[爭奪]冠軍。

examples.sentence: Many students [compete for] scholarships each year.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每年許多學生正在[爭取]獎學金。

examples.sentence: He wants to [compete for] the top position.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他想[爭取]最高的位置。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be made up or formed from particular parts.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 由特定部分組成或形成

examples.sentence: The committee is [composed of] various experts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該委員會是由不同的專家[組成]的。

examples.sentence: The team is [composed of] five members.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這支隊伍由五名成員[組成]。

examples.sentence: These materials are [composed of] recyclable elements.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這些材料是由可回收的元素[構成]。

meanings.meaning_en_US: In opposition to; in disagreement with.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 與…相反；不同意

examples.sentence: Contrary to popular belief, the Earth is not flat.
